1 
  2 (function(window, undefined) {
  3 	
  4 	var _VERSION_ = '0.25';
  5 	// also update /RiTaLibraryJS/www/download/index.html (TODO: should be automatic)
  6 
  7 	/**  @private Simple type-checking functions */ 
  8 	var Type = {
  9 		
 10 		N : 'number', S : 'string', O : 'object', A :'array', B : 'boolean', R : 'regexp', F : 'function',
 11 		
 12 		/**
 13 		 * From: http://javascriptweblog.wordpress.com/2011/08/08/fixing-the-javascript-typeof-operator/
 14 		 */
 15 		get : function(obj) {
 16 			
 17 			return ({}).toString.call(obj).match(/\s([a-zA-Z]+)/)[1].toLowerCase();
 18 		},
 19 		
 20 		/**
 21 		 * Returns true if the object is of type 'type', otherwise false
 22 		 */
 23 		is : function(obj,type) {
 24 			
 25 			return Type.get(obj) === type;
 26 		},
 27 		
 28 		/**
 29 		 * Throws TypeError if not the correct type, else returns true
 30 		 */
 31 		ok : function(obj,type) {
 32 			
 33 			if (Type.get(obj)!=type) {
 34 				
 35 				throw TypeError('Expected '+(type ? type.toUpperCase() : type+E) + ", received "+(obj ? Type.get(obj).toUpperCase() : obj+E));
 36 			}
 37 			
 38 			return true;
 39 		}
 40 		
 41 	}; // end Type
 42 	
 43 	var is = Type.is, ok = Type.ok; // alias
 44 
 45 	var Easing = {
 46 	
 47 		Linear: {
 48 	
 49 			None: function ( k ) {
 50 	
 51 				return k;
 52 	
 53 			}
 54 	
 55 		},
 56 	
 57 		Quadratic: {
 58 	
 59 			In: function ( k ) {
 60 	
 61 				return k * k;
 62 	
 63 			},
 64 	
 65 			Out: function ( k ) {
 66 	
 67 				return k * ( 2 - k );
 68 	
 69 			},
 70 	
 71 			InOut: function ( k ) {
 72 	
 73 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1 ) return 0.5 * k * k;
 74 				return - 0.5 * ( --k * ( k - 2 ) - 1 );
 75 	
 76 			}
 77 	
 78 		},
 79 	
 80 		Cubic: {
 81 	
 82 			In: function ( k ) {
 83 	
 84 				return k * k * k;
 85 	
 86 			},
 87 	
 88 			Out: function ( k ) {
 89 	
 90 				return --k * k * k + 1;
 91 	
 92 			},
 93 	
 94 			InOut: function ( k ) {
 95 	
 96 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1 ) return 0.5 * k * k * k;
 97 				return 0.5 * ( ( k -= 2 ) * k * k + 2 );
 98 	
 99 			}
100 	
101 		},
102 	
103 		Quartic: {
104 	
105 			In: function ( k ) {
106 	
107 				return k * k * k * k;
108 	
109 			},
110 	
111 			Out: function ( k ) {
112 	
113 				return 1 - (--k) * k * k * k;
114 	
115 			},
116 	
117 			InOut: function ( k ) {
118 	
119 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1) return 0.5 * k * k * k * k;
120 				return - 0.5 * ( ( k -= 2 ) * k * k * k - 2 );
121 	
122 			}
123 	
124 		},
125 	
126 		Quintic: {
127 	
128 			In: function ( k ) {
129 	
130 				return k * k * k * k * k;
131 	
132 			},
133 	
134 			Out: function ( k ) {
135 	
136 				return --k * k * k * k * k + 1;
137 	
138 			},
139 	
140 			InOut: function ( k ) {
141 	
142 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1 ) return 0.5 * k * k * k * k * k;
143 				return 0.5 * ( ( k -= 2 ) * k * k * k * k + 2 );
144 	
145 			}
146 	
147 		},
148 	
149 		Sinusoidal: {
150 	
151 			In: function ( k ) {
152 	
153 				return 1 - Math.cos( k * Math.PI / 2 );
154 	
155 			},
156 	
157 			Out: function ( k ) {
158 	
159 				return Math.sin( k * Math.PI / 2 );
160 	
161 			},
162 	
163 			InOut: function ( k ) {
164 	
165 				return 0.5 * ( 1 - Math.cos( Math.PI * k ) );
166 	
167 			}
168 	
169 		},
170 	
171 		Exponential: {
172 	
173 			In: function ( k ) {
174 	
175 				return k === 0 ? 0 : Math.pow( 1024, k - 1 );
176 	
177 			},
178 	
179 			Out: function ( k ) {
180 	
181 				return k === 1 ? 1 : 1 - Math.pow( 2, - 10 * k );
182 	
183 			},
184 	
185 			InOut: function ( k ) {
186 	
187 				if ( k === 0 ) return 0;
188 				if ( k === 1 ) return 1;
189 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1 ) return 0.5 * Math.pow( 1024, k - 1 );
190 				return 0.5 * ( - Math.pow( 2, - 10 * ( k - 1 ) ) + 2 );
191 	
192 			}
193 	
194 		},
195 	
196 		Circular: {
197 	
198 			In: function ( k ) {
199 	
200 				return 1 - Math.sqrt( 1 - k * k );
201 	
202 			},
203 	
204 			Out: function ( k ) {
205 	
206 				return Math.sqrt( 1 - (--k) * k );
207 	
208 			},
209 	
210 			InOut: function ( k ) {
211 	
212 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1) return - 0.5 * ( Math.sqrt( 1 - k * k) - 1);
213 				return 0.5 * ( Math.sqrt( 1 - ( k -= 2) * k) + 1);
214 	
215 			}
216 	
217 		},
218 	
219 		Elastic: {
220 	
221 			In: function ( k ) {
222 	
223 				var s, a = 0.1, p = 0.4;
224 				if ( k === 0 ) return 0;
225 				if ( k === 1 ) return 1;
226 				if ( !a || a < 1 ) { a = 1; s = p / 4; }
227 				else s = p * Math.asin( 1 / a ) / ( 2 * Math.PI );
228 				return - ( a * Math.pow( 2, 10 * ( k -= 1 ) ) * Math.sin( ( k - s ) * ( 2 * Math.PI ) / p ) );
229 	
230 			},
231 	
232 			Out: function ( k ) {
233 	
234 				var s, a = 0.1, p = 0.4;
235 				if ( k === 0 ) return 0;
236 				if ( k === 1 ) return 1;
237 				if ( !a || a < 1 ) { a = 1; s = p / 4; }
238 				else s = p * Math.asin( 1 / a ) / ( 2 * Math.PI );
239 				return ( a * Math.pow( 2, - 10 * k) * Math.sin( ( k - s ) * ( 2 * Math.PI ) / p ) + 1 );
240 	
241 			},
242 	
243 			InOut: function ( k ) {
244 	
245 				var s, a = 0.1, p = 0.4;
246 				if ( k === 0 ) return 0;
247 				if ( k === 1 ) return 1;
248 				if ( !a || a < 1 ) { a = 1; s = p / 4; }
249 				else s = p * Math.asin( 1 / a ) / ( 2 * Math.PI );
250 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1 ) return - 0.5 * ( a * Math.pow( 2, 10 * ( k -= 1 ) ) * Math.sin( ( k - s ) * ( 2 * Math.PI ) / p ) );
251 				return a * Math.pow( 2, -10 * ( k -= 1 ) ) * Math.sin( ( k - s ) * ( 2 * Math.PI ) / p ) * 0.5 + 1;
252 	
253 			}
254 	
255 		},
256 	
257 		Back: {
258 	
259 			In: function ( k ) {
260 	
261 				var s = 1.70158;
262 				return k * k * ( ( s + 1 ) * k - s );
263 	
264 			},
265 	
266 			Out: function ( k ) {
267 	
268 				var s = 1.70158;
269 				return --k * k * ( ( s + 1 ) * k + s ) + 1;
270 	
271 			},
272 	
273 			InOut: function ( k ) {
274 	
275 				var s = 1.70158 * 1.525;
276 				if ( ( k *= 2 ) < 1 ) return 0.5 * ( k * k * ( ( s + 1 ) * k - s ) );
277 				return 0.5 * ( ( k -= 2 ) * k * ( ( s + 1 ) * k + s ) + 2 );
278 	
279 			}
280 	
281 		},
282 	
283 		Bounce: {
284 	
285 			In: function ( k ) {
286 	
287 				return 1 - Easing.Bounce.Out( 1 - k );
288 	
289 			},
290 	
291 			Out: function ( k ) {
292 	
293 				if ( k < ( 1 / 2.75 ) ) {
294 	
295 					return 7.5625 * k * k;
296 	
297 				} else if ( k < ( 2 / 2.75 ) ) {
298 	
299 					return 7.5625 * ( k -= ( 1.5 / 2.75 ) ) * k + 0.75;
300 	
301 				} else if ( k < ( 2.5 / 2.75 ) ) {
302 	
303 					return 7.5625 * ( k -= ( 2.25 / 2.75 ) ) * k + 0.9375;
304 	
305 				} else {
306 	
307 					return 7.5625 * ( k -= ( 2.625 / 2.75 ) ) * k + 0.984375;
308 	
309 				}
310 	
311 			},
312 	
313 			InOut: function ( k ) {
314 	
315 				if ( k < 0.5 ) return Easing.Bounce.In( k * 2 ) * 0.5;
316 				return Easing.Bounce.Out( k * 2 - 1 ) * 0.5 + 0.5;
317 	
318 			}
319 		}
320 	};
321 
322 	var Interpolation = {
323 	
324 		Linear: function ( v, k ) {
325 	
326 			var m = v.length - 1, f = m * k, i = Math.floor( f ), fn = Interpolation.Utils.Linear;
327 	
328 			if ( k < 0 ) return fn( v[ 0 ], v[ 1 ], f );
329 			if ( k > 1 ) return fn( v[ m ], v[ m - 1 ], m - f );
330 	
331 			return fn( v[ i ], v[ i + 1 > m ? m : i + 1 ], f - i );
332 	
333 		},
334 	
335 		Bezier: function ( v, k ) {
336 	
337 			var b = 0, n = v.length - 1, pw = Math.pow, bn = Interpolation.Utils.Bernstein, i;
338 	
339 			for ( i = 0; i <= n; i++ ) {
340 				b += pw( 1 - k, n - i ) * pw( k, i ) * v[ i ] * bn( n, i );
341 			}
342 	
343 			return b;
344 	
345 		},
346 	
347 		CatmullRom: function ( v, k ) {
348 	
349 			var m = v.length - 1, f = m * k, i = Math.floor( f ), fn = Interpolation.Utils.CatmullRom;
350 	
351 			if ( v[ 0 ] === v[ m ] ) {
352 	
353 				if ( k < 0 ) i = Math.floor( f = m * ( 1 + k ) );
354 	
355 				return fn( v[ ( i - 1 + m ) % m ], v[ i ], v[ ( i + 1 ) % m ], v[ ( i + 2 ) % m ], f - i );
356 	
357 			} else {
358 	
359 				if ( k < 0 ) return v[ 0 ] - ( fn( v[ 0 ], v[ 0 ], v[ 1 ], v[ 1 ], -f ) - v[ 0 ] );
360 				if ( k > 1 ) return v[ m ] - ( fn( v[ m ], v[ m ], v[ m - 1 ], v[ m - 1 ], f - m ) - v[ m ] );
361 	
362 				return fn( v[ i ? i - 1 : 0 ], v[ i ], v[ m < i + 1 ? m : i + 1 ], v[ m < i + 2 ? m : i + 2 ], f - i );
363 	
364 			}
365 	
366 		},
367 	
368 		Utils: {
369 	
370 			Linear: function ( p0, p1, t ) {
371 	
372 				return ( p1 - p0 ) * t + p0;
373 	
374 			},
375 	
376 			Bernstein: function ( n , i ) {
377 	
378 				var fc = Interpolation.Utils.Factorial;
379 				return fc( n ) / fc( i ) / fc( n - i );
380 	
381 			},
382 	
383 			Factorial: ( function () {
384 	
385 				var a = [ 1 ];
386 	
387 				return function ( n ) {
388 	
389 					var s = 1, i;
390 					if ( a[ n ] ) return a[ n ];
391 					for ( i = n; i > 1; i-- ) s *= i;
392 					return a[ n ] = s;
393 	
394 				};
395 
396 			} )(),
397 	
398 			CatmullRom: function ( p0, p1, p2, p3, t ) {
399 	
400 				var v0 = ( p2 - p0 ) * 0.5, v1 = ( p3 - p1 ) * 0.5, t2 = t * t, t3 = t * t2;
401 				return ( 2 * p1 - 2 * p2 + v0 + v1 ) * t3 + ( - 3 * p1 + 3 * p2 - 2 * v0 - v1 ) * t2 + v0 * t + p1;
402 	
403 			}
404 		}
405 	};
406 
407 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
408 	// RiTa object (singleton)
409 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
410 	
411 	/**
412 	 * @namespace A collection of static variables and functions for the RiTa library
413 	 */
414 	RiTa = {
415 		// RiTa constants =================================
416 		
417 		/** The current version of the RiTa tools */
418 
419 		VERSION : _VERSION_,
420 
421 		/** 
422 		 * a=alpha
423 		 * b=beta
424 		 * @private
425 		 */
426 		PHASE : 'a', 
427 
428 		/** For tokenization, Can't -> Can not, etc. */
429 		SPLIT_CONTRACTIONS : false,
430 		
431 		// :::: For RiTaEvents :::::::::
432 	
433 		UNKNOWN : -1, TEXT_ENTERED : 1, BEHAVIOR_COMPLETED : 2, TIMER_TICK : 3,
434 	
435 		// :::: TextBehavior ::::::::::::
436 	
437 		MOVE_TO : 1, FADE_COLOR : 2, FADE_IN : 3, FADE_OUT : 4, FADE_TO_TEXT : 5, 
438 		TIMER : 6, SCALE_TO : 7, LERP : 8,
439 	
440 		// :::: RiText Constants  ::::::::: 
441 
442 		LEFT : 37, UP : 38, RIGHT : 39, DOWN : 40,  CENTER : 3,
443 	
444 		// :::: Animation types :::::::::
445 	
446 		LINEAR : Easing.Linear.None, 
447 		
448 		EASE_IN :  Easing.Exponential.In,
449 		EASE_OUT :  Easing.Exponential.Out, 
450 		EASE_IN_OUT :  Easing.Exponential.InOut,
451 		
452 		EASE_IN_EXPO :  Easing.Exponential.In,
453 		EASE_OUT_EXPO :  Easing.Exponential.Out,
454 		EASE_IN_OUT_EXPO :  Easing.Exponential.InOut,
455 		
456 		EASE_IN_SINE : Easing.Sinusoidal.In,
457 		EASE_OUT_SINE : Easing.Sinusoidal.Out,
458 		EASE_IN_OUT_SINE : Easing.Sinusoidal.InOut,
459 		
460 		EASE_IN_CUBIC :  Easing.Cubic.In,
461 		EASE_OUT_CUBIC : Easing.Cubic.Out,
462 		EASE_IN_OUT_CUBIC :  Easing.Cubic.InOut,
463 		
464 		EASE_IN_QUARTIC :  Easing.Quartic.In,
465 		EASE_OUT_QUARTIC :  Easing.Quartic.Out,
466 		EASE_IN_OUT_QUARTIC :  Easing.Quartic.InOut,
467 		
468 		EASE_IN_QUINTIC : Easing.Quintic.In,
469 		EASE_OUT_QUINTIC : Easing.Quintic.Out,
470 		EASE_IN_OUT_QUINTIC : Easing.Quintic.InOut,
471 		
472 		BACK_IN : Easing.Back.In,
473 		BACK_OUT : Easing.Back.Out,
474 		BACK_IN_OUT : Easing.Back.InOut,
475 		
476 		BOUNCE_IN : Easing.Bounce.In,
477 		BOUNCE_OUT : Easing.Bounce.Out,
478 		BOUNCE_IN_OUT : Easing.Bounce.InOut,
479 		
480 		CIRCULAR_IN : Easing.Circular.In,
481 		CIRCULAR_OUT : Easing.Circular.Out,
482 		CIRCULAR_IN_OUT : Easing.Circular.InOut,
483 		
484 		ELASTIC_IN : Easing.Elastic.In,
485 		ELASTIC_OUT : Easing.Elastic.Out,
486 		ELASTIC_IN_OUT : Easing.Elastic.InOut,
487 
488 		// For Conjugator =================================
489 		
490 		//TODO: add comments
491 		
492 		PHONEMES : 'phonemes',
493 		
494 		STRESSES : 'stresses',
495 		
496 		SYLLABLES : 'syllables',
497 		
498 		FIRST_PERSON : 1,
499 
500 		SECOND_PERSON : 2,
501 
502 		THIRD_PERSON : 3,
503 
504 		PAST_TENSE : 4,
505 
506 		PRESENT_TENSE : 5,
507 
508 		FUTURE_TENSE : 6,
509 
510 		SINGULAR : 7,
511 
512 		PLURAL : 8,
513 
514 		NORMAL : 9,
515 
516 		FEATURE_DELIM : ':',
517 	
518 		STRESSED : '1',
519 	
520 		UNSTRESSED : '0',
521 	
522 		PHONEME_BOUNDARY : '-', 
523 	
524 		WORD_BOUNDARY : " ", 
525 	
526 		SYLLABLE_BOUNDARY : "/", 
527 	
528 		SENTENCE_BOUNDARY : "|",
529 	
530 		VOWELS : "aeiou",
531 		
532 		ABBREVIATIONS : [   "Adm." ,"Capt." ,"Cmdr." ,"Col." ,"Dr." ,"Gen." ,"Gov." ,"Lt." ,"Maj." ,"Messrs." ,"Mr.","Mrs." ,"Ms." ,"Prof." ,"Rep." ,"Reps." ,"Rev." ,"Sen." ,"Sens." ,"Sgt." ,"Sr." ,"St.","a.k.a." ,"c.f." ,"i.e." ,"e.g." ,"vs." ,"v.", "Jan." ,"Feb." ,"Mar." ,"Apr." ,"Mar." ,"Jun." ,"Jul." ,"Aug." ,"Sept." ,"Oct." ,"Nov." ,"Dec." ],
533 
534 		/** The infinitive verb form  - 'to eat an apple' */
535 		INFINITIVE : 1,
536 
537 		/** Gerund form of a verb  - 'eating an apple' */
538 		GERUND : 2,
539 
540 		/** The imperative verb form - 'eat an apple!' */
541 		IMPERATIVE : 3,
542 
543 		/** Bare infinitive verb form - 'eat an apple' */
544 		BARE_INFINITIVE : 4,
545 
546 		/** The subjunctive verb form */
547 		SUBJUNCTIVE : 5,
548  
549 		/** Set to true to disable all console output */
550 		SILENT : false,
551 		
552 		// Start Methods =================================
553 		
554 		/**
555 		 * Joins array of word, similar to words.join(" "), but attempts to preserve punctuation position
556 		 * unless the 'adjustPunctuationSpacing' flag is set to false
557 		 * 
558 		 * @param {array} arr the array to join
559 		 * @param {string} delim the characters to place between each array element
560 		 * @param {boolean} adjustPunctuationSpacing (optional, default=true)
561 		 * 
562 		 * @returns {string} the joined array as string
563 		 */
564 		untokenize: function(arr, delim, adjustPunctuationSpacing) {
565 			 
566 			delim = delim || SP;
567 			adjustPunctuationSpacing = adjustPunctuationSpacing || 1;
568 			
569 			if (adjustPunctuationSpacing) {
570 				
571 				var newStr = arr[0] || E;
572 				for ( var i = 1; i < arr.length; i++) {
573 					if (arr[i]) {
574 						if (!RiTa.isPunctuation(arr[i]))
575 							newStr += delim;
576 						newStr += arr[i];
577 					}
578 				}
579 				
580 				return newStr.trim();
581 			}
582  
583 			return arr.join(delim);  
584 		},
585 		
586 		/**
587 		 * Returns a random number between min(default=0) and max(default=1)
588 		 * @returns {number}
589 		 */
590 		random: function() {
591 			
592 			var currentRandom = Math.random();
593 			if (arguments.length === 0) return currentRandom;
594 			if (arguments.length === 1) return currentRandom * arguments[0];
595 			var aMin = arguments[0], aMax = arguments[1];
596 			
597 			return currentRandom * (aMax - aMin) + aMin;
598 			
599 		},
600 		
601 		/**
602 		 * Convenience method to get the distance between 2 points
603 		 * @param {number} x1
604 		 * @param {number} y1
605 		 * @param {number} x2
606 		 * @param {number} y2
607 		 * 
608 		 * @returns {number}
609 		 */
610 		distance: function(x1,y1,x2,y2) {
611 			
612 			var dx = x1 - x2, dy = y1 - y2;
613 			return Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
614 			
615 		},
616 		
617 		/**
618 		 * Starts a timer that calls 'onRiTaEvent', or the specified callback, 
619 		 * every 'period' seconds
620 		 * 
621 		 * @param {number} period (in seconds)
622 		 * @param {function} callback called every 'period' seconds (optional)
623 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for the timer
624 		 */
625 		timer: function(period, callback) {
626 			
627 			var timer = Timer(
628 				function(){       
629 					RiTaEvent(RiTa, 'tick')._fire(callback);  
630 			}, period * 1000, true);
631 			timer.go();
632 			var id = timer.id(); 
633 			timers[id] = timer;
634 			return id;
635 		}, 
636 		
637 		/**
638 		 * Stops a timer according to its unique id
639 		 * @param {number} the unique id for the timer
640 		 */
641 		stopTimer: function(id) {
642 			
643 			if (timers[id])  
644 				timers[id].stop();
645 			else
646 				warn('no timer with id: '+id);
647 		}, 
648 		
649 		/**
650 		 * Pauses a timer according to its unique id
651 		 * @param {number} the unique id for the timer
652 		 * @param {number} pause-time (in seconds)
653 		 * @returns {number} the new unique id for the timer
654 		 */
655 		pauseTimer: function(id, pauseSec) {
656 			
657 			pauseSec = is(pauseSec, N) ? pauseSec : Number.MAX_VALUE;
658 			
659 			if (timers[id])  {
660 				timers[id].pause();
661 				setTimeout(function() { 
662 					if (timers[id]) timers[id].play(); else warn("no timer!!!");
663 				}, pauseSec*1000);
664 			}
665 			else
666 				warn('no timer with id: '+id);
667 		},   
668 
669 		/**
670 		 * Returns true if 'tag' is a valid PENN part-of-speech tag (e.g. cd, fw, jj, ls, nn, sym, vbg, wp)
671 		 * @param {string} tag the PENN part-of-speech tag
672 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the tag a valid PENN part-of-speech tag
673 		 */
674 		_isPosTag : function(tag) {
675 			return PosTagger.isTag(tag);
676 			
677 		},
678 			 
679 		// TODO: example
680 		/**
681 		 * Tags the word (as usual) with a part-of-speech from the Penn tagset, 
682 		 * then returns the corresponding part-of-speech for WordNet from the
683 		 * set { 'n', 'v', 'a', 'r' } as a string. 
684 		 * 
685 		 * @param {string | array} words the text to be tagged
686 		 * @returns {array} the corresponding parts-of-speech for WordNet
687 		 */
688 		_tagForWordNet  : function(words) {
689 			
690 			var posArr = RiTa.getPosTags(words);
691 
692 			if (!undef(words) && posArr.length) {
693 				for ( var i = 0; i < posArr.length; i++) {
694 					var pos = posArr[i];
695 					if (PosTagger.isNoun(pos))      posArr[i] =  "n";
696 					if (PosTagger.isVerb(pos))      posArr[i] =  "v";
697 					if (PosTagger.isAdverb(pos))    posArr[i] =  "r";
698 					if (PosTagger.isAdj(pos))      posArr[i] =  "a";
699 				}
700 				return posArr;  
701 			}
702 			return EA; 
703 		},
704 
705 		//TODO: example
706 		/**
707 		 * Uses the default PosTagger to tag the input with a tag from the PENN tag set
708 		 * @param {string | array} words the text to be tagged
709 		 * @returns {array}
710 		 * 
711 		 */
712 		getPosTags : function(words) {    
713 			
714 			var arr = is(words,S) ? RiTa.tokenize(words) : words;
715 			return PosTagger.tag(arr);
716 		},
717 		
718 		// TODO: example
719 		/**
720 		 * Takes an array of words and of tags and returns a 
721 		 * combined String of the form:
722 		 *  <pre>"The/dt doctor/nn treated/vbd dogs/nns"</pre>
723 		 * assuming a "/" as 'delimiter'.
724 		 *
725 		 * @param {string} words the text to tag
726 		 * @returns {string} 
727 		 */
728 		getPosTagsInline : function(words, delimiter) { 
729 			
730 			if (!words || !words.length) return E;
731 			
732 			delimiter = delimiter || '/';
733 			words = is(words,S) ? RiTa.tokenize(words) : words;
734 			
735 			var sb = E, tags = RiTa.getPosTags(words);
736 			for (var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
737 
738 				sb += (words[i]);
739 				if (!RiTa.isPunctuation(words[i])) {
740 					sb +=  delimiter + tags[i];
741 				}
742 				sb += SP;
743 			}
744 			
745 			return sb.trim();
746 		},
747 
748 		// TODO: example
749 		
750 		/**
751 		 * Converts a PENN part-of-speech tag to the simplified WordNet scheme 
752 		 * (e.g. nn -> n, nns -> n, vbz -> v, rb -> r)
753 		 * { "n" (noun), "v"(verb), "a"(adj), "r"(adverb), "-"(other) }
754 		 * as a String.
755 		 * 
756 		 * @param {string} tag pos tag to convert
757 		 * @returns {string} simplified WordNet tag
758 		 */
759 		posToWordNet  : function(tag) {
760 			
761 			if (!strOk(tag)) return E;
762 
763 			if (PosTagger.isNoun(tag))    
764 				return 'n';
765 			else if (PosTagger.isVerb(tag))
766 				return 'v';
767 			else if (PosTagger.isAdverb(tag))
768 				return  'r';
769 			else if (PosTagger.isAdj(tag))
770 				return  'a';
771 			else  {
772 				warn("[WARN] "+tag+" is not a valid pos-tag");
773 				return  '-';
774 			}
775 		},
776 		
777 		/**
778 		 *  Returns the present participle form of the stemmed or non-stemmed 'verb'. 
779 		 *  @param {string} verb the verb
780 		 *  @returns {string} the present participle form of the verb
781 		 */
782 		getPresentParticiple : function(verb) { 
783 			
784 			// TODO: need to call stem() and try again if first try fails
785 			return Conjugator().getPresentParticiple(verb);
786 		},
787 
788 		/**
789 		 *  Returns the past participle form of the stemmed or non-stemmed 'verb'. 
790 		 *  @param {string} verb the verb
791 		 *  @returns {string} the past participle form of the verb
792 		 */
793 		getPastParticiple : function(verb) { 
794 			
795 			// TODO: need to call stem() and try again if first try fails
796 			return Conjugator().getPastParticiple(verb);
797 		},
798 
799 		// TODO: 2 examples
800 		/**
801 		 *  Conjugates the 'verb' according to the specified options
802 		 *  @param {string} verb the verb stem
803 		 *  @param {object} args containing the relevant options for the conjugator
804 		 *  @returns {string}  the conjugated verb
805 		 */
806 		conjugate : function(verb, args) {
807 
808 			return Conjugator().conjugate(verb, args);            
809 		},
810 
811 		// TODO: 2 examples (regular & irregular) in javadoc
812 		
813 		/** 
814 		 * Pluralizes a word according to pluralization rules (see regexs in constants)
815 		 * Returns the regular or irregular plural form of noun.       
816 		 * 
817 		 * @param {string} word the noun
818 		 * 
819 		 * @returns {string} the plural form of noun
820 		 */
821 		pluralize : function(word) {
822 
823 			if (!strOk(word)) return E;
824 			
825 			var i, rule, rules = PLURAL_RULES;
826 
827 			if (inArray(MODALS, word.toLowerCase())) {
828 				return word;
829 			}
830 
831 			i = rules.length;
832 			while (i--) {
833 				rule = rules[i];
834 				if (rule.applies(word.toLowerCase())) {
835 					return rule.fire(word);
836 				}
837 			}
838 
839 			return DEFAULT_PLURAL_RULE.fire(word);            
840 		},
841 		
842 		// TODO: 2 examples (regular & irregular) in javadoc        
843 
844 		/**
845 		 *
846 		 * Singularize a word according to singularization rules (see regexs in constants)
847 		 * @param {string} word the noun
848 		 * @returns {string}  the singular form of noun
849 		 */ 
850 		singularize : function(word) {
851 
852 			if (!strOk(word)) return E;
853 
854 			var i, rule, rules = SINGULAR_RULES;
855 
856 			if (inArray(MODALS, word.toLowerCase())) {
857 				return word;
858 			}
859 
860 			i = rules.length;
861 			while (i--) {
862 				rule = rules[i];
863 				if (rule.applies(word.toLowerCase())) {
864 					return rule.fire(word);
865 				}
866 			}
867 
868 			
869 			return this.stem(word, 'Pling');
870 		},
871 
872 
873 		/**
874 		 *  Removes blank space from either side of a string
875 		 *
876 		 *  @param {string} the input string
877 		 *  
878 		 *  @returns {string}  
879 		 */
880 		trim : function(str) {
881 			
882 			return trim(str); // delegate to private
883 		},
884 
885 	
886 		/**
887 		 *  Tokenizes the string according to Penn Treebank conventions
888 		 *  See: http://www.cis.upenn.edu/~treebank/tokenization.html
889 		 *  
890 		 *  @param {string} words a sentence
891 		 *  @param {string | regex} regex (optional) the pattern to be used for tozenization
892 		 *  
893 		 *  @return{array} strings, which each element is a single token (or word) 
894 		 */
895 		tokenize : function(words, regex) {
896 			
897 			//TODO: 2 examples for doc comment, one with 1 arg, one with 2 (a regex that splits on spaces)
898 
899 			if (regex) return words.split(regex);
900 			
901 			words = trim(words).replace(/``/g, "`` ");
902 			words = words.replace(/''/g, "  ''");
903 			words = words.replace(/([\\?!\"\\.,;:@#$%&])/g, " $1 ");
904 			words = words.replace(/\\.\\.\\./g, " ... ");
905 			words = words.replace(/\\s+/g, SP);
906 			words = words.replace(/,([^0-9])/g, " , $1");
907 			words = words.replace(/([^.])([.])([\])}>\"']*)\\s*$/g, "$1 $2$3 ");
908 			words = words.replace(/([\[\](){}<>])/g, " $1 ");
909 			words = words.replace(/--/g, " -- ");
910 			words = words.replace(/$/g, SP);
911 			words = words.replace(/^/g, SP);
912 			words = words.replace(/([^'])' /g, "$1 ' ");
913 			words = words.replace(/'([SMD]) /g, " '$1 ");
914  
915 			if (RiTa.SPLIT_CONTRACTIONS) { // SAVE
916 				words = words.replace(/'ll /g, " 'll "); 
917 				words = words.replace(/'re /g, " 're "); 
918 				words = words.replace(/'ve /g, " have ");
919 				words = words.replace(/n't /g, " not "); 
920 				
921 				words = words.replace(/'LL /g, " 'LL "); 
922 				words = words.replace(/'RE /g, " 'RE "); 
923 				words = words.replace(/'VE /g, " 'VE "); 
924 				words = words.replace(/N'T /g, " N'T "); 
925 			}
926 			
927 			words = words.replace(/ ([Cc])an't /g, " $1an not ");
928 			words = words.replace(/ ([Cc])annot /g, " $1an not ");
929 			words = words.replace(/ ([Dd])idn't /g, " $1id not ");
930 			words = words.replace(/ ([CcWw])ouldn't /g, " $1ould not ");
931 			
932 
933 			// "Nicole I. Kidman" gets tokenized as "Nicole I . Kidman"
934 			words = words.replace(/ ([A-Z]) \\./g, " $1. ");
935 			words = words.replace(/\\s+/g, SP);
936 			words = words.replace(/^\\s+/g, E);
937 			
938 			return trim(words).split(/\s+/); // DCH: fixed bug here, 6/3/12
939 		},
940 
941 		
942 		// TODO: test and (probably) re-implement from RiTa (RiSplitter.java)
943 		/**
944 		 *  Splits the 'text' into sentences (according to PENN Treebank conventions)
945 		 *  
946 		 *  @param {string} text the text to be split
947 		 *  @param {string | regex} regex (optional) the pattern to be used for tozenization
948 		 *  
949 		 *  @returns {array} of sentences 
950 		 */
951 		splitSentences : function(text, regex) {
952 
953 			var arr = text.match(/(\S.+?[.!?])(?=\s+|$)/g);
954 
955 			return (text.length && arr && arr.length) ? arr : [ text ];
956 			
957 		},
958 
959 		/**
960 		 * Returns true if and only if the string matches 'pattern'
961 		 * 
962 		 * @param {string} string string to test
963 		 * @param {string | regex} pattern object containing regular expression
964 		 * @returns {boolean} true if matched, else false
965 		 */
966 		_regexMatch : function(string, pattern) {
967 			
968 			if (undef(string) || undef(pattern))
969 				return false;
970 			
971 			if (typeof pattern === S)
972 				pattern = new RegExp(pattern);
973 			
974 			return pattern.test(string);
975 			
976 		},
977 
978 		/**
979 		 * Replaces all matches of 'pattern' in the 'string' with 'replacement'
980 		 * 
981 		 * @param {string} string to test
982 		 * @param {string | regex } pattern object containing regular expression
983 		 * @param {string} replacement the replacement
984 		 * @returns {string} with replacements or thestring on error
985 		 */
986 		_regexReplace : function(string, pattern, replacement) {
987 			
988 			if (undef(string) || undef(pattern))
989 				return E;
990 			if (typeof pattern === S)
991 				pattern = new RegExp(pattern); // TODO: is this necessary?
992 			return string.replace(pattern, replacement);
993 			
994 		},
995 			 
996 		/**
997 		 * Returns true if 'input' is an abbreviation
998 		 * 
999 		 * @param {string} input
1000 		 * @param {boolean} caseSensitive (optional, default=false)
1001 		 * 
1002 		 * @returns {boolean} true if 'input' is an abbreviation
1003 		 */
1004 		isAbbreviation : function(input, caseSensitive) {
1005 			
1006 			caseSensitive = caseSensitive || false;
1007 			input = caseSensitive ? input : RiTa._titleCase(input);
1008 			return inArray(this.ABBREVIATIONS, input);
1009 			
1010 		},
1011 		
1012 		/**
1013 		 * Returns true if sentence starts with a question word.
1014 		 * 
1015 		 * @param {string} sentence
1016 		 * 
1017 		 * @returns {boolean} true if 'sentence' starts with a question word.
1018 		 */
1019 		isQuestion : function(sentence) {
1020 			
1021 			var sentenceArr = RiTa.tokenize((sentence));
1022 			
1023 			for (var i = 0; i < QUESTION_STARTS.length; i++) {
1024 				
1025 				if (equalsIgnoreCase(sentenceArr[0], QUESTION_STARTS[i]))
1026 					return true;
1027 			}
1028 			return false;
1029 			
1030 		},
1031 
1032 		/**
1033 		 * Returns true if 'currentWord' is the final word of a sentence.
1034 		 * This is a simplified version of the OAK/JET sentence splitter method.
1035 		 * 
1036 		 * @param {string} currentWord
1037 		 * @param {string} nextWord
1038 		 * @returns {boolean} true if 'currentWord' is the final word of a sentence.
1039 		 */
1040 		isSentenceEnd : function(currentWord, nextWord) {
1041 
1042 			if ( !is(currentWord,S) || !is(nextWord,S) )
1043 				return false;
1044 			
1045 			var cw = currentWord.charAt(0), cWL = currentWord.length; 
1046 			
1047 			// token is a mid-sentence abbreviation (mainly, titles) --> middle of sent
1048 			if (RiTa.isAbbreviation(currentWord))
1049 				return false;
1050 			
1051 			if (cWL > 1 && cw.indexOf("`'\"([{<") != -1 && RiTa.isAbbreviation(currentWord.substring(1)))
1052 				return false;
1053 		
1054 			if (cWL > 2 && ((currentWord.charAt(0) == '\'' && currentWord.charAt(1) == '\'') || (currentWord.charAt(0) == '`' && currentWord.charAt(1) == '`')) && RiTa.isAbbreviation(currentWord.substring(2)))
1055 			{
1056 				return false;
1057 			}
1058 			
1059 			var nTL = nextWord.length,
1060 				currentToken0 = currentWord.charAt(cWL - 1), 
1061 				currentToken1 = (cWL > 1) ? currentWord.charAt(cWL - 2) : ' ', 
1062 				currentToken2 = (cWL > 2) ? currentWord.charAt(cWL - 3) : ' ',
1063 				nextToken0 = nextWord.charAt(0), 
1064 				nextToken1 = (nTL > 1) ? nextWord.charAt(1) : ' ',
1065 				nextToken2 = (nTL > 2) ? nextWord.charAt(2) : ' ';
1066 		
1067 			// nextToken does not begin with an upper case,
1068 			// [`'"([{<] + upper case, `` + upper case, or < -> middle of sent.
1069 			if (!  (nextToken0 == nextToken0.toUpperCase()
1070 				|| (nextToken1 == nextToken1.toUpperCase() && nextToken0.indexOf("`'\"([{<") != -1)
1071 				|| (nextToken2 == nextToken2.toUpperCase() && ((nextToken0 == '`' && nextToken1 == '`') 
1072 				|| (nextToken0 == '\'' && nextToken1 == '\'')))
1073 				||  nextWord == "_" || nextToken0 == '<'))
1074 			  return false;
1075 		
1076 			// ends with ?, !, [!?.]["'}>)], or [?!.]'' -> end of sentence
1077 			if (currentToken0 == '?'
1078 				|| currentToken0 == '!'
1079 				|| (currentToken1.indexOf("?!.") != -1 && currentToken0.indexOf("\"'}>)") != -1)
1080 				|| (currentToken2.indexOf("?!.") != -1 && currentToken1 == '\'' && currentToken0 == '\''))
1081 			return true;
1082 
1083 			// last char not "." -> middle of sentence
1084 			if (currentToken0 != '.') return false;
1085 		
1086 			// Note: wont handle Q. / A. at start of sentence, as in a news wire
1087 			//if (startOfSentence && (currentWord.equalsIgnoreCase("Q.") 
1088 			  //|| currentWord.equalsIgnoreCase("A.")))return true; 
1089 			
1090 			// single upper-case alpha + "." -> middle of sentence
1091 			if (cWL == 2 && currentToken1 == currentToken1.toUpperCase())
1092 				return false;
1093 		
1094 			// double initial (X.Y.) -> middle of sentence << added for ACE
1095 			if (cWL == 4 && currentToken2 == '.'&& (currentToken1 == currentToken1.toUpperCase() && currentWord.charAt(0) == currentWord.charAt(0).toUpperCase() ))
1096 				return false;
1097 		
1098 			// U.S. or U.N. -> middle of sentence
1099 			//if (currentToken.equals("U.S.") || currentToken.equals("U.N."))
1100 			  //return false; // dch
1101 			  
1102 			//if (Util.isAbbreviation(currentToken)) return false;
1103 			
1104 			// (for XML-marked text) next char is < -> end of sentence
1105 		   // if (nextToken0 == '<') return true;
1106 			
1107 			return true;
1108 
1109 		},
1110 		
1111 		/**
1112 		 * Returns true if sentence starts with a w-question word, eg (who,what,why,where,when,etc.)
1113 		 * 
1114 		 * @param {string} sentence
1115 		 * @returns {boolean} true if sentence starts with a w-question word, eg (who,what,why,where,when,etc.)
1116 		 */
1117 		isW_Question : function(sentence) {    
1118 			var sentenceArr = RiTa.tokenize((sentence));
1119 			for (var i = 0; i < W_QUESTION_STARTS.length; i++)
1120 				if (equalsIgnoreCase(sentenceArr[0], W_QUESTION_STARTS[i]))
1121 					return true;
1122 			return false;
1123 			
1124 		},
1125 
1126 		/**
1127 		 * Returns a randomly ordered array of unique integers from 0 to numElements. 
1128 		 * The size of the array will be numElements.
1129 		 * 
1130 		 * @param {number} numElements
1131 		 * @returns {array} unique integers from 0 to numElements. 
1132 		 */
1133 		randomOrdering : function(numElements) {    
1134 			
1135 			if (!numElements || numElements < 1)// !isNum(numElements)) 
1136 				err("bad arg");
1137 			
1138 			var o = [];
1139 			for ( var z = 0; z < numElements; z++) {
1140 				o.push(z);
1141 			}
1142 			
1143 			// Array shuffle, from Jonas Raoni Soares Silva (http://jsfromhell.com/array/shuffle)
1144 			for (var j, x, i = o.length; i; j = parseInt(Math.random() * i), x = o[--i], o[i] = o[j], o[j] = x) {}
1145 
1146 			return o;
1147 			
1148 		},
1149 
1150 		/**
1151 		 * Strips all punctuation from the given string
1152 		 * @param {string} text input
1153 		 * @returns {string} result
1154 		 */
1155 		stripPunctuation : function(text) {    
1156 
1157 			return (text === E) ? E : text.replace(PUNCTUATION_CLASS, E); 
1158 		},
1159 		
1160 		// PUNCTUATION : "`'""\",;:!?)([].#\"\\!@$%&}<>|+=-_\\/*{^",
1161 		
1162 		/**
1163 		 * Trims punctuation from each side of the token (does not trim whitespace or internal punctuation).
1164 		 * 
1165 		 * @param {string} text input
1166 		 * @returns {string} result
1167 		 */
1168 		trimPunctuation : function(text) {
1169 			
1170 			// TODO: replace all this with 1 regex
1171 
1172 			var c;
1173 
1174 			// from the front
1175 			while (text.length > 0) {
1176 				c = text.charAt(0);
1177 				if (!RiTa.isPunctuation(c)) 
1178 					break;
1179 				text = text.substr(1);
1180 			}
1181 			
1182 			// from the back
1183 			while (text.length > 0) {
1184 				c = text.charAt(text.length - 1);
1185 				if (!RiTa.isPunctuation(c)) 
1186 					break;
1187 				text = text.substring(0, text.length - 1);
1188 			}
1189 
1190 			return text;
1191 
1192 			
1193 		},
1194 
1195 		/**
1196 		 * Returns true if every character of 'text' is a punctuation character
1197 		 * 
1198 		 * @param {string} text input
1199 		 * @returns {boolean} 
1200 		 */
1201 		// TEST: PUNCTUATION : "`'""\",;:!?)([].#\"\\!@$%&}<>|+=-_\\/*{^",
1202 		isPunctuation : function(text) { 
1203 			
1204 			if (!text || !text.length) return false;
1205   
1206 			return ONLY_PUNCT.test(text); 
1207 			
1208 		},
1209 		
1210 		/**
1211 		 * Returns true if any character of 'text' is a punctuation character
1212 		 * 
1213 		 * @param {string} text input
1214 		 * @returns {boolean}
1215 		 */
1216 		// TEST: PUNCTUATION : "`'""\",;:!?)([].#\"\\!@$%&}<>|+=-_\\/*{^",
1217 		hasPunctuation : function(text) { 
1218 			
1219 			if (!text || !text.length) return false;
1220   
1221 			return ONLY_PUNCT.test(text); 
1222 		},
1223 
1224 		/**
1225 		 * Returns a string containing all phonemes for the input text
1226 		 * 
1227 		 * @param {string | array} words to analyze
1228 		 * @returns {string}  e.g., "dh-ax-d-ao-g-r-ae-n-f-ae-s-t"
1229 		 */
1230 		getPhonemes : function(words) {
1231 
1232 			return RiString(words).analyze().get(RiTa.PHONEMES);
1233 			
1234 		},
1235 
1236 		/**
1237 		 * Analyzes the given string and returns a new string containing the stresses
1238 		 *  for each syllable of the input text 
1239 		 * 
1240 		 * @param {string | array} words to analyze
1241 		 * 
1242 		 * @returns {string}  e.g., "01-0-1", with 1's meaning 'stressed', 
1243 		 *      and 0's meaning 'unstressed', 
1244 		 */
1245 		getStresses : function(words) {
1246 
1247 			return RiString(words).analyze().get(RiTa.STRESSES);
1248 		},
1249 
1250 		/**
1251 		 * Analyzes the given string, Returns a String containing the phonemes for each syllable of
1252 		 * each word of the input text,  delimited by dashes (phonemes) and spaces (words) 
1253 		 * 
1254 		 * @param {string | array} words to analyze
1255 		 * 
1256 		 * @returns {string} e.g., "dh-ax d-ao-g r-ae-n f-ae-s-t" 
1257 		 *  for the 4 syllables of the phrase 'The dog ran fast'
1258 		 */
1259 		getSyllables : function(words) {
1260 
1261 			return RiString(words).analyze().get(RiTa.SYLLABLES);
1262 
1263 		},
1264 		
1265 		/**
1266 		 * Returns the # of words in the String according to the default tokenizer.
1267 		 * 
1268 		 * @param {string} words the string to analyze
1269 		 * 
1270 		 * @returns {number}
1271 		 */
1272 		getWordCount : function(words) {
1273 			
1274 			return RiTa.tokenize(words).length;
1275 
1276 		},
1277 		
1278 		/**
1279 		 * Extracts base roots from a word according to the specified stemming algorithm
1280 		 * <p>
1281 		 * Note: see http://text-processing.com/demo/stem/ for comparison of 
1282 		 * Lancaster and Porter algorithms or  http://mpii.de/yago-naga/javatools 
1283 		 * for info on PlingStemmer
1284 		 * 
1285 		 * @param {string} word the word to analyze
1286 		 * 
1287 		 * @param {string} type one of ['Lancaster' (the default), 'Porter', or 'Pling'] 
1288 		 *  to specify the stemming algorithm to use
1289 		 * 
1290 		 * @returns {string} the stemmed form of 'word'
1291 		 */
1292 		stem : function(word, type) {
1293 			
1294 			type = type || 'Lancaster';  // CONSTANTS
1295 			
1296 			if (type != 'Lancaster' && type != 'Porter' && type != 'Pling')
1297 				err('Bad stemmer type: '+type);
1298 			
1299 			var stemImpl = Stemmer['stem_'+type];
1300 			
1301 			if (word.indexOf(SP) < 0) return stemImpl(word);
1302 			
1303 			// dump non-words && multiple white-space - http://qaa.ath.cx/porter_js_demo.html
1304 			word = word.replace(/[^\w]/g, SP);
1305 			word = word.replace(/\s+/g, SP); 
1306 			
1307 			var res = [], words = word.split(SP);
1308 			
1309 			for ( var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
1310 				
1311 				res.push(stemImpl(words[i]));
1312 			}
1313 			
1314 			return res.join(SP);
1315 		},
1316 		
1317 		/**
1318 		 * For convenience, provides implementations of some of Processing built-in 
1319 		 * method, e.g. size(), background(), etc. and backwards compatibility with
1320 		 * the original RiTa/Processing Java library
1321 		 * 
1322 		 * @param {boolean} true to enable compatibility, else false
1323 		 */
1324 		p5Compatible : function(value) {
1325 			
1326 			//console.log('p5Compatible('+value+'['+window+'])');
1327 			
1328 			if (!arguments.callee.setupAndDraw) {
1329 				
1330 				arguments.callee.setupAndDraw = function() {
1331 					if (typeof window.setup == F) setup();
1332 					if (typeof window.draw == F) RiText.loop();
1333 				};
1334 			}
1335 			
1336 			if (window) {
1337 				// TODO: add mouse-handling methods here?
1338 				if (typeof window.mouseClicked == F) 
1339 					window.onmouseup = window.mouseClicked;
1340 				if (typeof window.mousePressed == F) 
1341 					window.onmousedown = window.mousePressed;
1342 				if (typeof window.mouseReleased == F) 
1343 					window.onmouseup = window.mouseReleased;
1344 				if (typeof window.mouseMoved == F) 
1345 					window.onmousemove = window.mouseMoved;
1346 			}
1347 			//if (typeof window.mouseDragged == F) 
1348 				//window.onmousemove = window.mouseDragged; 
1349 			// window.onmousemove = mouseDragged;
1350 
1351 			if (value) {
1352 				
1353 				// alias for some P5 member functions 
1354 				RiText.prototype.fill       = RiText.prototype.color;
1355 				RiText.prototype.textAlign  = RiText.prototype.align;
1356 				RiText.prototype.textFont   = RiText.prototype.font;
1357 				RiText.prototype.textSize   = RiText.prototype.fontSize;
1358 				
1359 				// alias for some RiTa-java functions
1360 				RiText.prototype.setText    = RiText.prototype.text;
1361 				RiText.prototype.fadeColor  = RiText.prototype.colorTo;
1362 				RiText.prototype.fadeToText = RiText.prototype.textTo;
1363 				RiText.prototype.setColor   = RiText.prototype.color;
1364 	
1365 				// alias for RiTa-java static functions
1366 				RiText.setDefaultFont = RiText.defaultFont;
1367 				RiText.setDefaultColor = RiText.defaultColor;
1368 				RiText.setDefaultAlignment = RiText.defaultAlignment;
1369 				RiText.setCallbackTimer = RiText.timer;
1370 				
1371 				if (typeof window != 'undefined' && !hasProcessing) {
1372 					
1373 					// add some common P5 global methods (sorry, namespace)
1374 					
1375 					if (!window.line) window.line = RiText.line;
1376 					if (!window.size) window.size= RiText.size;
1377 					if (!window.width) window.width = RiText.width; // want the var
1378 					if (!window.height) window.height= RiText.height; // want the var
1379 					if (!window.createFont) window.createFont= RiText.createFont;
1380 					if (!window.background) window.background= RiText.background;
1381 					if (!window.random) window.random= RiText.random;
1382 					if (!window.RIGHT) window.RIGHT = RiTa.RIGHT;
1383 					if (!window.LEFT) window.LEFT = RiTa.LEFT;
1384 					if (!window.CENTER) window.CENTER = RiTa.CENTER;
1385 					
1386 					window.onload = arguments.callee.setupAndDraw;
1387 				}
1388 			}
1389 			else { // non-compatible mode (clear extra stuff)
1390 				
1391 				delete RiText.prototype.fill;
1392 				delete RiText.prototype.textAlign;
1393 				delete RiText.prototype.textFont;
1394 				delete RiText.prototype.textSize;
1395 				
1396 				delete RiText.prototype.setColor;
1397 				delete RiText.prototype.setText;
1398 				delete RiText.prototype.fadeColor;
1399 				delete RiText.prototype.fadeToText;
1400 				
1401 				delete RiText.setDefaultFont;
1402 				delete RiText.setDefaultColor;
1403 				delete RiText.setDefaultAlignment;
1404 				delete RiText.setCallbackTimer;
1405 
1406 				if (typeof window != 'undefined' && window && !hasProcessing)  {
1407 					
1408 					// are these checks needed?
1409 					if (window.line === RiText.line) delete window.line;
1410 					if (window.size === RiText.size) delete window.size;
1411 					if (window.width === RiText.width) delete window.width;
1412 					if (window.height === RiText.height) delete window.height;
1413 					if (window.createFont === RiText.createFont) delete window.createFont;
1414 					if (window.background === RiText.background) delete window.background;
1415 					if (window.random === RiText.random) delete window.random;
1416 					if (window.RIGHT === RiTa.RIGHT) delete window.RIGHT;
1417 					if (window.LEFT === RiTa.LEFT) delete window.LEFT;
1418 					if (window.CENTER === RiTa.CENTER) delete window.CENTER;
1419 
1420 					if (window.onload && (window.onload == arguments.callee.setupAndDraw))
1421 						delete window.onload;
1422 				}
1423 			}
1424 		},
1425 		
1426 		/**
1427 		 * Converts 'input' to Titlecase (1st letter upper, rest lower)
1428 		 */
1429 		_titleCase : function(input) {
1430 			
1431 			if (!input || !input.length) return input;
1432 			
1433 			return input.substring(0,1).toUpperCase() + input.substring(1);
1434 		}
1435 		
1436 	}; // end RiTa object
1437 
1438 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1439 	// RiMarkov
1440 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1441 	
1442 	/**
1443 	 * @name RiMarkov
1444 	 * @class Performs text generation via Markov chains (aka n-grams)
1445 	 * with options to process single characters, words, sentences, and 
1446 	 * arbitrary regular expressions. 
1447 	 * 
1448 	 * <p>
1449 	 * 
1450 	 * Provides a variety of methods specifically 
1451 	 * designed for text-generation.
1452 	 *  
1453 	 * @example
1454 	 *   var rm = new RiMarkov(3);
1455 	 *   rm.loadFile("war_peace.txt"); 
1456 	 *   var sents = rm.generateSentences(10);
1457 	 *   for (var i = 0; i < sents.length; i++) {
1458 	 *     console.log(sents[i]);
1459 	 *   }
1460 	 
1461 	 * Note: use RiMarkov.setTokenizerRegex() to control how inputs are tokenized (or split-up). 
1462 	 * The default is to use the Penn word-tokenizing conventions (without splitting contractions). 
1463 	 * You may wish to simply use whitespace (or some other regular expression), which 
1464 	 * can be accomplished as follows:
1465 	 * <pre>
1466 	 *   var rm = new RiMarkov(3);
1467 	 *   rm.setTokenizerRegex(/\s+/);</pre>
1468 	 *   
1469 	 * This creates a new model, with n=3, that tokenizes its
1470 	 * input on one or more whitespace characters: [ \t\n\x0B\f\r].
1471 	 * 
1472 	 * <p> 
1473 	 * 
1474 	 */
1475 	/*
1476 	 * Note: use RiMarkov.setAllowDuplicates(false) method to ensure that sentences that exist 
1477 	 * in the input test are not output by generate().  This method should be used with care, 
1478 	 * as certain sets of input texts (with allowDuplicates=false) may result in decreased performance
1479 	 * and/or excessive memory use.
1480 	 */
1481 	var RiMarkov = makeClass();
1482 
1483 	RiMarkov.prototype = {
1484 
1485 		/**
1486 		 * @function
1487 		 * @name RiMarkov 
1488 		 * 
1489 		 * Construct a Markov chain (or n-gram) model and set its n-Factor
1490 		 * 
1491 		 * @param {number} nFactor for the model
1492 		 * @param {boolean} caseSensitive whether the model should be case-sensitive (optional, default=false)
1493 		 * @param {boolean} useSmoothing whether the model should be case-sensitive (optional, default=false)
1494 		 */
1495 		init : function(nFactor, useSmoothing) {
1496 
1497 			ok(nFactor,N);
1498 
1499 			this._n = nFactor;
1500 			this.sentenceList = [];
1501 			this.sentenceStarts = [];
1502 			this.sentenceAware = true;
1503 			this.smoothing = useSmoothing || false;
1504 			this.root = new TextNode(null, 'ROOT');
1505 			this.ssRegex = "\"?[A-Z][a-z\"',;`-]*";
1506 			this.ssDelim = "D=l1m"; // last 2 should be static
1507 		},
1508 
1509 		/**
1510 		 * Returns either the raw (unigram) probability for a single token in the model (0 if it does not exist)
1511 		 * OR (for an array) the probability of obtaining a sequence of k tokens where k <= nFactor,
1512 		 * e.g., if nFactor = 3, then valid lengths for the data arrau are 1, 2 & 3.
1513   
1514 		 * @param {string | array} data the string (or sequence of strings) to search for
1515 		 * 
1516 		 * @returns {number} from 0-1
1517 		 */
1518 		getProbability : function(data) {
1519 			
1520 			if (!this.root) err("Model not initd: null root!");
1521 			
1522 			var tn = is(data,S) ? this.root.lookup(data) : this._findNode(data);
1523 
1524 			return (tn) ? tn.probability() : 0;
1525 			
1526 		},
1527 		
1528 		/** 
1529 		 * Returns the full set of possible next tokens, as an associative array, 
1530 		 * (mapping string -> number (probability)) given an array of tokens 
1531 		 * representing the path down the tree (with length less than n).
1532 		 * 
1533 		 * <p>  Note: seed arrays of any size (>0) may be input, but only 
1534 		 * the last n-1 elements will be considered.   
1535 		 *
1536 		 * @param {string | array} a single token or array of tokens (strings)
1537 		 *
1538 		 * @returns {object} associative array mapping tokens to probabilities
1539 		 */
1540 		getProbabilities : function(path) {
1541 			
1542 			//log('getProbabilities: '+path);
1543 			
1544 			if (is(path,S)) path = [path];
1545 
1546 			if (path.length > this._n) {
1547 				
1548 				path = path.slice(Math.max(0, path.length-(this._n-1)), path.length);
1549 			}
1550 			
1551 			var probs = {}, tn = this._findNode(path);
1552 			
1553 			if (!tn) return {};
1554 
1555 			var nexts = tn.childNodes();
1556 			for (var i = 0; i < nexts.length; i++) {
1557 				var node = nexts[i];
1558 				if (node)  {
1559 					probs[node.token] = node.probability();
1560 				}
1561 			}
1562 			
1563 			return probs;
1564 		},
1565 		
1566 		/**
1567 		 * If only one array parameter is provided, this function returns all possible
1568 		 * next words (or tokens), ordered by probability, for the given
1569 		 * array. <p>Note: seed arrays of any size (>0) may 
1570 		 * be input, but only the last n-1 elements will be considered.   
1571 		 *
1572 		 * @example var result = rm.getCompletions([ "the","red"]);
1573 		 *
1574 		 * If two arrays are provided, it returns an unordered list of possible words <i>w</i> 
1575 		 * that complete an n-gram consisting of: pre[0]...pre[k], <i>w</i>, post[k+1]...post[n].
1576 		 * 
1577 		 * As an example, the following call:
1578 		 * 
1579 		 * @example var result = rm.getCompletions([ "the" ], [ "red", "ball" ]);
1580 		 * 
1581 		 * will return all the single words that occur between 'the' and 'red ball'
1582 		 * in the current model (assuming n > 3), e.g., [ 'round', 'big', 'bouncy']).
1583 		 * <p> 
1584 		 * Note: For this operation to be valid, (pre.length + post.length)
1585 		 * must be less than the model's n-factor, otherwise an error will be thrown. 
1586 		 * 
1587 		 * @param {array} pre
1588 		 * @param {array} post (optional)
1589 		 * 
1590 		 * @returns {array} an unordered list of possible next tokens
1591 		 */
1592 		getCompletions : function(pre, post) {
1593 			
1594 			//  log(pre+" :: "+post);
1595 			
1596 			var tn, result=[], node, test, nexts;
1597 			
1598 			if (post) { // fill the center
1599 	
1600 				if (pre.length + post.length > this._n) {
1601 	
1602 					err('Sum of pre.length && post.length must be < N, was ' + (pre.length + post.length));
1603 				}
1604 	
1605 				tn = this._findNode(pre);
1606 				if (!tn) return null;
1607 	
1608 				nexts = tn.childNodes();
1609 				for ( var i = 0; i < nexts.length; i++) {
1610 	
1611 					node = nexts[i];
1612 					
1613 					test = pre.slice(0); // clone
1614 	
1615 					test.push(node.token);
1616 					
1617 					for ( var j = 0; j < post.length; j++)
1618 						test.push(post[j]);
1619 	
1620 					if (this._findNode(test)) result.push(node.token);
1621 				}
1622 				return result;
1623 			}
1624 			else { // fill the end
1625 	
1626 				var hash = this.getProbabilities(pre);
1627 				var keys = okeys(hash);
1628 				return keys.sort(function(a, b) {
1629 	
1630 					return hash[b] - hash[a];
1631 				});
1632 			}
1633 		},
1634 		
1635 		/**
1636 		 * Continues generating tokens until a token matches 'regex', assuming
1637 		 * the length of the output array is between min and maxLength (inclusive).
1638 		 * 
1639 		 * @param {string} or {object} regex The regex string or object to match against
1640 		 * @param {number} minLength the minimum number of tokens to generate
1641 		 * @param {number} maxLength the maximum number of tokens to generate
1642 		 * 
1643 		 * @returns {array} strings
1644 		 */ 
1645 		generateUntil : function(regex, minLength, maxLength){
1646 
1647 			minLength = minLength || 1;
1648 			maxLength = maxLength || Number.MAX_VALUE;
1649 			
1650 			var mn, tokens, tries=0, maxTries=999;
1651 			
1652 			OUT: while (++tries < maxTries) {
1653 			
1654 				// generate the min number of tokens
1655 				tokens = this.generateTokens(minLength);
1656 
1657 				// keep adding one and checking until we pass the max
1658 				while (tokens.length < maxLength) {
1659 					
1660 					mn = this._nextNode(tokens);
1661 					
1662 					if (!mn || !mn.token)   
1663 						continue OUT;// fail, restart
1664 					
1665 					tokens.push(mn.token);
1666 					
1667 					// check against our regex
1668 					if (mn.token.search(regex) >-1 )
1669 						return tokens;
1670 				}
1671 			}
1672 			
1673 			// uh-oh, we failed
1674 			if (tries >= maxTries) 
1675 				err("\n[WARN] RiMarkov failed to complete after "+tries+" attempts\n");
1676 
1677 			return tokens;
1678 
1679 		},
1680 			
1681 		/**
1682 		 * Generates a string of <pre>length</pre> tokens from the model
1683 		 * @param {number} the target number of tokens to generate
1684 		 * @returns {array} strings
1685 		 */
1686 		generateTokens: function(targetNumber) {
1687 
1688 			var tries = 0, maxTries = 500, tokens = [];
1689 
1690 			OUT: while(++tries < maxTries) {
1691 
1692 				var mn = this.root.selectChild(null, true);
1693 				if (!mn || !mn.token) continue OUT;
1694 				tokens.push(mn);
1695 
1696 				while(tokens.length < targetNumber) {
1697 
1698 					mn = this._nextNode(tokens);
1699 					if (!mn || !mn.token) { // hit the end
1700 						tokens = []; // start over
1701 						continue OUT;
1702 					}
1703 
1704 					tokens.push(mn);
1705 				}
1706 
1707 				break;
1708 			}
1709 
1710 			// uh-oh, looks like we failed...
1711 			if (tokens.length < targetNumber) {
1712 				err("\n[WARN] RiMarkov failed to complete after " + tries + " tries, with only " + tokens.length + " successful generations...\n");
1713 			}
1714 
1715 			var res = [];
1716 			for(var i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++) {
1717 				res[i] = tokens[i].token;
1718 			}
1719 
1720 			return res;
1721 		},
1722 		
1723 
1724 				
1725 		/**
1726 		 * Sets/gets the value of 'useSmoothing' to detemine 
1727 		 * whether (add-1) smoothing is enabled for the model.
1728 		 * Note: should be called before any data loading is done.
1729 		 * @param {boolean} the value (optional, for sets only)
1730 		 * @returns {object | boolean} 
1731 		 */
1732 		useSmoothing : function(value) {
1733 			
1734 			if (arguments.length) {
1735 				
1736 				this.smoothing = value;
1737 				return this;
1738 			}
1739 			return this.smoothing;
1740 		},
1741 		
1742 						
1743 		/**
1744 		 * Sets whether the model will try to recognize 
1745 		 * (english-like) sentences in its input (default=true).
1746 		 * Note: should be called before any data loading is done.
1747 		 * 
1748 		 * @param {boolean} the value (optional, for sets only)
1749 		 * @returns {object | boolean} 
1750 		 */
1751 		recognizeSentences : function(value) {
1752 			
1753 			if (arguments.length) {
1754 				
1755 				this.sentenceAware = value;
1756 				return this;
1757 			}
1758 			return this.sentenceAware;
1759 		},
1760 
1761 		/**
1762 		 * Returns the current n-value for the model
1763 		 * @returns {number}
1764 		 */
1765 		getN : function() {
1766 			
1767 			return this._n;
1768 		},
1769 		
1770 		/**
1771 		 * Returns the number of tokens currently in the model
1772 		 * @returns {number}
1773 		 */
1774 		size : function() {
1775 			
1776 			return this.root.count;
1777 		},
1778 		
1779 		/**
1780 		 * Prints a formatted version of the model to the console 
1781 		 */
1782 		print : function() {
1783 			
1784 			if (console) console.log(this.root.asTree(false));
1785 			return this;
1786 		},
1787 		
1788 		/**
1789 		 * Loads a text string into the model after tokenizing it.
1790 		 * 
1791 		 * @param {string} text the string
1792 		 * @param {number} multiplier Weighting for text (optional, default=1) 
1793 		 * @param {string | regex} a regular expression to be used for tokenizing
1794 		 *   (optional, if not supplied, uses RiTa.tokenize())
1795 		 * @see RiTa.tokenize
1796 		 * @returns {object} this RiMarkov
1797 		 */
1798 		loadText : function(text, multiplier, regex) {
1799 
1800 			ok(text,S);
1801 
1802 			multiplier = multiplier || 1;
1803 
1804 			if (multiplier < 1 || multiplier != Math.floor(multiplier))
1805 		    	err('multiplier must be an positive integer, found: '+multiplier); 
1806 
1807 			if (this.sentenceAware) 
1808 				return this._loadSentences(RiTa.splitSentences(text), multiplier);       
1809 			else        
1810 				return this.loadTokens(RiTa.tokenize(text,regex), multiplier);
1811 		},
1812 		
1813 		/**
1814 		 * Loads an array of tokens (or words) into the model; each 
1815 		 * element in the array must be a single token for proper 
1816 		 * construction of the model. 
1817 		 * 
1818 		 * @param {array} tokens the strings with which to load the model 
1819 		 * @param {number} multiplier Weighting for tokens in the array (optional, default=1)
1820 		 * @returns {object} this RiMarkov
1821 		 */
1822 		loadTokens: function(tokens, multiplier) {
1823 
1824 			multiplier = multiplier || 1;
1825 
1826 			if (multiplier < 1 || multiplier != Math.floor(multiplier))
1827 		    	err('multiplier must be an positive integer, found: '+multiplier); 
1828 
1829 			this.root.count += tokens.length; // here?
1830 			for(var toAdd, k = 0; k < tokens.length; k++) {
1831 				toAdd = [];
1832 
1833 				for(var j = 0; j < this._n; j++) {
1834 					if ((k + j) < tokens.length) toAdd[j] = (!undef(tokens[k + j])) ? tokens[k + j] : null;
1835 					else toAdd[j] = null;
1836 				}
1837 
1838 				// hack to deal with multiplier...
1839 				for(var l = 0; l < multiplier; l++) {
1840 
1841 					var node = this.root;
1842 					for(var i = 0; i < toAdd.length; i++) {
1843 						if (node.token) node = node.addChild(toAdd[i], this.smoothing ? 2 : 1);
1844 					}
1845 				}
1846 			}
1847 
1848 			return this;
1849 		},
1850 		
1851    
1852 		/**
1853 		 * Generates some # (one or more) of sentences from the model.<P>
1854 		 * Note: multiple sentences generated by this method WILL follow
1855 		 * the model across sentence boundaries; thus the following two calls
1856 		 * are NOT equivalent:<pre>
1857 			String[] results = markov.generateSentences(10);
1858 				and
1859 			for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
1860 				results[i] = markov.generateSentence(1);</pre>
1861 		 * The latter will create 10 sentences with no explicit relationship
1862 		 * between one and the next; while the former will follow probabilities
1863 		 * from one sentence (across a boundary) to the next.
1864 		 */
1865 
1866 		generateSentences: function(num) {
1867 
1868 			if (!this.recognizeSentences) 
1869 				err("Illegal: call to generateSentences() while generateSentences=false");
1870 
1871 			var s, result = [],
1872 				counter = 0,
1873 				totalTries = 0,
1874 				wordsInSentence = 1;
1875 
1876 			// find a token to start from
1877 			var mn = this._getSentenceStart();
1878 
1879 			if (!mn) err("Unable to find start node! genSen=" + this.sentenceAware);
1880 
1881 			s.append(mn.getToken() + " ");
1882 
1883 			var tries = 0;
1884 			while(counter < numSentences) {
1885 				if (wordsInSentence >= this._getMaxSentenceLength() || !mn) { // too long, start over
1886 					//System.out.println("MarkovModel.generateSentences() L:: toolong");
1887 					wordsInSentence = 0;
1888 					s = E;
1889 				}
1890 
1891 				if (mn.isLeaf()) {
1892 					mn = this.tracePathFromRoot(mn);
1893 					continue;
1894 				}
1895 
1896 				mn = nextNode(mn);
1897 				if (mn.isSentenceStart()) {
1898 					if (wordsInSentence >= this._getMinSentenceLength()) {
1899 						var candidate = this._checkPunctuation(s.toString());
1900 						if (candidate && this._validateSentence(candidate)) {
1901 							// got one, store and reset the counters
1902 							result[counter++] = candidate;
1903 							formattotalTries += tries;
1904 							tries = 0;
1905 						} else {
1906 							log("MarkovModel.generateSentences() L:: reject");
1907 							candidate = E;
1908 						}
1909 					}
1910 					wordsInSentence = 0;
1911 					s = E;
1912 				}
1913 				wordsInSentence++;
1914 				s.append(mn.getToken() + " ");
1915 
1916 				//System.out.println("adding: "+mn);
1917 				if (++tries >= MAX_GENERATION_ATTEMPTS) {
1918 					totalTries += tries;
1919 					this._onGenerationIncomplete(totalTries, counter);
1920 
1921 					for(var i = 0; i < result.length; i++)
1922 					if (!result[i]) result[i] = "";
1923 
1924 					break; // give-up
1925 				}
1926 			}
1927 
1928 			return result;
1929 		},
1930 		
1931 		_clean: function(sentence) {
1932 
1933 			return RiTa.trim(sentence.replace('\s+', ' '));
1934 		},
1935 
1936 		/**
1937 		 * Loads an array of sentences into the model; each
1938 		 * element in the array must be a single sentence for
1939 		 * proper parsing.
1940 		 */ 
1941 		_loadSentences : function(sentences, multiplier) {
1942 
1943 			var i, j, tokens, sentence, allWords = [], printIgnoredText = true;
1944 
1945 			// do the cleaning/splitting first ---------------------
1946 
1947 			for (i = 0; i < sentences.length; i++) {
1948 				
1949 				sentence = this._clean(sentences[i]);
1950 				
1951 				// do we need this?
1952 				if (!this.allowDuplicates) {
1953 					this.sentenceList.push(sentence);
1954 				}
1955 				
1956 				tokens = RiTa.tokenize(sentence);
1957 				
1958 				//wordCount += tokens.length;
1959 				
1960 				if (!this._validSentenceStart(tokens[0])) {
1961 					if (printIgnoredText)
1962 						warn("[WARN] Skipping (bad sentence start): " + tokens);
1963 					continue;
1964 				}
1965 				
1966 				allWords.push(this.ssDelim + tokens[0]);
1967 				
1968 				j = 1; // awful hack
1969 				for (; j < tokens.length; j++)
1970 					allWords.push(tokens[j]);
1971 
1972 				return this;
1973 			}
1974 
1975 			// ------------------------------------------------
1976 
1977 			var toAdd, words = allWords,nFactor;
1978 			//wordsPerFile += allWords.length;
1979 			for (i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
1980 				
1981 				toAdd = [];
1982 				nFactor = this.getN();
1983 				for (j = 0; j < nFactor; j++) {
1984 					if ((i + j) < words.length)
1985 						toAdd[j] = words[i + j];
1986 				}
1987 
1988 				// hack to deal with multiplier...
1989 				for (j = 0; j < multiplier; j++)
1990 					this._addSentenceSequence(toAdd);
1991 			}
1992 		},
1993 		
1994 		_validSentenceStart : function(word) {      
1995  
1996 			return (!this.recognizeSentences || word.match(this.ssRegex)); 
1997 		},
1998 		
1999 		addSentenceSequence: function(toAdd) {
2000 
2001 			var node = root;
2002 
2003 			for(var i = 0; i < toAdd.length; i++) {
2004 
2005 				if (!toAdd[i]) continue;
2006 
2007 				if (node.getToken()) {
2008 
2009 					var add = toAdd[i];
2010 
2011 					if (add.startsWith(SS_DELIM)) {
2012 
2013 						add = add.substring(this.ssDelim.length); // ??
2014 						var parent = node;
2015 
2016 						node = node.addChild(add, this.useSmoothing ? 2 : 1);
2017 						node.setIsSentenceStart(true);
2018 
2019 						if (parent.isRoot()) {
2020 							this.sentenceStarts.add(node.getToken());
2021 						}
2022 
2023 					} else 
2024 						node = node.addChild(add, this.useSmoothing ? 2 : 1);
2025 				}
2026 			}
2027 		},
2028 		
2029 
2030 		_getSentenceStart : function() {
2031 			
2032 			if (!this.sentenceStarts || this.sentenceStarts.length < 1) {
2033 				console.warn('no sentence starts found!');
2034 				return null;
2035 			}
2036 				
2037 			var idx = Math.floor(Math.random() * this.sentenceStarts.length); 
2038 			
2039 			return root.lookup(this.sentenceStarts[idx]);
2040 		},
2041 
2042 		_findNode: function(path) {
2043 
2044 			//log("RiMarkov.findNode("+path.toString()+")");
2045 
2046 			if (!path || !is(path, A) || !path.length) 
2047 				return null;
2048 
2049 			var nFactor = this._n;
2050 			var numNodes = Math.min(path.length, nFactor - 1);
2051 			var firstLookupIdx = Math.max(0, path.length - (nFactor - 1));
2052 			var node = this.root.lookup(path[firstLookupIdx++]);
2053 
2054 			if (!node) return null;
2055 
2056 			var idx = 0; // found at least one good node
2057 			var nodes = [];
2058 			nodes[idx++] = node;
2059 			for (var i = firstLookupIdx; i < path.length; i++) {
2060 				node = node.lookup(path[i]);
2061 				if (!node) return null;
2062 				nodes[idx++] = node;
2063 			}
2064 
2065 			return nodes ? nodes[nodes.length - 1] : null;
2066 		},
2067 		
2068 		_nextNode: function(previousTokens) {
2069 
2070 			// Follow the seed path down the tree
2071 			var firstLookupIdx = Math.max(0, previousTokens.length - (this._n - 1)),
2072 				node = this.root.lookup(previousTokens[firstLookupIdx++]);
2073 
2074 			for(var i = firstLookupIdx; i < previousTokens.length; i++) {
2075 
2076 				if (node) node = node.lookup(previousTokens[i]);
2077 			}
2078 
2079 			// Now select the next node
2080 			return node ? node.selectChild(null, true) : null;
2081 		}
2082 	}
2083 	
2084 	///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2085 	// RiTaEvent class 
2086 	///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2087 	
2088 	/**
2089 	 * @name RiTaEvent
2090 	 * 
2091 	 * @class A simple wrapper for event-based callbacks 
2092 	 */
2093 	/*
2094 	 * @example A typical usage might be to switch on the type 
2095 	 * of a RiTaEvent within a callback:
2096 	 <pre>
2097 	 function onRiTaEvent(e)
2098 		{
2099 		  if (e.getSource() == RiTa.BEHAVIOR_COMPLETED)
2100 			// ...
2101 		  else 
2102 			// ...
2103 		}<pre>
2104 	 */   
2105 	var RiTaEvent = makeClass();
2106 	
2107 	RiTaEvent._callbacksDisabled = false;
2108 	
2109 	RiTaEvent.prototype = {
2110 		
2111 		/**
2112 		 * Contructs a new RiTaEvent object with a source and type
2113 		 */
2114 		init : function(sourceRiText, eventType) {
2115 			
2116 			ok(sourceRiText,O);
2117 			
2118 			var fn = RiTaEvent.prototype.init;
2119 			if (!fn.ID) fn.ID = 0;
2120 			this._id = ++(fn.ID);
2121 			
2122 			this._source = sourceRiText;
2123 			this._type = eventType || RiTa.UNKNOWN;
2124 			//this._data = data;
2125 		},
2126 		
2127 		
2128 		/** @private  */
2129 		toString : function() {
2130 			
2131 			return "RiTaEvent[#"+this._id+" type="+this._type+
2132 				" src="+this._source.toString()+"]";//+", data="+this._data+"]";
2133 		},
2134 		
2135 		/**
2136 		 * Gets the source for this event
2137 		 * @returns {object} the source
2138 		 */
2139 		getSource : function() {
2140 			
2141 			return this._source;  
2142 		},
2143 		
2144 		/**
2145 		 * Gets the type for this event
2146 		 * @returns {string} the type
2147 		 */
2148 		getType : function() {
2149 			
2150 			return this._type;  
2151 		},
2152 		
2153 		/**
2154 		 * Fires an event and directs it to the appropriate callback implementation
2155 		 * @param callback
2156 		 */
2157 		_fire: function(callback) {
2158 
2159 			callback = callback || window.onRiTaEvent || (RiText.graphics() && RiText.graphics().onRiTaEvent); 
2160 																				// last is for P5
2161 			//if (typeof callback === 'function') {
2162 			if (is(callback,F)) {
2163 
2164 				try {
2165 					
2166 					callback.apply(this, [this]); // first arg should be ??
2167 
2168 				} catch(err) {
2169 
2170 					RiTaEvent._callbacksDisabled = true; 
2171 					warn("RiTaEvent: error calling '"+callback+"': " + err);
2172 					throw err;
2173 				}
2174 			} 
2175 			else if (!RiTaEvent._callbacksDisabled) {
2176 
2177 				// TODO: Consider REMOVE THIS ?
2178 				callback = callback || 'onRiTaEvent(e) { ... }';
2179 				warn("RiTaEvent: no '"+callback+"' callback found...");
2180 				RiTaEvent._callbacksDisabled = true;
2181 			}
2182 		}
2183 	}
2184 	
2185 	
2186 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2187 	// RiLexicon
2188 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2189 	
2190 	/**
2191 	 * @name RiLexicon
2192 	 * 
2193 	 * @class The core 'dictionary' (or lexicon) for the RiTa tools. 
2194 	 * <p>
2195 	 * It contains ~40,000 words augmented with phonemic and syllabic data, as well as a list of valid parts-of-speech for each. 
2196 	 * The lexicon can be extended and/or customized for additional words, usages, or pronunciations.
2197 	 * 
2198 	 * <p> Additionally the lexicon is equipped with implementations of a variety of matching algorithms 
2199 	 * (min-edit-distance, soundex, anagrams, alliteration, rhymes, looks-like, etc.) 
2200 	 * based on combinations of letters, syllables and phonemes.
2201 	 * <p>
2202 	 * Note: For performance, the data for RiLexicon is shared in a single location for ALL created instances (static)
2203 	 * <p> 
2204 	 * Note: If you wish to modify or customize the lexicon (e.g., add words, or change pronunciations) 
2205 	 * you can do so directly, by editing the 'rita_dict.js' file, or programatically, via addWord() & removeWord()
2206 	 *
2207 	 * @example
2208 		var lex = new RiLexicon(this);
2209 		var similars = lex.similarBySound("cat");
2210 		var rhymes = lex.getSimpleRhymes("cat");
2211 		// etc.
2212 	 */
2213 	var RiLexicon = makeClass();
2214 
2215 	
2216 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2217 	// Static functions
2218 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2219 	
2220 	/**
2221 	 * Returns the singleton instance of RiLexicon
2222 	 */
2223 	RiLexicon._getInstance = function() { // Do we need this? 
2224 
2225 		var lexicon; 
2226 		
2227 		try {
2228 			lexicon = new RiLexicon();
2229 		}
2230 		catch(e) {
2231 			err("No RiTa lexicon found! Have you included 'rita_dict.js'?");
2232 		}
2233 		
2234 		RiLexicon._getInstance = function() {
2235 			return lexicon;
2236 		};
2237 		
2238 		return lexicon;
2239 	};
2240 
2241 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2242 	// Static variables
2243 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2244    
2245 	
2246 	/** @private */
2247 	RiLexicon.data = undefined; // shared static var
2248 	
2249 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2250 	// Member functions
2251 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2252 	
2253 	RiLexicon.prototype = {
2254 		
2255 		/**
2256 		 * Constructs a (singleton) instance of the RiLexicon class.
2257 		 * <p> 
2258 		 * Note: For performance, the data for all RiLexicon instances
2259 		 * is shared (there is only 1 copy)
2260 		 */
2261 		init: function() {
2262 
2263 			if (!RiLexicon.data) {
2264 
2265 				if (typeof _RiTa_DICT != 'undefined') {
2266 
2267 					log('[RiTa] Loaded lexicon data...');
2268 
2269 					RiLexicon.data = {}; // TODO: test perf. of this
2270 					for (var word in _RiTa_DICT) {
2271 						RiLexicon.data[word] = _RiTa_DICT[word];
2272 					}
2273 				} else {
2274 
2275 					err("Dictionary not found! Make sure to add it to your .html:" + ", e.g.,\n\n    <script src=\"path/to/rita_dict.js\"></script>");
2276 				}
2277 			}
2278 		},
2279 	
2280 		
2281 		/** Clears the lexicon */
2282 		clear : function() {
2283 			
2284 			RiLexicon.data = undefined;
2285 			
2286 			for (var word in RiLexicon.data) 
2287 				delete RiLexicon.data[word];
2288 		},
2289 	 
2290 		/**
2291 		 * Adds a word to the current lexicon. Note: will replace the word if it already exists
2292 		 *
2293 		 * @example lexicon.addWord('abandon','ax-b ae1-n-d ax-n','vb nn vbp');
2294 		 * 
2295 		 * @param {string} word
2296 		 * @param {string} pronunciationData
2297 		 * @param {string} posData
2298 		 * 
2299 		 * @returns {object} this RiLexicon  
2300 		 */
2301 		addWord : function(word, pronunciationData, posData) {
2302 			
2303 			RiLexicon.data[word.toLowerCase()] = [pronunciationData.toLowerCase(), posData.toLowerCase()];
2304 			return this;
2305 		},
2306 		
2307 		/**
2308 		 * Removes a word from the current lexicon 
2309 		 * 
2310 		 * @example removeWord('abandon');
2311 		 * 
2312 		 * @param {string} word
2313 		 * @returns {object} this RiLexicon  
2314 		 */
2315 		removeWord : function(word) {
2316 			
2317 			delete RiLexicon.data[word.toLowerCase()];
2318 			return this;
2319 		},
2320 		
2321 		/**
2322 		 * Compares the characters of the input string  (using a version of the min-edit distance algorithm)
2323 		 * to each word in the lexicon, returning the set of closest matches.        
2324 		 * 
2325 		 * @param {string} word
2326 		 * @param {number} minAllowedDist minimum edit distance for matches (optional, default=1)
2327 		 * @param {boolean} preserveLength whether to return only words that match the length of the input word (optional, default=true)
2328 		 * 
2329 		 * @returns {array} matching words 
2330 		 */
2331 		similarByLetter: function(input, minAllowedDist, preserveLength) {
2332 
2333 			var minVal = Number.MAX_VALUE,
2334 				minLen = 2,
2335 				result = [];
2336 
2337 			if (!(input && input.length)) return EA;
2338 
2339 			input = input.toLowerCase();
2340 			minAllowedDist = minAllowedDist || 1;
2341 			preserveLength = preserveLength || false;
2342 
2343 			for (var entry in RiLexicon.data) {
2344 
2345 				if (preserveLength && entry.length != input.length || entry.length < minLen) 
2346 					continue;
2347 
2348 				entry = entry.toLowerCase();
2349 
2350 				if (entry == input || entry == (input + "s") || entry == (input + "es")) 
2351 					continue;
2352 
2353 				var med = MinEditDist.computeRaw(entry, input);
2354 
2355 				if (med == 0) continue; // same word
2356 
2357 				// we found something even closer
2358 				if (med >= minAllowedDist && med < minVal) {
2359 
2360 					minVal = med;
2361 					result = [entry];
2362 				}
2363 
2364 				// we have another best to add
2365 				else if (med == minVal) {
2366 					result.push(entry);
2367 				}
2368 			}
2369 
2370 			return result;
2371 		},
2372 
2373 		/**
2374 		 * Compares the phonemes of the input string 
2375 		 * (using a version of the min-edit distance algorithm)
2376 		 * to each word in the lexicon, returning the set of closest matches.        
2377 		 * 
2378 		 * @param {string} input
2379 		 * @param {number}  minEditDist (optional) minimum edit distance for matches 
2380 		 * @returns {array} matching words 
2381 		 */
2382 		similarBySound: function(input, minEditDist) { 
2383 
2384 			minEditDist = minEditDist || 1;
2385 
2386 			var minVal = Number.MAX_VALUE, entry, result = [], minLen = 2,
2387 				phonesArr, phones = RiTa.getPhonemes(input), med;
2388 
2389 			targetPhonesArr = phones ? phones.split('-') : [];
2390 
2391 			if(!targetPhonesArr[0] || !(input && input.length)) return EA;
2392 
2393 			for(entry in RiLexicon.data) {
2394 
2395 				if(entry.length < minLen) continue;
2396 
2397 				entry = entry.toLowerCase();
2398 
2399 				if(entry == input || entry == (input + "s") || entry == (input + "es")) continue;
2400 
2401 				phones = this._getRawPhones(entry);
2402 
2403 				if(!phones.length) {
2404 
2405 					phones = RiString._syllabify(LetterToSound().getPhones(entry));
2406 					if(!phones) return EA;
2407 				}
2408 
2409 				phonesArr = phones.replace(/1/g, "").replace(/ /g, "-").split('-');
2410 
2411 				med = MinEditDist.computeRaw(phonesArr, targetPhonesArr);
2412 
2413 				if(med == 0) continue; // same phones 
2414 
2415 				// found something even closer
2416 				if(med >= minEditDist && med < minVal) {
2417 
2418 					minVal = med;
2419 					result = [entry];
2420 				}
2421 				// another best to add
2422 				else if(med == minVal) {
2423 
2424 					result.push(entry);
2425 				}
2426 			}
2427 
2428 			return result;
2429 		},
2430 
2431 		
2432 		/**
2433 		 * Returns all valid substrings of the input word in the lexicon 
2434 		 *
2435 		 * @param {string} word
2436 		 * @param {number} minLength (optional, default=4) minimum length of return word 
2437 		 * @returns {array} matching words 
2438 		 */
2439 		substrings: function(word, minLength) { 
2440 			
2441 			minLength = minLength || (minLength === 0) || 4;
2442 			
2443 			var entry, result =[];
2444 			for  (entry in RiLexicon.data){
2445 				if (entry == word || entry.length < minLength ) continue;        
2446 				if (word.indexOf(entry) >=0) result.push(entry);
2447 			}
2448 			
2449 			return result;
2450 		},
2451 		
2452 		/**
2453 		 * Returns all valid superstrings of the input word in the lexicon 
2454 		 *
2455 		 * @param {string} word
2456 		 * @returns {array} matching words 
2457 		 */
2458 		superstrings: function(word) { 
2459 			
2460 			var entry, result =[];
2461 			
2462 			for  (entry in RiLexicon.data){
2463 				if (entry == word) continue;
2464 				if (entry.indexOf(word) >= 0) result.push(entry);
2465 			}
2466 			
2467 			return result;
2468 		},
2469 		
2470 		/**
2471 		 * First calls similarBySound(), then filters the result set by the algorithm 
2472 		 * used in similarByLetter(); 
2473 		 * 
2474 		 * (useful when similarBySound() returns too large a result set)
2475 		 * 
2476 		 * @param {string} word
2477 		 * @returns {array} matching words 
2478 		 */
2479 		similarBySoundAndLetter: function(word) { 
2480 			
2481 			var simSound, simLetter, result = [];
2482 
2483 			simSound = this.similarBySound(word);
2484 			simLetter = this.similarByLetter(word);
2485 			
2486 			// if (undef(minEditDist)) {
2487 				
2488 			// 	simSound = this.similarBySound(word);
2489 			// 	simLetter = this.similarByLetter(word);
2490 			// } 
2491 			// else {
2492 				
2493 			// 	simSound = this.similarBySound(word,minEditDist);
2494 			// 	simLetter = this.similarByLetter(word,minEditDist);
2495 			// }
2496 
2497 			if (undef(simSound) || undef(simLetter)) 
2498 				return result;
2499 			
2500 			for (var i=0; i<simSound.length; i++) {
2501 				
2502 				for (var j=0; j<simLetter.length; j++) {
2503 					
2504 					if (simSound[i] == simLetter[j]) 
2505 						result.push(simLetter[j]);
2506 				}
2507 			}
2508 			
2509 			return result;
2510 		},
2511 		
2512 		/**
2513 		 * Returns the array of all words in the lexicon or those matching a specific regex. 
2514 		 * If specified, the order of the result array is randomized before return.
2515 		 *  
2516 		 * @param {regex} regex (string or object) pattern to match (optional)
2517 		 * @param {boolean} sorted In sorted order when true (default=false)
2518 		 * @returns {array} words in the RiLexicon  
2519 		 */
2520 		words : function() {
2521 			
2522 			var a = arguments, sorted = false, regex = undefined, 
2523 				wordArr = [], words =  okeys(RiLexicon.data);
2524 			
2525 			switch (a.length) {
2526 				
2527 				case 2:
2528 					
2529 					if (is(a[0],B)) {
2530 						sorted = a[0];
2531 						regex = (is(a[1],R)) ? a[1] : new RegExp(a[1]);
2532 					} 
2533 					else {
2534 						sorted = a[1];
2535 						regex = (is(a[0],R)) ? a[0] : new RegExp(a[0]);
2536 					}
2537 
2538 					break;
2539 					
2540 				case 1:
2541 										
2542 					if (is(a[0],B)) {
2543 						return a[0] ? shuffle(words) : okeys(words);
2544 					}
2545 					
2546 					regex = (is(a[0],R)) ? a[0] : new RegExp(a[0]);
2547 					
2548 					break;
2549 					
2550 				case 0:
2551 					
2552 					return shuffle(words);
2553 			}
2554 
2555 			for (var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
2556 				
2557 				if (words[i].match(regex)) {
2558 					
2559 					wordArr.push(words[i]);
2560 				}
2561 			}
2562 			
2563 			// TODO: make sure we have a test for both sorted=false/true
2564 
2565 			return sorted ? wordArr : shuffle(wordArr);  
2566 		},
2567 		
2568 		/**
2569 		 * Returns true if c is a vowel
2570 		 * @param {char} c
2571 		 * @returns {boolean}
2572 		 */
2573 		_isVowel : function(c) {
2574 
2575 			return (strOk(c) && RiTa.VOWELS.indexOf(c) > -1);
2576 		},
2577 
2578 		/**
2579 		 * Returns true if c is a consonant
2580 		 * @param {char} p
2581 		 * @returns {boolean}
2582 		 */
2583 		_isConsonant : function(p) {
2584 
2585 			return (typeof p == S && p.length==1 && 
2586 				RiTa.VOWELS.indexOf(p) < 0 && /^[a-z\u00C0-\u00ff]+$/.test(p));  
2587 		},
2588 
2589 		/**
2590 		 * Returns true if the word exists in the lexicon (case-insensitive)
2591 		 * @param {string} word
2592 		 * @returns {boolean} 
2593 		 */
2594 		containsWord : function(word) {
2595 
2596 			return (strOk(word) && RiLexicon.data && !undef(RiLexicon.data[word.toLowerCase()]));
2597 		},
2598 		
2599 		/**
2600 		 * Returns true if the two words rhyme, that is, if their final stressed phoneme 
2601 		 * and all following phonemes are identical, else false.
2602 		 * <p>
2603 		 * Note: returns false if word1.equals(word2) or if either (or both) are null;
2604 		 * <p>
2605 		 * Note: at present doesn't use letter-to-sound engine if either word is not found in the lexicon, 
2606 		 * but instead just returns false. 
2607 		 * 
2608 		 * @param {string} word1
2609 		 * @param {string} word2
2610 		 * 
2611 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the two words rhyme, else false.
2612 		 */
2613 		isRhyme : function(word1, word2) {
2614 
2615 			if ( !strOk(word1) || !strOk(word2) || equalsIgnoreCase(word1, word2))
2616 				return false;
