2617 			
2618 			var p1 = this._lastStressedPhoneToEnd(word1), 
2619 				p2 = this._lastStressedPhoneToEnd(word2);
2620 			
2621 			return (strOk(p1) && strOk(p2) && p1 === p2);  
2622 		},
2623 
2624 		/**
2625 		 * 
2626 		 * Two words rhyme if their final stressed vowel and all following phonemes are identical.
2627 		 * @param {string} word
2628 		 * @returns {array} strings of the rhymes for a given word, or empty array if none are found
2629 		 */
2630 		rhymes : function(word) {
2631 
2632 			//this._buildWordlist_();
2633 
2634 			if (this.containsWord(word)) {
2635 
2636 				var p = this._lastStressedPhoneToEnd(word);
2637 				var entry, entryPhones, results = [];
2638 
2639 				for (entry in RiLexicon.data) {
2640 					if (entry === word)
2641 						continue;
2642 					entryPhones = this._getRawPhones(entry);
2643 
2644 					if (strOk(entryPhones) && endsWith(entryPhones, p)) {
2645 						results.push(entry);
2646 					}
2647 				}
2648 				return (results.length > 0) ? results : EA; 
2649 			}
2650 			
2651 			return EA; 
2652 		},
2653 
2654 		/**
2655 		 * Finds alliterations by comparing the phonemes of the input string to those of each word in the lexicon
2656 		 * 
2657 		 * @param {string} word input
2658 		 * @returns {array} strings of alliterations
2659 		 */
2660 		alliterations : function(word) {
2661 
2662 			if (this.containsWord(word)) {
2663 
2664 				var c2, entry, results = [];
2665 				var c1 = this._firstConsonant(this._firstStressedSyllable(word));
2666 
2667 				for (entry in RiLexicon.data) {
2668 					
2669 					c2 = this._firstConsonant(this._firstStressedSyllable(entry));
2670 					
2671 					if (c2 && c1 === c2) {
2672 						results.push(entry);
2673 					}
2674 				}
2675 				return (results.length > 0) ? results : EA; 
2676 			}
2677 			return EA;
2678 		},
2679 
2680 		/**
2681 		 * Returns true if the first stressed consonant of the two words match, else false.
2682 		 * 
2683 		 * @param {string} word1
2684 		 * @param {string} word2
2685 		 * @returns {boolean} true if word1.equals(word2) and false if either (or both) are null;
2686 		 */
2687 		isAlliteration : function(word1, word2) {
2688 
2689 			if (!strOk(word1) || !strOk(word2)) return false;
2690 
2691 			if (equalsIgnoreCase(word1, word2)) return true;
2692 
2693 			var c1 = this._firstConsonant(this._firstStressedSyllable(word1)),
2694 				c2 = this._firstConsonant(this._firstStressedSyllable(word2));
2695 
2696 			//log("'"+c1+"'=?'"+c2+"'");
2697 			
2698 			return (strOk(c1) && strOk(c2) && c1 === c2);  
2699 		},
2700 
2701 		/**
2702 		 * Returns the first stressed syllable of the input word
2703 		 * @param {string} word
2704 		 * @returns {string}   
2705 		 */
2706 		_firstStressedSyllable : function(word) {
2707 
2708 			var raw = this._getRawPhones(word), idx = -1, c, firstToEnd;
2709 
2710 			if (!strOk(raw)) return E; // return null?
2711 			
2712 			idx = raw.indexOf(RiTa.STRESSED);
2713 
2714 			if (idx < 0) return E; // no stresses... return null?
2715 			
2716 			c = raw.charAt(--idx);
2717 
2718 			while (c != ' ') {
2719 				if (--idx < 0) {
2720 					// single-stressed syllable
2721 					idx = 0;
2722 					break;
2723 				}
2724 				c = raw.charAt(idx);
2725 			}
2726 			
2727 			firstToEnd = idx === 0 ? raw : trim(raw.substring(idx));
2728 			idx = firstToEnd.indexOf(' ');
2729 
2730 			return idx < 0 ? firstToEnd : firstToEnd.substring(0, idx);
2731 		},
2732 		
2733 		/**  
2734 		 * Returns true for 'word' if it has a verb form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech 
2735 		 *  are any variant of a verb in the PENN part-of-speech tag set (e.g. vb, vbg, vbd, vbp, vbz));
2736 		 * @param {string} word the PENN part-of-speech tag
2737 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the word can be used as a verb 
2738 		 */
2739 		isVerb: function(word) {
2740 
2741 			return this._checkType(word, PosTagger.VERBS);
2742 		},
2743  
2744 		
2745 		/**
2746 		 * Returns true for 'word' if it has a noun form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech 
2747 		 *  are any variant of a noun in the PENN part-of-speech tag set(e.g. nn, nns, nnp, nnps)
2748 		 * @param {string} word the PENN part-of-speech tag
2749 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the word can be used as a noun
2750 		 */
2751 		isNoun : function(word) {
2752 
2753 			return this._checkType(word, PosTagger.NOUNS);
2754 		},
2755 		
2756 		/**
2757 		 * Returns true for 'word' if it has an adverb form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech 
2758 		 *  are any variant of an adverb in the PENN part-of-speech tag set (e.g. rb, rbr, rbs)
2759 		 * @param {string} word the PENN part-of-speech tag
2760 		 * @returns boolean} true if the word can be used as an adverb 
2761 		 */
2762 		isAdverb : function(word) {
2763 			//log("isAdverb("+word+")");
2764 			return this._checkType(word, PosTagger.ADV);
2765 		},
2766 		
2767 		/**
2768 		 * Returns true for 'word' if it has an adjective form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech 
2769 		 *  are any variant of an adjective in the PENN part-of-speech tag set (e.g. jj, jjr, jjs)
2770 		 * @param {string} word the PENN part-of-speech tag
2771 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the word can be used as an adjective 
2772 		 */
2773 		isAdjective : function(word) {
2774 			
2775 			return this._checkType(word, PosTagger.ADJ);
2776 		},
2777 		
2778 		
2779 		/**
2780 		 * Returns the number of words currently in the lexicon 
2781 		 * @returns {number} words
2782 		 */
2783 		size : function() {
2784 			
2785 			return RiLexicon.data ? okeys(RiLexicon.data).length : 0
2786 		},
2787 
2788 		_checkType: function(word, tagArray) {
2789 
2790 			if (word && word.indexOf(SP) != -1) 
2791 				 throw Error("_checkType() expects a single word, found: "+word); 
2792 
2793 			var psa = this._getPosArr(word);
2794 			for (var i = 0; i < psa.length; i++) {
2795 				if (tagArray.indexOf(psa[i].toUpperCase()) > -1)
2796 					return true;
2797 			} 
2798 			
2799 			return false;  
2800 		 },
2801 		 
2802 		/**
2803 		 * Returns a String containing the phonemes for each syllable of each word of the input text, 
2804 		 * delimited by dashes (phonemes) and semi-colons (words). For example, the 4 syllables of the phrase 
2805 		 * 'The dog ran fast' is "dh-ax:d-ao-g:r-ae-n:f-ae-s-t".
2806 		 * 
2807 		 * @param {string} word
2808 		 * 
2809 		 * @returns {string} the phonemes for each syllable of each word
2810 		 */
2811 		_getSyllables : function(word) {
2812 			
2813 			if (!strOk(word)) return E;
2814 			
2815 			var wordArr = RiTa.tokenize((word)), phones, raw = [];
2816 			
2817 			for (var i=0; i< wordArr.length; i++) {
2818 				
2819 				raw[i] = this._getRawPhones(wordArr[i]).replace(/ /g, "/");
2820 			}
2821 			
2822 			return RiTa.untokenize(raw).replace(/1/g, E).trim();
2823 		},
2824 
2825 		/**
2826 		 * Returns a String containing all phonemes for the input text, delimited by semi-colons
2827 		 * 
2828 		 * @example "dh:ax:d:ao:g:r:ae:n:f:ae:s:t"
2829 		 * 
2830 		 * @param {string} word
2831 		 * 
2832 		 * @returns {string} all phonemes,
2833 		 */
2834 		_getPhonemes : function(word) {
2835 
2836 			if (!strOk(word)) return E;
2837 			
2838 			var wordArr = RiTa.tokenize(word), raw = [];
2839 			
2840 			for (var i=0; i< wordArr.length; i++)
2841 			{
2842 
2843 				if (RiTa.isPunctuation(wordArr[i])) continue;
2844 
2845 				// raw[i] = wordArr[i].length
2846 				raw[i] = this._getRawPhones(wordArr[i]);
2847 
2848 				if (!raw[i].length) return E;
2849 					//err("Unable to lookup (need LTSEngine): "+wordArr[i]);
2850 
2851 				raw[i] = raw[i].replace(/ /g, "-");
2852 			}
2853 
2854 			return RiTa.untokenize(raw).replace(/1/g, E).trim(); 
2855 		},
2856 
2857 		/**
2858 		 * Returns a String containing the stresses for each syllable of the input text, delimited by semi-colons, 
2859 		 * @example "0:1:0:1", with 1's meaning 'stressed', and 0's meaning 'unstressed', 
2860 		 * 
2861 		 * @param {string} word
2862 		 * 
2863 		 * @returns {string} stresses for each syllable
2864 		 */
2865 		_getStresses : function(word) {
2866 
2867 			var stresses = [], phones, raw = [],
2868 				wordArr = is(word,A) ? word : RiTa.tokenize(word);
2869 
2870 			if (!strOk(word)) return E;
2871 			
2872 			for (var i=0; i< wordArr.length; i++) {
2873 				
2874 				if (!RiTa.isPunctuation(wordArr[i]))
2875 					raw[i] = this._getRawPhones(wordArr[i]);
2876 			}
2877 
2878 			for (var i = 0; i < raw.length; i++) {
2879 
2880 				if (raw[i]) { // ignore undefined array items (eg Punctuation)
2881 					
2882 					phones = raw[i].split(SP);
2883 					for (var j = 0; j < phones.length; j++) {
2884 
2885 						var isStress = (phones[j].indexOf(RiTa.STRESSED) > -1) 
2886 							? RiTa.STRESSED : RiTa.UNSTRESSED;
2887 						
2888 						if (j > 0) isStress = "/" + isStress;
2889 
2890 						stresses.push(isStress);            
2891 					}
2892 				}
2893 			}
2894 			
2895 			return stresses.join(SP).replace(/ \//g, "/");
2896 		},
2897 		
2898 		
2899 		/**
2900 		 * Allows one to set/get the raw dictionary data used to create the default lexicon.
2901 		 * See RiLexicon.addWord() for data format
2902 		 * 
2903 		 * @param {object} dictionaryDataObject mapping words to their pronunciation/pos data (optional, for sets only)
2904 		 * @returns {object} this RiLexicon or lexical data (for gets)
2905 		 */
2906 		lexicalData : function(dictionaryDataObject) {
2907 
2908 			
2909 			if (arguments.length == 1) {
2910 				RiLexicon.data = dictionaryDataObject;
2911 				return this;
2912 			}
2913 
2914 			return RiLexicon.data;
2915 		},
2916 		
2917 		/**
2918 		 * Returns the raw (RiTa-format) dictionary entry for the given word 
2919 		 * 
2920 		 * @param {string} word
2921 		 * 
2922 		 * @returns {array} a 2-element array of strings, 
2923 		 * the first is the stress and syllable data, 
2924 		 * the 2nd is the pos data, or null if the word is not found
2925 		 */
2926 		_lookupRaw : function(word) {
2927 
2928 			word = word.toLowerCase();
2929 
2930 			if (RiLexicon.data && RiLexicon.data[word]) 
2931 				return RiLexicon.data[word];
2932 			
2933 			//log("[RiTa] No lexicon entry for '" + word + "'");
2934 			
2935 			return null;
2936 		},
2937 		
2938 
2939 		_getRawPhones : function(word) {
2940 			
2941 			var data = this._lookupRaw(word);
2942 			return (data && data.length==2) ? data[0] : E; 
2943 		},
2944 
2945 
2946 		_getPosData : function(word) {
2947 			
2948 			var data = this._lookupRaw(word);
2949 			return (data && data.length==2) ? data[1] : E; 
2950 		},
2951 
2952 		
2953 		_getPosArr : function(word) { 
2954 			
2955 			var pl = this._getPosData(word);
2956 			
2957 			if (!strOk(pl)) return EA;
2958 			
2959 			return pl.split(SP);  
2960 		},
2961 
2962 		_getBestPos : function(word) { 
2963 			
2964 			var pl = this._getPosArr(word);
2965 			
2966 			return (pl.length > 0) ? pl[0] : [];
2967 		},
2968 
2969 
2970 		
2971 		_firstConsonant : function(rawPhones) {
2972 
2973 			if (!strOk(rawPhones)) return E; 
2974 			
2975 			var phones = rawPhones.split(RiTa.PHONEME_BOUNDARY);
2976 			// var phones = rawPhones.split(PHONEME_BOUNDARY);
2977 			
2978 			if (!undef(phones)) {
2979 				
2980 				for (var j = 0; j < phones.length; j++) {
2981 					if (this._isConsonant(phones[j].charAt(0))) // first letter only
2982 						return phones[j];
2983 				}
2984 			}
2985 			return E; // return null?  
2986 		},
2987 		
2988 
2989 		_lastStressedPhoneToEnd : function(word) {
2990 
2991 			if (!strOk(word)) return E; // return null?
2992 			
2993 			var idx, c, result;
2994 			var raw = this._getRawPhones(word);
2995 
2996 			if (!strOk(raw)) return E; // return null?
2997 			
2998 			idx = raw.lastIndexOf(RiTa.STRESSED);
2999 			
3000 			if (idx < 0) return E; // return null?
3001 			
3002 			c = raw.charAt(--idx);
3003 			while (c != '-' && c != ' ') {
3004 				if (--idx < 0) {
3005 					return raw; // single-stressed syllable
3006 				}
3007 				c = raw.charAt(idx);
3008 			}
3009 			result = raw.substring(idx + 1);
3010 			
3011 			return result;
3012 		},
3013 
3014 		/**
3015 		 * Returns a random word from the lexicon
3016 		 * 
3017 		 * @param {string} pos (optional)
3018 		 * @param {string} syllableCount (optional)
3019 		 * @returns {string} random word
3020 		 */
3021 		randomWord : function() {  // takes nothing, pos, syllableCount, or both 
3022 			
3023 			var found = false, a = arguments, wordArr = okeys(RiLexicon.data),
3024 				ran = Math.floor(Math.random() * okeys(RiLexicon.data).length),
3025 				ranWordArr = shuffle(wordArr);
3026 			
3027 			switch (a.length) {
3028 					
3029 				case 2: //a[0]=pos  a[1]=syllableCount
3030 					
3031 						a[0] = trim(a[0].toUpperCase()); 
3032 						
3033 						for(var j = 0; j < PosTagger.TAGS.length; j++) { 
3034 							
3035 							if (PosTagger.TAGS[j] == a[0]) found = true;
3036 						} 
3037 						
3038 						if (found) { 
3039 							
3040 							for(var i=0; i< ranWordArr.length; i++){
3041 								
3042 								var data = this._lookupRaw(ranWordArr[i]);
3043 								var posTag = RiTa.getPosTags(ranWordArr[i]);
3044 								
3045 								if (data[0].split(" ").length == a[1] && a[0] == posTag[0].toUpperCase()) {
3046 									return ranWordArr[i];
3047 								}
3048 							} 
3049 						} 
3050 						
3051 						return E;
3052 						
3053 					break;
3054 					
3055 				case 1:
3056 					
3057 					if (is(a[0],S)) { //pos
3058 						
3059 						a[0] = trim(a[0].toUpperCase()); 
3060 						
3061 						for(var j = 0; j < PosTagger.TAGS.length; j++) {
3062 							
3063 							if (PosTagger.TAGS[j] == a[0]) found = true;
3064 						} 
3065 						
3066 						if (found) { 
3067 							
3068 							for(var i=0; i< ranWordArr.length; i++){
3069 								
3070 								var posTag = RiTa.getPosTags(ranWordArr[i]);
3071 								
3072 								if (a[0] == posTag[0].toUpperCase()) {
3073 									return ranWordArr[i];
3074 								}
3075 							} 
3076 						} 
3077 					}
3078 					
3079 					else { //syllableCount    
3080 						
3081 						for(var i=0; i< ranWordArr.length; i++) {
3082 							
3083 							var data = this._lookupRaw(ranWordArr[i]);
3084 							
3085 							if (data[0].split(" ").length == a[0]) {
3086 								
3087 								return ranWordArr[i];
3088 							}
3089 						} 
3090 					}
3091 					
3092 					break;
3093 					
3094 				case 0:
3095 					
3096 					return wordArr[ran];
3097 			}
3098 			
3099 			return E;
3100 		}
3101 	}
3102 	
3103 	
3104 	var Phones =        
3105 	{
3106 		  consonants: [ 'b', 'ch', 'd', 'dh', 'f', 'g', 'hh', 'jh', 'k', 'l', 'm', 'n', 
3107 						'ng', 'p', 'r', 's', 'sh', 't', 'th', 'v', 'w', 'y', 'z', 'zh' ],
3108 
3109 		  vowels: [ 'aa', 'ae', 'ah', 'ao', 'aw', 'ax', 'ay', 'eh', 'er', 'ey', 'ih', 'iy',
3110 					'ow', 'oy', 'uh', 'uw' ],
3111 	
3112 		  onsets: [ 'p', 't', 'k', 'b', 'd', 'g', 'f', 'v', 'th', 'dh', 's', 'z', 'sh', 'ch', 'jh', 'm',
3113 					'n', 'r', 'l', 'hh', 'w', 'y', 'p r', 't r', 'k r', 'b r', 'd r', 'g r', 'f r',
3114 					'th r', 'sh r', 'p l', 'k l', 'b l', 'g l', 'f l', 's l', 't w', 'k w', 'd w', 
3115 					's w', 's p', 's t', 's k', 's f', 's m', 's n', 'g w', 'sh w', 's p r', 's p l',
3116 					's t r', 's k r', 's k w', 's k l', 'th w', 'zh', 'p y', 'k y', 'b y', 'f y', 
3117 					'hh y', 'v y', 'th y', 'm y', 's p y', 's k y', 'g y', 'hh w', '' ],
3118 	
3119 		  digits: [ 'z-ih-r-ow', 'w-ah-n', 't-uw', 'th-r-iy', 'f-ao-r', 'f-ay-v', 's-ih-k-s', 
3120 					's-eh1-v-ax-n', 'ey-t', 'n-ih-n' ]
3121 	}
3122 	
3123 	////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3124 	// RiString
3125 	////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3126 	
3127 	
3128 	/**
3129 	 * @name RiString
3130 	 * 
3131 	 * @class The basic text container object, implementing a variety of 
3132 	 * additional functionality atop the javascript string object
3133 	 */
3134 	var RiString = makeClass();
3135 
3136 	
3137 	/**
3138 	 *  Syllabifies the input, given a string or array of phonemes in CMUpronunciation dictionary format 
3139 	 *   (with optional stress numbers after vowels), e.g. "B AE1 T" or ["B", "AE1", "T"]'''
3140 	 *       
3141 	 *  @param {string or array} input containing
3142 	 *  @returns {string} 
3143 	 */
3144 	RiString._syllabify = function(input) {
3145 	   
3146 		var dbug, None=undefined, internuclei = [], syllables = [],   // returned data structure.
3147 			sylls = ((typeof (input) == 'string') ? input.split('-') : input);
3148 
3149 		for (var i = 0; i < sylls.length; i++) {
3150 		
3151 			var phoneme = sylls[i].trim(), stress = None;
3152 
3153 			if (!phoneme.length) continue;
3154 			
3155 			if ( isNum(last(phoneme)) ) {
3156 				
3157 				stress = parseInt(last(phoneme));
3158 				phoneme = phoneme.substring(0, phoneme.length-1);
3159 			}
3160 			
3161 			if (dbug)console.log(i+")"+phoneme + ' stress='+stress+' inter='+internuclei.join(':'));
3162 			
3163 			if (inArray(Phones.vowels, phoneme)) {
3164 	 
3165 				// Split the consonants seen since the last nucleus into coda and onset.            
3166 				var coda = None, onset = None;
3167 				
3168 				// Make the largest onset we can. The 'split' variable marks the break point.
3169 				for (var split = 0; split < internuclei.length+1; split++) {
3170 					
3171 					coda  = internuclei.slice(0, split);
3172 					onset = internuclei.slice(split, internuclei.length);
3173 					
3174 					if (dbug)console.log('  '+split+') onset='+onset.join(':')+
3175 						'  coda='+coda.join(':')+'  inter='+internuclei.join(':'));
3176 					
3177 					// If we are looking at a valid onset, or if we're at the start of the word
3178 					// (in which case an invalid onset is better than a coda that doesn't follow
3179 					// a nucleus), or if we've gone through all of the onsets and we didn't find
3180 					// any that are valid, then split the nonvowels we've seen at this location.
3181 					var bool = inArray(Phones.onsets, onset.join(" "));
3182 					if (bool || syllables.length == 0 || onset.length == 0) {
3183 						if (dbug)console.log('  break '+phoneme);
3184 					   break;
3185 					}
3186 				}
3187 				
3188 				//if (dbug)console.log('  onset='+join(',',onset)+'  coda='+join(',',coda));
3189 				
3190 				// Tack the coda onto the coda of the last syllable. Can't do it if this
3191 				// is the first syllable.
3192 				if (syllables.length > 0 ) {
3193 					
3194 					//syllables[syllables.length-1][3] = syllables[syllables.length-1][3] || [];
3195 					//console.log('  len='+syllables[syllables.length-1][3].length);
3196 					extend(syllables[syllables.length-1][3], coda);
3197 					if (dbug) console.log('  tack: '+coda+' -> len='+syllables[syllables.length-1][3].length+" ["+syllables[syllables.length-1][3]+"]");
3198 				}
3199 				
3200 				// Make a new syllable out of the onset and nucleus.
3201 
3202 				var toPush = [ [stress], onset, [phoneme], [] ];
3203 				syllables.push(toPush);
3204 					
3205 				// At this point we've processed the internuclei list.
3206 				internuclei = [];
3207 			}
3208 			
3209 			else if (!inArray(Phones.consonants, phoneme) && phoneme != " ") {
3210 				throw Error('Invalid phoneme: ' + phoneme);
3211 			}
3212 				
3213 			else { // a consonant
3214 				
3215 				//console.log('inter.push: '+phoneme);
3216 				internuclei.push(phoneme)
3217 			}
3218 		}
3219 	  
3220 		
3221 		// Done looping through phonemes. We may have consonants left at the end.
3222 		// We may have even not found a nucleus.
3223 		if (internuclei.length > 0) {
3224 
3225 			if (syllables.length == 0) {
3226 				
3227 				syllables.push([ [None], internuclei, [], [] ]);
3228 			}
3229 			else {
3230 				
3231 				extend(syllables[syllables.length-1][3], internuclei);
3232 			}
3233 				
3234 		}
3235 
3236 		return RiString._stringify(syllables);
3237 	}
3238 	  
3239 	/*
3240 	 * Takes a syllabification and turns it into a string of phonemes, 
3241 	 * delimited with dashes, and spaces between syllables 
3242 	 */
3243 	RiString._stringify = function(syllables) {
3244 			
3245 		var ret = [];
3246 		for (var i = 0; i < syllables.length; i++) {
3247 			
3248 			var syl = syllables[i];
3249 			var stress = syl[0][0];
3250 			var onset = syl[1];
3251 			var nucleus = syl[2];
3252 			var coda = syl[3];
3253 		  
3254 			if (stress != undefined && nucleus.length) // dch
3255 				nucleus[0] += (E+stress);
3256 			
3257 			var data = [];
3258 			for (var j = 0; j < onset.length; j++) 
3259 				data.push(onset[j]);
3260 			
3261 			for (var j = 0; j < nucleus.length; j++) 
3262 			   data.push(nucleus[j]);
3263 			
3264 			for (var j = 0; j < coda.length; j++) 
3265 			   data.push(coda[j]);
3266 			
3267 			ret.push(data.join('-'));
3268 		}
3269 		
3270 		return ret.join(SP);
3271 	}
3272 	
3273 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3274 	// Member functions
3275 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3276 	
3277 	RiString.prototype = {
3278 			
3279 		/**
3280 		 * The RiString constructor function
3281 		 * 
3282 		 * @param {string} the text 
3283 		 */
3284 		init : function(text) {
3285 			
3286 			if (is(text,N)) {
3287 				
3288 				text = String.fromCharCode(text);
3289 			}
3290 			
3291 			ok(text,S);
3292 			this._text = text;
3293 			this._features = undefined;
3294 		},
3295 		
3296 		/**
3297 		 * Returns the full feature set for this object, first computing the default
3298 		 * features if necessary
3299 		 * 
3300 		 * @see #get
3301 		 * @see #analyze
3302 		 * 
3303 		 * @returns {array} the features 
3304 		 */
3305 		features : function() {
3306 			
3307 		   this._features || this.analyze();
3308 		   return this._features;
3309 		},
3310 		
3311 		/**
3312 		 * Computes a set of features for the contained string, including
3313 		 * phonemes, syllables, stresses, etc.
3314 		 * To access any of these, use get(name), e.g., 
3315 		 * 
3316 		 * @example myRiString.get('phonemes') ||  myRiString.get(RiTa.PHONEMES);
3317 		 * 
3318 		 * @returns this RiString
3319 		 */
3320 		analyze : function() {
3321 	
3322 			var phonemes = E, syllables = E, stresses = E, slash = '/',  delim = '-', raw, lts,
3323 				words = RiTa.tokenize(this._text), lts, stressyls, lex = RiLexicon._getInstance(); 
3324 				
3325 			this._features = this._features || {};
3326 			
3327 			for (var i = 0, l = words.length; i < l; i++) {
3328 				
3329 				raw = lex._getRawPhones(words[i]); 
3330 				
3331 				if (!raw) {
3332 					
3333 					if (words[i].match(/[a-zA-Z]+/))
3334 						log("[RiTa] Used LTS-rules for '"+words[i]+"'");
3335 					
3336 					  
3337 					lts = lts || LetterToSound();
3338 					raw = RiString._syllabify(lts.getPhones(words[i]));
3339 				}
3340  
3341 				phonemes += raw.replace(/[0-2]/g, E).replace(/ /g, delim) + SP;
3342 				syllables += raw.replace(/ /g, slash).replace(/1/g, E) + SP;
3343 
3344 				stressyls = raw.split(SP);   
3345 				for (var j = 0; j < stressyls.length; j++) {
3346 
3347 					if (!stressyls[j].length) continue;
3348 					
3349 					stresses += (stressyls[j].indexOf(RiTa.STRESSED) > -1) 
3350 						? RiTa.STRESSED : RiTa.UNSTRESSED;
3351 					
3352 					if (j < stressyls.length-1) stresses += slash;      
3353 				}
3354 				if (!endsWith(stresses, SP)) stresses += SP;     
3355 			}
3356 			
3357 			
3358 			this._features.stresses = stresses.trim();
3359 			this._features.phonemes = replaceAll(phonemes.trim(), " +", SP);
3360 			this._features.syllables = replaceAll(syllables.trim(), " +", SP);
3361 			
3362 			return this;
3363 		},
3364 		
3365 		/**
3366 		 * Returns the specified feature, computing it first if necessary. 
3367 		 * Default features include RiTa.STRESSES, RiTa.PHONEMES, and RiTa.SYLLABLES.
3368 		 * 
3369 		 * @example myRiString.get('phonemes') ||  myRiString.get(RiTa.PHONEMES);
3370 		 * 
3371 		 * @returns {string} the requested feature
3372 		 */
3373 		get : function(featureName) {
3374 			
3375 			this._features || this.analyze();
3376 			return this._features[featureName.toLowerCase()];  
3377 		},
3378 	
3379 
3380 		/**
3381 		 * Tests if this string ends with the specified suffix.
3382 		 * 
3383 		 * @param {string} substr string the suffix.
3384 		 * 
3385 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of
3386 		 *         the character sequence represented by this object; false otherwise.          * 
3387 		 */
3388 		endsWith : function(substr) {
3389 			
3390 			return endsWith(this._text, substr);  
3391 		},
3392 			 
3393 		/**
3394 		 * Compares this RiString to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the
3395 		 * argument is not null and is a String or RiString object that represents the same sequence 
3396 		 * of characters as this object.
3397 		 * 
3398 		 * @param {string | object} str String or RiString object to compare this RiString against
3399 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the RiString are equal; false otherwise.
3400 		 */
3401 		equals : function(arg) {
3402 			
3403 			return (typeof arg === S) ? arg === this._text :  arg.text() === this._text; 
3404 		},
3405 
3406 		/**
3407 		 * Compares this RiString to another RiString, ignoring case considerations.
3408 		 * 
3409 		 * @param {string | object} arg String or RiString object to compare this RiString against
3410 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the argument is not null and the Strings are equal, ignoring
3411 		 *         case; false otherwise.
3412 		 */
3413 		equalsIgnoreCase : function(arg) {
3414 			
3415 			if (typeof arg === S) {
3416 				
3417 				return arg.toLowerCase() === this._text.toLowerCase();
3418 			} 
3419 			else {
3420 				
3421 				return arg.text().toLowerCase() === this._text.toLowerCase();
3422 			}
3423 		},
3424 
3425 		/**
3426 		 * Gets/sets the text contained by this object
3427 		 * 
3428 		 * @param {string} text (optional)
3429 		 * 
3430 		 * @returns {object | string} the contained text (for sets) or this RiString (for gets)
3431 		 */
3432 		text : function(theText) {
3433 			
3434 			if (arguments.length>0) {
3435 				this._text = theText;
3436 				this._features = undefined;
3437 				return this;
3438 			}
3439 			return this._text;
3440 		},
3441 
3442 		/**
3443 		 * Returns an array of part-of-speech tags, one per word, using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.getPosTags().
3444 		 *
3445 		 * @returns {array} strings of pos, one per word
3446 		 */
3447 		pos : function() {
3448 				   
3449 			var words = RiTa.tokenize((this._text)); // was getPlaintext()
3450 			var tags = PosTagger.tag(words); 
3451   
3452 			for ( var i = 0, l = tags.length; i < l; i++) {
3453 				if (!strOk(tags[i])) 
3454 					err("RiString: can't parse pos for:" + words[i]);
3455 			}
3456 		
3457 			return tags;            
3458 		},
3459 
3460 		/**
3461 		 * Returns the part-of-speech tag for the word at 'index', using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.getPosTags().
3462 		 * 
3463 		 * @param {number} index the word index
3464 		 * @returns {string} the pos
3465 		 */
3466 		posAt : function(index) {
3467 			
3468 			var tags = this.pos();
3469 
3470 			if (undef(tags) || tags.length == 0 || index < 0 || index >= tags.length)
3471 				return E;
3472 			
3473 			return tags[index];
3474 		},
3475 
3476 		/**
3477 		 * Returns the word at 'index', according to RiTa.tokenize()
3478 		 * 
3479 		 * @param {number} index the word index
3480 		 * @returns {string} the word
3481 		 */
3482 		wordAt : function(index) {
3483 			
3484 			var words = RiTa.tokenize((this._text));
3485 			if (index < 0 || index >= words.length)
3486 				return E;
3487 			return words[index];  
3488 		},
3489 
3490 		/**
3491 		 * Returns the number of words in the object, according to RiTa.tokenize().
3492 		 * 
3493 		 * @returns {number} number of words
3494 		 */
3495 		wordCount : function() {
3496 			
3497 			if (!this._text.length) return 0;
3498 			return this.words().length;  
3499 		},
3500 
3501 		/**
3502 		 * Returns the array of words in the object, via a call to RiTa.tokenize().
3503 		 * 
3504 		 * @returns {array} strings, one per word
3505 		 */
3506 		words : function() { //TODO: change to words()
3507 			
3508 			return RiTa.tokenize(this._text);  
3509 		},
3510 
3511 		/**
3512 		 * Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character.
3513 		 * 
3514 		 * @param {string} searchstring (Required) or character to search for
3515 		 * @param {number} start (Optional) The start position in the string to start the search. If omitted,
3516 		 *        the search starts from position 0
3517 		 * @returns {number} the first index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found
3518 		 */
3519 		indexOf : function(searchstring, start) {
3520 			
3521 			return this._text.indexOf(searchstring, start);   
3522 		},
3523 
3524 		/**
3525 		 * Inserts 'newWord' at 'wordIdx' and shifts each subsequent word accordingly.
3526 		 *
3527 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3528 		 */
3529 		insertWordAt : function(newWord, wordIdx) {
3530 					
3531 			var words = this.words();
3532 			if (newWord && newWord.length && wordIdx >= 0 && wordIdx < words.length) {
3533 			 
3534 				// filthy hack to preserve punctuation in 'newWord'
3535 				words.splice(wordIdx,0, DeLiM+newWord+DeLiM);
3536 				
3537 				this.text( RiTa.untokenize(words).replace(new RegExp(DeLiM,'g'),E) );
3538 			}
3539 
3540 			return this;            
3541 		},
3542 
3543 		/**
3544 		 * Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character.
3545 		 * 
3546 		 * @param {string} searchstring The string to search for
3547 		 * @param {number} start (Optional) The start position in the string to start the search. If omitted,
3548 		 *        the search starts from position 0
3549 		 *        
3550 		 * @returns {number} the last index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found
3551 		 */
3552 		lastIndexOf : function(searchstring, start) {
3553 			
3554 			return this._text.lastIndexOf(searchstring, start);
3555 		},
3556 
3557 		/**
3558 		 * Returns the length of this string.
3559 		 * 
3560 		 * @returns {number} the length
3561 		 */
3562 		length : function() {
3563 			
3564 			return this._text.length;  
3565 		},
3566 
3567 		/**
3568 		 * Searches for a match between a substring (or regular expression) and the contained
3569 		 * string, and _returns the matches
3570 		 * 
3571 		 * @param {string} regex Regular expression
3572 		 * @returns {array} strings matches or empty array if none are found
3573 
3574 		 */
3575 		match : function(regex) {
3576 			
3577 			var result = this._text.match(regex);
3578 			return undef(result) ?  [] : result;   
3579 		},
3580 		
3581 		
3582 		/**
3583 		 * Extracts a part of a string from this RiString
3584 		 * 
3585 		 * @param {number} begin (Required) The index where to begin the extraction. First character is at
3586 		 *        index 0
3587 		 * @param {number} end (Optional) Where to end the extraction. If omitted, slice() selects all
3588 		 *        characters from the begin position to the end of the string
3589 		 * @returns {String} 
3590 		 */
3591 		slice : function(begin, end) {
3592 			
3593 			return this._text.slice(begin, end) || E;  
3594 		},
3595 
3596 		/**
3597 		 * Replaces each substring of this string that matches the given regular expression with the
3598 		 * given replacement.
3599 		 * 
3600 		 * @param {string | regex } pattern the pattern to be matched
3601 		 * @param {string} replacement the replacement sequence of char values
3602 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3603 		 */
3604 		replaceAll : function(pattern, replacement) {
3605 			
3606 			if (pattern && (replacement || replacement==='')) {
3607 				this._text = replaceAll(this._text, pattern, replacement);
3608 			}
3609 			return this;   
3610 		},
3611 
3612 		/**
3613 		 * Inserts the character at 'idx'.
3614 		 * If the specified 'idx' is less than zero, or beyond the
3615 		 * length of the current text, there will be no effect.
3616 		 * 
3617 		 * @param {number} idx the character index
3618 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
3619 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3620 		 */
3621 		insertChar : function(idx, toInsert) {
3622 			
3623 			var s = this.text();
3624 			
3625 			if (idx > s.length || idx < -s.length) {
3626 				console.warn("bad index="+idx);
3627 				return this;
3628 			}
3629 
3630 			 
3631 			idx = idx < 0 ? idx += s.length : idx;
3632 			//if (idx < 0) console.log("idx="+idx);
3633 			var beg = s.substring(0, idx);
3634 			var end = s.substring(idx);
3635 		 
3636 			if (toInsert) beg += toInsert;
3637 
3638 			return this.text(beg+end);
3639 		},
3640 		 
3641 		 
3642 		/**
3643 		 * Replaces the character at 'idx' with 'replaceWith'.
3644 		 * If the specified 'idx' is less than zero, or beyond the
3645 		 * length of the current text, there will be no effect.
3646 		 * 
3647 		 * @param {number} idx the character index
3648 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
3649 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3650 		 */
3651 		replaceChar : function(idx, replaceWith) {
3652 			
3653 			if (idx < 0 || idx >= this.length()) 
3654 				return this;
3655 				
3656 			var s = this.text();
3657 			var beg = s.substring(0, idx);
3658 			var end = s.substring(idx + 1);
3659 		 
3660 			if (replaceWith)
3661 				beg += replaceWith;
3662 
3663 			return this.text(beg+end);
3664 		},
3665 
3666 		/**
3667 		 * Replaces the first instance of 'regex' with 'replaceWith'
3668 		 * 
3669 		 * @param {string | regex} regex the pattern
3670 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
3671 		 * 
3672 		 * @returns this RiString
3673 		 */
3674 		replaceFirst : function(regex, replaceWith) {
3675 			
3676 			this._text = this._text.replace(regex, replaceWith);
3677 			return this;  
3678 		},
3679 		
3680 		/**
3681 		 * Replaces the last instance of 'regex' with 'replaceWith'
3682 		 * 
3683 		 * @param {string | regex} regex the pattern
3684 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
3685 		 * 
3686 		 * @returns this RiString
3687 		 */
3688 		replaceLast : function(regex, replaceWith) {
3689 			
3690 			//TODO: this fails for '?', other regex chars?
3691 			
3692 			if (!regex) return this;
3693 			
3694 			var ret = this._text;
3695 
3696 			if (is(regex, S)) {
3697 
3698 				var len = regex.length, idx = ret.lastIndexOf(regex);
3699 				if (idx >= 0) {
3700 					
3701 					this._text = ret.substring(0, idx) + replaceWith + ret.substring(idx + len);
3702 				}	
3703 			} 
3704 			else {
3705 
3706 				var matches = ret.match(regex);
3707 				if (matches) {
3708 
3709 					var target = matches.pop(), tmp = this._text.split(target), last = tmp.pop();
3710 					tmp[tmp.length - 1] += replaceWith + last;
3711 					ret = tmp.join(target);
3712 				}
3713 
3714 				this._text = ret;
3715 			}
3716 
3717 			return this;
3718 		},
3719 		
3720 		/**
3721 		 * Removes the word at 'wordIdx'.
3722 		 * 
3723 		 * @param {number} wordIdx the index
3724 		 * 
3725 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3726 		 */
3727 		removeWord : function(wordIdx) {
3728 			
3729 			return this.replaceWord(wordIdx,E);
3730 		},    
3731 			
3732 		/**
3733 		 * Replaces the word at 'wordIdx' with 'newWord'
3734 		 * 
3735 		 * @param {number} wordIdx the index
3736 		 * @param {string} newWord the replacement
3737 		 * 
3738 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3739 		 */
3740 		insertWord : function(wordIdx, newWord) {
3741 			
3742 			//console.log(newWord+' '+this.words()[wordIdx]);
3743 			//if (wordIdx == 0)  return text(newWord+' '+this.text());
3744 			return this.replaceWord(wordIdx, newWord+' '+this.words()[wordIdx]);
3745 		},
3746 			
3747 		/**
3748 		 * Replaces the word at 'wordIdx' with 'newWord'
3749 		 * 
3750 		 * @param {number} wordIdx the index
3751 		 * @param {string} newWord the replacement
3752 		 * 
3753 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3754 		 */
3755 		replaceWord : function(wordIdx, newWord) {
3756 			
3757 			var words = this.words(); //  tokenize
3758 			
3759 			if (wordIdx < 0) wordIdx += words.length;
3760 			
3761 			if (wordIdx >= 0 && wordIdx < words.length) {
3762 				
3763 				words[wordIdx] = newWord;
3764 				
3765 				this.text(RiTa.untokenize(words));
3766 			}
3767 			
3768 			return this.trim();  
3769 		},
3770 
3771 		/**
3772 		 * Split a RiString into an array of sub-RiString and return the new array.
3773 		 * 
3774 		 * If an empty string ("") is used as the separator, the string is split between each character.
3775 		 * 
3776 		 * @param {string} separator (Optional) Specifies the character to use for splitting the string. If
3777 		 *        omitted, the entire string will be returned. If an empty string ("") is used as the separator, 
3778 		 *        the string is split between each character.
3779 		 *        
3780 		 * @param {number} limit (Optional) An integer that specifies the number of splits
3781 		 * 
3782 		 * @returns {array} RiStrings
3783 		 */
3784 		split : function(separator, limit) {
3785 			
3786 			var parts = this._text.split(separator, limit);
3787 			var rs = [];
3788 			for ( var i = 0; i < parts.length; i++) {
3789 				if (!undef(parts[i]))
3790 					rs.push(new RiString(parts[i]));
3791 			}
3792 			return rs;  
3793 		},
3794 
3795 		/**
3796 		 * Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.
3797 		 * 
3798 		 * @param {string} substr string the prefix
3799 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of
3800 		 *         the character sequence represented by this string; false otherwise. Note also
3801 		 *         that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this
3802 		 *         RiString object as determined by the equals() method.
3803 		 */
3804 		startsWith : function(substr) {
3805 			
3806 			return this.indexOf(substr) == 0;  
3807 		},
3808 
3809 		/**
3810 		 * Extracts the characters from this objects contained string, beginning at 'start' and
3811 		 * continuing through the specified number of characters, and sets the current text to be
3812 		 * that string. (from Javascript String)
3813 		 * 
3814 		 * @param {number} start  The index where to start the extraction. First character is at
3815 		 *        index 0
3816 		 * @param {number} length (optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the
3817 		 *        rest of the string
3818 		 * @returns {String}
3819 		 */
3820 		substr : function(start, length) {
3821 			
3822 			return this._text.substr(start, length);
3823 			// return this.text(res);
3824 		},
3825 
3826 		/**
3827 		 * Extracts the characters from a string, between two specified indices, and sets the
3828 		 * current text to be that string. 
3829 		 * 
3830 		 * @param {number} from  The index where to start the extraction. First character is at
3831 		 *        index 0
3832 		 * @param {number} to (optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the
3833 		 *        rest of the string
3834 		 * @returns {String} 
3835 		 */
3836 		substring : function(from, to) {
3837 
3838 			// return this.text(this._text.substring(from, to));
3839 			return this._text.substring(from, to);
3840 		},
3841 
3842 		/**
3843 		 * Converts this object to an array of RiString objects, one per character
3844 		 * 
3845 		 * @returns {array} RiStrings with each letter as its own RiString element
3846 		 */
3847 		toCharArray : function() {
3848 			var parts = this._text.split(E);
3849 			var rs = [];
3850 			for ( var i = 0; i < parts.length; i++) {
3851 				if (!undef(parts[i]))
3852 					rs.push(parts[i]);
3853 			}
3854 			return rs;
3855 		},
3856 
3857 		/**
3858 		 * Converts all of the characters in this RiString to lower case
3859 		 * 
3860 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3861 		 */
3862 		toLowerCase : function() {
3863 			
3864 			return this.text(this._text.toLowerCase());
3865 		},
3866 
3867 		/**
3868 		 * Returns the contained string object
3869 		 * 
3870 		 * @returns {string}
3871 		 */
3872 		toString : function() {
3873 			
3874 			return "RiString["+this._text+"]";
3875 		},
3876 
3877 		/**
3878 		 * Converts all of the characters in this RiString to upper case
3879 		 * 
3880 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3881 		 */
3882 		toUpperCase : function() {
3883 			
3884 			return this.text(this._text.toUpperCase());
3885 		},
3886 
3887 		/**
3888 		 * Returns a copy of the string, with leading and trailing whitespace omitted.
3889 		 * 
3890 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3891 		 */
3892 		trim : function() {
3893 			
3894 			return this.text(trim(this._text));
3895 		},
3896 
3897 		/**
3898 		 * Returns the character at the given 'index', or empty string if none is found
3899 		 * 
3900 		 * @param {number} index index of the character
3901 		 * @returns {string} the character
3902 		 */
3903 		charAt : function(index) {
3904 
3905 			return this._text.charAt(index);  
3906 		},
3907 
3908 		/**
3909 		 * Concatenates the text from another RiString at the end of this one
3910 		 * 
3911 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3912 		 */
3913 		concat : function(riString) {
3914 			
3915 			return this._text.concat(riString.text());  
3916 		},
3917 			   
3918 		/**
3919 		 * Removes the character at the specified index
3920 		 * 
3921 		 * @param {number} idx the index
3922 		 * @returns {object} this RiString
3923 		 */
3924 		removeChar : function(idx) { 
3925 			
3926 			this.text(this._text.substring(0, idx).concat(this._text.substring(idx + 1)));
3927 			return this;   
3928 		}
3929 
3930 	}
3931 
3932 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3933 	// RiGrammar
3934 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3935 
3936 	/**
3937 	 * @name RiGrammar
3938 	 * @class A probabilistic context-free grammar with literary extensions designed for text-generation
3939 	 * <pre> 
3940 		rg = new RiGrammar("mygrammar.g");
3941 		System.out.println(rg.expand());
3942 
3943 		</pre>
3944 	 * 
3945 	 * RiTa grammar files are JSON-formatted text files that follow the format below:
3946 	 *  <pre>   
3947 
3948 		  "<start>": "<rule1> | <rule2> | <rule3>"
3949 	
3950 		  "<rule2>": "terminal1 |  terminal2 | <rule1>"
3951 		
3952 		   ...
3953 		</pre>   
3954 	 * <b>Primary methods of interest:</b>
3955 	 * <ul>
3956 	 * <li><code>expand()</code> which simply begins at the <start> state and 
3957 	 * generates a string of terminals from the grammar.<p>
3958 	 * <li><code>expandFrom(String)</code> which begins with the argument
3959 	 * String (which can consist of both non-terminals and terminals,) 
3960 	 * and expands from there. Notice that <code>expand()</code> is simply
3961 	 * a convenient version of <code>expandFrom("<start>");</code>.<p>
3962 	 * <li><code>expandWith(String, String)</code> takes 2 String arguments, the 1st 
3963 	 * (a terminal) is guaranteed to be substituted for the 2nd (a non-terminal). Once this 
3964 	 * substitution is made, the algorithm then works backwards (up the tree from the leaf)
3965 	 * ensuring that the terminal (terminal1) appears in the output string. 
3966 	 * For example, with the grammar fragment above, one might call:<p>
3967 	   <pre>
3968 			grammar.expandWith(terminal1, "<rule2>");
3969 	  </pre>
3970 	 * assuring not only that <code><rule2></code>will be used at least 
3971 	 * once in the generation process, but that when it is, it will be replaced 
3972 	 * by the terminal "hello".
3973 	 *</ul>
3974 	 *
3975 	 *<li>A RiGrammar object will assign (by default) equal weights to all choices in a rule. 
3976 	 *One can adjust the weights by adding 'multipliers' as follows: (in the rule below,
3977 	 * 'terminal1' will be chosen twice as often as the 2 other choices.
3978 	 * <pre>   
3979 		 "<rule2>": "[2] terminal1 | terminal2 | <rule1>" 
3980 	   </pre>
3981 		
3982 	 *<li>The RiGrammar object supports callbacks, from your grammar, back into your code.
3983 	 * To generate a callback, add the method call in your grammar, surrounded by back-ticks, as follows:
3984 	 * <pre>   
3985 	 *     
3986 	 *       "<rule2>": "The cat ran after the `pluralize('cat');` | \
3987 	 *       The <noun> ran after the `pluralize(<noun>);`" 
3988 	 *     </pre>
3989 	 *     
3990 	 * Any number of arguments may be passed in a callback, but for each call,
3991 	 * there must be a corresponding method in the sketch, e.g.,
3992 	 * 
3993 	 * <pre>
3994 	 *    function pluralize(theString) {
3995 	 *      ...
3996 	 *    }
3997 	 * </pre>
3998 	 * 
3999 	 * @author dhowe 
4000 	 */
4001 	var RiGrammar = makeClass();
4002 	
4003 	RiGrammar.START_RULE = "<start>";
4004 	RiGrammar.OPEN_RULE_CHAR = "<";
4005 	RiGrammar.CLOSE_RULE_CHAR = ">";
4006 	RiGrammar.PROB_PATT = /(.*[^\s])\s*\[([0-9.]+)\](.*)/;
4007 	RiGrammar.OR_PATT = /\s*\|\s*/;
4008 	RiGrammar.EXEC_PATT = /`[^`]+`/g;
4009 	RiGrammar.STRIP_TICKS = /`([^`]*)`/g;
4010 	
4011 	/**
4012 	 * Set/gets the execDisabled flag. Set to true (default=false) 
4013 	 * if you don't want to use the exec mechanism for callbacks. Useful if you want
4014 	 * to include backticks or method calls as terminals in your grammar.
4015 	RiGrammar._execDisabled = function(disableExec)
4016 	{
4017 		if (arguments.length==1) {
4018 			RiGrammar._execDisabled = disableExec;
4019 		}
4020 		return RiGrammar._execDisabled;
4021 	}    
4022 	*/
4023 
4024 	RiGrammar.prototype = {
4025 
4026 		/**
4027 		 * Initializes a grammar, optionally accepting an object or JSON string containing the rules
4028 		 * 
4029 		 * @param  {none | string | object } grammar containing the grammar rules
4030 		 */
4031 		init : function(grammar) {
4032 			
4033 			(arguments.length == 0 || is(grammar,S) || ok(grammar, O)); 
4034 			this._rules = {};
4035 			this._execDisabled = false;
4036 			grammar && this.setGrammar(grammar);  
4037 		},
4038 	
4039 		/**
4040 		 * Loads a JSON grammar via AJAX call to 'url', replacing any existing grammar. 
4041 		 * @param {string} url of JSON file containing the grammar rules
4042 		 * @returns {object} this RiGrammar
4043 		 */
4044 		_load : function(url) {
4045 			
4046 			this.reset();
4047 			
4048 			err("Implement me!");
4049 			
4050 			return this;
4051 			
4052 		},
4053 	
4054 		/**
4055 		 * inits a grammar from an object or JSON string containing the rules (rather than a file)
4056 		 * and replacing any existing grammar. 
4057 		 * @param  {string | object} grammar containing the grammar rules
4058 		 * @returns {object} this RiGrammar
4059 		 */
4060 		setGrammar : function(grammar) {
4061 			
4062 			this.reset();
4063 			
4064 			grammar = (typeof grammar == S) ?  JSON.parse(grammar) : grammar 
4065 			
4066 			for (var rule in grammar) 
4067 				this.addRule(rule, grammar[rule]);
4068 			
4069 			return this;
4070 			
4071 		},
4072 		
4073 		
4074 		/**
4075 		 * Deletes the named rule from the grammar
4076 		 * @returns {object} this RiGrammar
4077 		 */ 
4078 		removeRule : function(name)  {
4079 			
4080 			name = this._normalizeRuleName(name);
4081 			delete this._rules[name];
4082 			return this;
4083 			
4084 		},
4085 
4086 		_clone: function() {  // NIAPI
4087 			var tmp = RiGrammar();
4088 			for(var name in this._rules) {
4089 				tmp._rules[name] = this._rules[name];
4090 			}
4091 			return tmp;
4092 
4093 		},
4094 		
4095 		/**
4096 		 * Adds a rule to the existing grammar, replacing any existing rule with the same name 
4097 		 * @param {string} name
4098 		 * @param {string} ruleStr
4099 		 * @param {number} weight
4100 		 * @returns {object} this RiGrammar
4101 		 */
4102 		addRule : function(name, ruleStr, weight) 
4103 		{
4104 			var dbug = false;
4105 	
4106 			weight = (undef(weight) ? 1.0 : weight); // default
4107 
4108 			name = this._normalizeRuleName(name);
4109 
4110 			if (dbug) log("addRule: "+name+ " -> "+ruleStr+" ["+weight+"]");
4111 			
4112 			var ruleset = ruleStr.split(RiGrammar.OR_PATT);
4113 			//ruleset = "<noun-phrase> <verb-phrase>";
4114 	
4115 			for ( var i = 0; i < ruleset.length; i++) {
4116 				
4117 				var rule = ruleset[i];
4118 				var prob = weight;
4119 				var m = RiGrammar.PROB_PATT.exec(rule);
4120 	
4121 				if (m != null) // found weighting
4122 				{
4123 					if (dbug) {
4124 						log("Found weight for " + rule);
4125 						for (i = 0; i < m.length; i++)
4126 							log("  " + i + ") '" + m[i] + "'");
4127 					}
4128 					rule = m[1] + m[3];
4129 					prob = m[2];
4130 					if (dbug) log("weight=" + prob + " rule='" + rule + "'");
4131 				}
4132 	
4133 				if (this.hasRule(name)) {
4134 					if (dbug)log("rule exists");
4135 					var temp = this._rules[name];
4136 					temp[rule] = prob;
4137 				} 
4138 				else {
4139 					
4140 					// log("new rule");
4141 					var temp2 = {};
4142 					temp2[rule] = prob;
4143 					this._rules[name] = temp2;
4144 					if (dbug)log("added rule: "+name);
4145 				}
4146 			}
4147 			return this;
4148 			
4149 		},
4150 	  
4151 		/**
4152 		 * Clears all rules in the current grammar
4153 		 * @returns {object} this RiGrammar
4154 		 */
4155 		reset : function() {
4156 			
4157 		   this._rules = {};
4158 		   return this;
4159 		   
4160 		},
4161 			  
4162 		/**
4163 		 * Returns the requested rule
4164 		 * @param {string} rule name
4165 		 * @returns {string} the rule
4166 		 */
4167 		getRule : function(pre) {
4168 			
4169 			pre = this._normalizeRuleName(pre);
4170 	   
4171 			// log("getRule("+pre+")");
4172 			var tmp = this._rules[pre];
4173 			var name, cnt = 0;
4174 			
4175 			for (name in tmp) cnt++; // count the matching rules
4176 			
4177 			if (cnt == 1) {
4178 				return name;
4179 			} 
4180 			else if (cnt > 1) {
4181 				
4182 				var sr = this._getStochasticRule(tmp);
4183 				return sr;
4184 			}
4185 			else {
4186 				err("No rule found for: "+pre);
4187 			}  
4188 		},
4189 		
4190 		/**
4191 		 * Prints the grammar rules to the console in human-readable format (useful for debugging) 
4192 		 * @returns {object} this RiGrammar
4193 		 */
4194 		print : function() { //TODO: compare to RiTa
4195 			
4196 			if (console) {
4197 				console.log("Grammar----------------");
4198 				for ( var name in this._rules) {
4199 					
4200 					console.log("  '" + name + "' -> ");
4201 					var choices = this._rules[name];
4202 					for ( var p in choices) {
4203 						console.log("    '" + p + "' [" + choices[p] + "]");
4204 					}
4205 				}
4206 				console.log("-----------------------");
4207 			}
4208 			return this;
4209 			
4210 		},
4211 		
4212 		/**
4213 		 * Returns true if the requested rule exists in the grammar, else false
4214 		 * @param {string} the rule name
4215 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the rule exists in the grammar, else false
4216 		 */
4217 		hasRule : function(name) {
4218 			
4219 			//log("hasRule("+name+")");
4220 			name = this._normalizeRuleName(name);
4221 			return (typeof this._rules[name] !== 'undefined');
4222 			
4223 		},
4224 		
4225 		/**
4226 		 * Expands the grammar after replacing an instance of the non-terminal
4227 		 * 'symbol' with the String in 'literal'.
4228 		 * <P>
4229 		 * Guarantees that 'literal' will be in the final expanded String, 
4230 		 * assuming at least one instance of 'symbol' in the Grammar.
4231 		 * 
4232 		 * @param literal
4233 		 * @param symbol
4234 		 * 
4235 		 * @returns {string} expanded text
4236 		 */
4237 		expandWith : function(literal, symbol) { // TODO: finish 
4238 
4239 			var gr = this._clone();
4240 			
4241 			var match = false;
4242 			for ( var name in gr._rules) {
4243 				if (name===symbol) {
4244 					var obj = {};
4245 					obj[literal] = 1.0;
4246 					gr._rules[name] = obj;
4247 					match = true;
4248 				}
4249 			}
4250 			if (!match) 
4251 				err("Rule '"+symbol+"' not found in grammar");
4252 
4253 			// TODO: tmp, awful hack, write this correctly
4254 			var tries, maxTries = 1000;
4255 			for (tries = 0 ;tries < maxTries; tries++) {
4256 				var s = gr.expand();
4257 				if (s.indexOf(literal)>-1)
4258 					return s;
4259 			}
4260 			err("\n[WARN] RiGrammar failed to complete after "+tries+" tries\n");
4261 			
4262 		},
4263 		
4264 		/**
4265 		 * @param input
4266 		 * @returns this
4267 		 */
4268 		_handleExec : function(input) { // TODO: private
4269 					   
4270 			//console.log("handleExec: "+input);
4271 			
4272 			if (!input || !input.length) return E;
4273 			
4274 			// strip backticks and eval
4275 			var exec = input.replace(RiGrammar.STRIP_TICKS, "$1");
4276 			
4277 			try {
4278 				input = RiTa._eval(exec);
4279 			}
4280 			catch (e) {
4281 				
4282 				warn("RiGrammar._handleExec failed on '"+input+"'\n  -> "+e.message);
4283 				
4284 				// if (is(exports, O)) { // we are running in node
4285 					// console.log("found node! "+typeof module.vm);
4286 					// module.vm.runInThisContext(exec);
4287 					// //eval("function adj(){return 56;}") 
4288 				// }
4289 			}
4290 			
4291 			return input;
4292 		},
4293 		
4294 				
4295 		/**
4296 		 * Expands a grammar from its '<start>' symbol
4297 		 * @param {string} One or more function to be added to the current context BEFORE 
4298 		 * executing the expand() call. Useful for defining functions referenced in back-ticked rules.
4299 		 * @returns {string}
4300 		 */
4301 		expand : function(funs) {
4302 
4303 			funs && RiTa._eval(funs);
4304 			
4305 			return this.expandFrom(RiGrammar.START_RULE);
4306 		}, 
4307 		// TODO: reconsider
4308 		
4309 		/**
4310 		 * Expands the grammar, starting from the given symbol.
4311 		 * RiGrammar.expand() is equivalent to RiGrammar.expandFrom('').
4312 		 * 
4313 		 * @param {string} rule
4314 		 * @returns {string}
4315 		 * 
4316 		 */
4317 		expandFrom : function(rule) {
4318 			
4319 			//log("expandFrom("+rule+")");
4320 			
4321 			if (!this.hasRule(rule)) {
4322 				warn("Rule not found: " + rule + "\nRules: ");
4323 				(!RiTa.SILENT) && this.print();
4324 			}
4325 	
4326 			var iterations = 0;
4327 			var maxIterations = 1000;
4328 			while (++iterations < maxIterations) {
4329 				
4330 				var next = this._expandRule(rule);
4331 				if (!next) {
4332 
4333 					//  we're done, check for back-ticked strings to eval
4334 					(!this._execDisabled && (rule = rule.replace
4335 						(RiGrammar.EXEC_PATT, this._handleExec)));
4336 								 
4337 					break;
4338 				} 
4339 				rule = next;
4340 			}
4341 	
4342 			if (iterations >= maxIterations)
4343 				warn("max number of iterations reached: " + maxIterations);
4344 	
4345 			return rule;
4346 			
4347 		},
4348 			
4349 		_expandRule : function(prod) { 
4350 			
4351 			var dbug = false, trimSpace = true, result = [];
4352 			if (trimSpace) prod = prod.trim();
4353 
4354 			if (dbug) log("_expandRule(" + prod + ")");
4355 			
4356 			for ( var name in this._rules) {
4357 				
4358 				var entry = this._rules[name];
4359 				if (dbug) log("  name=" + name+"  entry=" + entry+"  prod=" + prod+"  idx=" + idx);
4360 				var idx = prod.indexOf(name);
4361 				
4362 				if (idx >= 0) {
4363 					
4364 					var pre = prod.substring(0, idx);
4365 					var expanded = this.getRule(name);
4366 					var post = prod.substring(idx + name.length);
4367 					
4368 					if (trimSpace) {
4369 						pre = pre.trim();
4370 						expanded = expanded.trim();
4371 						post = post.trim();
4372 					}
4373 
4374 					if (dbug) log("  pre=" + pre+"  expanded=" + expanded+"  post=" + post+"  result=" + pre + expanded + post);
4375 					
4376 //					var tmp = (pre + SP + expanded + SP + post);
4377 
4378 					result.push(pre,expanded,post);
4379 
4380 					var ok = result.join(SP);
4381 					
4382 					if (dbug) console.log('Returns: '+ok);
4383 
4384 					if (trimSpace) ok = ok.trim();
4385 
4386 					return ok;
4387 				}
4388 				
4389 				// do the exec check here, in while loop()
4390 			}
4391 			// what happens if we get here? no expansions left, return?
4392 		},
4393 		
4394 		_normalizeRuleName : function(pre) {
4395 			
4396 			if (!strOk(pre)) return pre;
4397 			
4398 			if (!startsWith(pre, RiGrammar.OPEN_RULE_CHAR))
4399 				pre = RiGrammar.OPEN_RULE_CHAR + pre;
4400 			
4401 			if (!endsWith(pre,RiGrammar.CLOSE_RULE_CHAR))
4402 				pre += RiGrammar.CLOSE_RULE_CHAR;
4403 
4404 			if (pre.indexOf('>>')>0) err(">>");
4405 			
4406 			return pre;
4407 			
4408 		},
4409 		
4410 		// private?? (add structure test case)
4411 		_getStochasticRule : function(temp)    { // map
4412 	 
4413 			var dbug = false;
4414 			
4415 			if (dbug) log("_getStochasticRule(" + temp + ")");
4416 			
4417 			var p = Math.random();
4418 			var result, total = 0;
4419 			for ( var name in temp) {
4420 				total += parseFloat(temp[name]);
4421 			}
4422 			
4423 			if (dbug) log("total=" + total+"p=" + p);
4424 			
4425 			 for ( var name in temp) {
4426 				if (dbug) log("  name=" + name);
4427 				var amt = temp[name] / total;
4428 				
4429 				if (dbug) log("amt=" + amt);
4430 				
4431 				if (p < amt) {
4432 					result = name;
4433 					if (dbug)log("hit!=" + name);
4434 					break;
4435 				} else {
4436 					p -= amt;
4437 				}
4438 			}
4439 			return result;
4440 		}
4441 		
4442 	
4443 	} // end RiGrammar
4444 	
4445 	
4446 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4447 	////////// RiText   
4448 	////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
4449 	
4450 	/**
4451 	 * @name RiText
4452 	 * 
4453 	 * @class A text display object for the RiTa tools. 
4454 	 * 
4455 	 * Wraps an instance of RiString to provide utility
4456 	 * methods for typography, text effects, animation, etc. 
4457 	 * 
4458 	 * <p>
4459 	 * 
4460 	 * Uses either the native canvas renderer or the Processing renderer (when included) 
4461 	 * 
4462 	 * @property {number} x The x position
4463 	 * @property {number} y The y position
4464 	 */    
4465 	var RiText = makeClass();
4466 		
4467 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4468 	//////// RiText statics
4469 	////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
4470 	
4471 	/**
4472 	 * Static container for properties related to the update/render loop
4473 	 */
4474 	RiText._animator = {
4475 		loopId : -1,
4476 		actualFPS : 0,
4477 		targetFPS : 60,
4478 		isLooping : false,
4479 		frameCount : 0,
4480 		loopStarted : false,
4481 		framesSinceLastFPS : 0,
4482 		callbackDisabled : false,
4483 		timeSinceLastFPS : Date.now()
4484 	}
4485 
4486 	/**
4487 	 * Starts a timer that calls 'onRiTaEvent' or the specified callback every 'period'
4488 	 * seconds
4489 	 * 
4490 	 * @param {number} period (in seconds)
4491 	 * @param {function} callback called every 'period' seconds (default=onRiTaEvent)
4492 	 * @returns {number} the unique id for the timer
4493 	 */
4494 	RiText.timer = function(period, callback) {
4495 
4496 		return RiTa.timer.apply(this,arguments);
4497 	}
4498 	
4499 	/**
4500 	 * Stops a timer according to its unique id
4501 	 * @param {number} the unique id for the timer
4502 	 */
4503 	RiText.stopTimer = function(id) {
4504 
4505 		RiTa.stopTimer.apply(this,arguments);
4506 	} 
4507 	
4508 	/**
4509 	 * Pauses a timer according to its unique id (and assigns a new unique id)
4510 	 * @param {number} the unique id for the timer
4511 	 * @param {number} period (in seconds)
4512 	 * @returns {number} the new unique id for the timer
4513 	 */
4514 	RiText.pauseTimer = function(id, pauseSec) {
4515 		
4516 		return RiTa.pauseTimer.apply(this,arguments);
4517 	}   
4518 	
4519 	/**
4520 	 * Returns the number of frames since the start of the sketch 
4521 	 * @returns {number} the number of frames
4522 	 */
4523 	RiText.frameCount = function() {
4524 		return RiText._animator.frameCount;
4525 	}
4526 	
4527 	/**
4528 	 * Immediately stops the current animation loop and clears 
4529 	 */
4530 	RiText.noLoop = function() {
4531 		var an = RiText._animator;
4532 		an.isLooping = false;
4533 		an.loopStarted = false;
4534 		an.clearInterval(loopId);
4535 	}
4536 		
4537 	/**
4538 	 * Starts an animation loop that calls the specified callback (usually 'draw') 
4539 	 * at the specified fps  
4540 	 * 
4541 	 * @param {function} callback the animation callback (optional, default=60)
4542 	 * @param {number} fps the target framesPerSecond (optional, default='draw')
4543 	 * <pre>
4544 	 * Examples:
4545 	 *  RiText.loop();
4546 	 *  RiText.loop('draw');
4547 	 *  RiText.loop(30);
4548 	 *  RiText.loop(draw, 10);
4549 	 * </pre>
4550 	 */
4551 	RiText.loop = function(callbackFun, fps) {
4552 		
4553 		var a = arguments, 
4554 			g = RiText.renderer,  
4555 			an = RiText._animator, 
4556 			callback = undef(window) ? null : window['draw'];
4557 		
4558 		if (g._type() === 'Processing') return; // let P5 do its own loop?
4559   
4560 		if (an.loopStarted) return;
4561 		
4562 		switch (a.length) {
4563 			
4564 			case 1:
4565 				
4566 				if (a[0]) {
4567 					var type = Type.get(a[0]);
4568 					if (type == F) {
4569 						callback = a[0];
4570 					}
4571 					else if (type == N) {
4572 						an.targetFPS = a[0];
4573 					}
4574 				}
4575 				break;
4576 				
4577 			case 2:
4578 				
4579 				if (a[0]) {
4580 					
4581 					var type = Type.get(a[0]);
4582 					if (type == F) {
4583 						callback = a[0];
4584 					}
4585 					type = Type.get(a[1])
4586 					if (type == N) {
4587 						an.targetFPS = a[1];
4588 					}
4589 				}
4590 				break;
4591 		}
4592 
4593 		an.timeSinceLastFPS = Date.now(), an.framesSinceLastFPS = 0, mps =  1E3 / an.targetFPS;
4594 		
4595 		if (callback && !an.callbackDisabled && window) {
4596 			
4597 			an.loopId = window.setInterval(function() {
4598 				
4599 			  try {
4600 				
4601 				 callback();
4602 				 
4603 				 var sec = (Date.now() - an.timeSinceLastFPS) / 1E3;
4604 				 var fps = ++an.framesSinceLastFPS / sec;
4605 				 
4606 				 if (sec > 0.5) {
4607 					 an.timeSinceLastFPS = Date.now();
4608 					 an.framesSinceLastFPS = 0;
4609 					 an.actualFPS = fps;
4610 				 }
4611 				 an.frameCount++;
4612 				
4613 			  } catch(ex) {
4614 				  
4615 				if (!an.callbackDisabled) {
4616 					console.warn("Unable to invoke callback: "+callback);
4617 					an.callbackDisabled = true;
4618 				}
4619 				window.clearInterval(an.loopId);
4620 				console.trace(this);
4621 				throw ex;
4622 			  }
4623 			}, mps);
4624 			
4625 			an.isLooping = true;
4626 			an.loopStarted = true;
4627 		}
4628 
4629 	}
4630 	
4631 	/**
4632 	 * Convenience method to get the height of the current drawing surface
4633 	 * @returns {number} width
4634 	 */
4635 	RiText.width = function() { return RiText.renderer._width(); }
4636 	 
4637 
4638 	/**
4639 	 * Convenience method to get the height of the current drawing surface
4640 	 * @returns {number} height
4641 	 */
4642 	RiText.height = function() { return RiText.renderer._height(); }
4643  
4644 	/**
4645 	 * Convenience method to draw a crisp line on the drawing surface
4646 	 * @param {number} x1
4647 	 * @param {number} y1
4648 	 * @param {number} x2
4649 	 * @param {number} y2
4650 	 * @param {number} lineWidth (optional: default=1)
4651 	 */ 
4652 	RiText.line = function(x1, y1, x2, y2, lineWidth) {
4653 
4654 		var g = RiText.renderer;
4655 		g._pushState();
4656 		g._line(x1, y1, x2, y2, lineWidth || 1);
4657 		g._popState();
4658 	}
4659 	  
4660 	/**
4661 	 * Convenience method to set the size of the drawing surface in the current 
4662 	 * renderer context 
4663 	 * @param {number} w width
4664 	 * @param {number} h height
4665 	 */
4666 	RiText.size = function(w,h/*renderer*/) {
4667 		
4668 		RiText.renderer._size(w,h/*renderer*/);
4669 	}
4670 	
4671 	/**
4672 	 * Returns the current graphics context, either a canvas 2d'-context or ProcessingJS instance 
4673 	 * @returns {object}
4674 	 */
4675 	RiText.graphics = function() {
4676 		
4677 		return RiText.renderer ? RiText.renderer._getGraphics() : null;
4678 	}
4679 	
4680 	/**
4681 	 * Returns a random color in which the 3 values for rgb (or rgba if 'includeAlpha' is true), 
4682 	 * are between min and max 
4683 	 * 
4684 	 * @param {number} min value
4685 	 * @param {number} max value
4686 	 * @param {boolean} includeAlpha true if includes alpha
4687 	 * @returns {array} numbers - [r,g,b] or [r,g,b,a]
4688 	 */
4689 	RiText.randomColor = function(min,max,includeAlpha) {
4690 		
4691 		min = min || 0, max = max || 256;
4692 		var col = [RiText.random(min,max),RiText.random(min,max),RiText.random(min,max)];
4693 		if (includeAlpha) col.push(RiText.random(min,max));
4694 		return col;
4695 	}
4696 	
4697 	/**
4698 	 * Returns a random number between 'min' (default 0) and 'max
4699 	 * @returns {number}
4700 	 */
4701 	RiText.random = function() {
4702 		
4703 		return RiTa.random.apply(this ,arguments);
4704 	}
4705 	
4706 	/**
4707 	 * Convenience method to get the distance between 2 points
4708 	 * @param {number} x1
4709 	 * @param {number} y1
4710 	 * @param {number} x2
4711 	 * @param {number} y2
4712 	 * 
4713 	 * @returns {number}
4714 	 */
4715 	RiText.distance = function() {
4716 		
4717 		return RiTa.distance.apply(this,arguments);
4718 	}
4719 	
4720 	/**
4721 	 * Convenience method to fill drawing surface background with specified color
4722 	 * @param {number} r
4723 	 * @param {number} g
4724 	 * @param {number} b
4725 	 * @param {number} a
4726 	 */
4727 	RiText.background = function(r,g,b,a) {
4728 		
4729 		var br, bg, bb, ba = 255, r = (typeof r == N) ? r : 255;
4730 
4731 		if (arguments.length >= 3) {
4732 			br = r;
4733 			bg = g;
4734 			bb = b;
4735 		}
4736 		if (arguments.length == 4) {
4737 			ba = a;
4738 		}
4739 		if (arguments.length <= 2) {
4740 			br = r;
4741 			bg = r;
4742 			bb = r;
4743 		}
4744 		if (arguments.length == 2) {
4745 			ba = g;
4746 		}
4747  
4748 		RiText.renderer._background(br,bg,bb,ba);
4749 	}
4750 	
4751 	/**
4752 	 * Returns the mouse position from a mouse event
4753 	 * in a cross-browser compatible fashion
4754 	 * @param {MouseEvent} e mouseEvent
4755 	 * @returns {object} mouse position with x,y properties
4756 	 */
4757 	RiText.mouse = function(e) {
4758 		
4759 		var posX = -1,posY = -1;
4760 		
4761 		if (!e) var e = window.event;
4762 		
4763 		if (!e && !RiText.mouse.printedWarning) { 
4764 			console.warn("No mouse-position without event!");
4765 			RiText.mouse.printedWarning = true;
4766 		}        
4767 		
4768 		if (e.pageX) {
4769 			posX = e.pageX;
4770 		}
4771 		else if (e.clientX)    {
4772 			posX = e.clientX + document.body.scrollLeft
4773 				+ document.documentElement.scrollLeft;
4774 		}
4775 
4776 		if (e.pageY) {
4777 			
4778 			posY = e.pageY;
4779 		}
4780 		else if (e.clientY)    {
4781 			
4782 			posY = e.clientY + document.body.scrollTop
4783 				+ document.documentElement.scrollTop;
4784 		}
4785  
4786 		return {x:posX,y:posY};
4787 	}
4788 
4789 	/**
4790 	 * Returns all RiTexts that contain the point x,y or null if none do.
4791 	 * <p>
4792 	 * Note: this will return an array even if only one item is picked, therefore,
4793 	 * you should generally use it as follows:
4794 	 * 
4795 	 * @example
4796 	 *   var rts = RiText.getPicked(mx, my);
4797 	 *   if (rts.length) {
4798 	 *      rts[0].doSomething();
4799 	 *   }
4800 	 *
4801 	 *
4802 	 * @param {number} x
4803 	 * @param {number} y
4804 	 * 
4805 	 * @returns {array} RiText[] one or more RiTexts containing
4806 	 * the point, or an empty array if none do.
4807 	 */
4808 	RiText.picked = function(x, y) {
4809 	  var hits = [];
4810 	  for (var i = 0; i < RiText.instances.length; i++)
4811 	  {
4812 		var rt = RiText.instances[i];
4813 		rt.contains(x, y) && hits.push(rt);
4814 	  }
4815 	  return hits;
4816 	}
4817 	
4818 	RiText.dispose = function(toDelete) {
4819 		
4820 	   is(toDelete,A) && RiText._disposeArray(toDelete);
4821 	   is(toDelete,O) && RiText._disposeOne(toDelete);
4822 	}
4823 	
4824 	RiText.disposeAll = function() {
4825 		
4826 		for ( var i = 0; i < RiText.instances.length; i++) {
4827 
4828 			if (RiText.instances[i]) {
4829 				
4830 				delete(RiText.instances[i]._rs);
4831 				delete(RiText.instances[i]);
4832 			}
4833 		}
4834 		RiText.instances = [];
4835 	}
4836 	
4837    RiText.createWords = function(txt, x, y, w, h, fontObj) {
4838 
4839 		return RiText._createRiTexts(txt, x, y, w, h, fontObj, RiText.prototype.splitWords);
4840 	}
4841 
4842 	RiText.createLetters = function(txt, x, y, w, h, fontObj) {
4843 
4844 		return RiText._createRiTexts(txt, x, y, w, h, fontObj, RiText.prototype.splitLetters);
4845 	}
4846 
4847 	// TODO: other alignments?
4848 	RiText.createLines = function(txt, x, y, maxW, maxH, theFont) { 
4849    
4850   		var strLines = txt, theFont = theFont || RiText._getDefaultFont();
4851 				 
4852 		if (is(txt, S)) 
4853 			strLines = RiText._makeLines(txt, x, y, maxW, maxH, theFont);
4854 
4855 		if (!(strLines && strLines.length)) 
4856 			err('Unexpected fail in createLines: no lines');
4857 
4858 		// lay out the lines
4859 		var rts = RiText._createLinesByCharCountFromArray(strLines, x, y, theFont);
4860 		
4861 		if (!rts || rts.length < 1) return EA;
4862 
4863 		// set the paragraph spacing
4864 		if (RiText.defaults.paragraphLeading > 0)  {
4865 			
4866 		  var lead = 0;
4867 		  for (var i = 0; i < rts.length; i++) {
4868 			  
4869 			var str = rts[i].text();
4870 			var idx = str.indexOf('|');
4871 			if (idx > -1) {
4872 			  lead += RiText.defaults.paragraphLeading;
4873 			  rts[i].removeChar(idx);
4874 			}
4875 			rts[i].y += lead;
4876 		  }
4877 		}
4878 		
4879 		// check all the lines are still in the rect
4880 		var toKill = [];
4881 		var check = rts[rts.length - 1];   
4882 		for (var z = 1; check.y > y + maxH; z++) {
4883 			
4884 			toKill.push(check);
4885 			var idx = rts.length - 1 - z;
4886 			if (idx < 0) break;
4887 			check = rts[idx];
4888 		}
4889 		
4890 		// remove the dead ones
4891 		for (var z = 0; z < toKill.length; z++) {
4892 			
4893 			removeFromArray(rts, toKill[z]);
4894 		}
4895 		
4896 		RiText._disposeArray(toKill);
4897 
4898 		return rts;
4899 	}
4900 
4901 	/**
4902 	 * Sets/gets the default font size for all RiTexts
4903 	 * @param {object} motionType
4904 	 * @returns {object} the current default motionType
4905 	 */
4906 	RiText.defaultMotionType = function(motionType) {
4907 
4908 		if (arguments.length==1) 
4909 			RiText.defaults.motionType = motionType;
4910 		return RiText.defaults.motionType;
4911 	}
4912 	
4913 	/**
4914 	 * Sets/gets the default alignment for all RiTexts
4915 	 * @param {number} align (optional, for sets only)
4916 	 * @returns {number} the current default alignment
4917 	 */
4918 	RiText.defaultAlignment = function(align) {
4919 
4920 		if (arguments.length==1)
4921 			RiText.defaults.alignment = align;
4922 		return RiText.defaults.alignment;
4923 	}
4924 	
4925 	/**
4926 	 * Sets/gets the default font size for all RiTexts
4927 	 * @param {number} size (optional, for sets only)
4928 	 * @returns {number} the current default font size
4929 	 */
4930 	RiText.defaultFontSize = function(size) {
4931 
4932 		if (arguments.length==1) 
4933 			RiText.defaults.fontSize = size;
4934 		return RiText.defaults.fontSize;
4935 	}
4936 
4937 	/**
4938 	 * Sets/gets the default bounding box visibility
4939 	 * @param {boolean} size (optional, for sets only)
4940 	 * @returns {boolean} the current default bounding box visibility
4941 	 */
4942 	RiText.showBoundingBoxes = function(value) {
4943 		
4944 		if (arguments.length==1) 
4945 			RiText.defaults.boundingBoxVisible = value;
4946 		return RiText.defaults.boundingBoxVisible;
4947 	}
4948 
4949 	/**
4950 	 * Sets/gets the default font for all RiTexts
4951 	 * @param {object} font (optional, for 'sets' only)
4952 	 * @param {string} the font name (optional, for 'sets' only)
4953 	 * @param {number} the font size (optional, for 'sets' only)
4954 	 * @param {number} the font leading (optional, for 'sets' only)
4955 	 *
4956 	 * @returns {object} the current default font
4957 	 */
4958 	RiText.defaultFont = function(font) {
4959 		
4960 		var a = arguments;
4961 		if (a.length == 1 && typeof a[0] == O) {
4962 			RiText.defaults.font = a[0];
4963 		}
4964 		// this allows for RiText.defaultFont(name,sz,lead); // TODO: remove or add to params
4965 		else if (a.length > 1 && typeof a[0] == S) {
4966 			RiText.defaults.font = RiText.renderer._createFont.apply(RiText.renderer, a);
4967 		}
4968 
4969 		if (!RiText.defaults.font.leading)
4970 			RiText.defaults.font.leading = RiText.defaults.font.size * RiText.defaults.leadingFactor;
4971  
4972 		return RiText.defaults.font;
4973 	}
4974 	
4975 	RiText.createFont = function(fontName, fontSize, leading) {
4976 		
4977 		if (!fontName) err('RiText.createFont requires fontName');
4978 		
4979 		fontSize = fontSize || RiText.defaults.fontSize;
4980 
4981 		return RiText.renderer._createFont(fontName, fontSize, leading);
4982 	}
4983 	
4984 	/**
4985 	 * A convenience method to draw all existing RiText objects (with no argument)
4986 	 * or an array of RiText objects (if supplied as an argument)
4987 	 * @param {array} array draws only the array if supplied (optional)
4988 	 */
4989 	RiText.drawAll = function(array) {
4990 		
4991 		if (arguments.length == 1 && is(array,A)) { 
4992 			for ( var i = 0; i < array.length; i++)
4993 				array[i] && array[i].draw();
4994 		}
4995 		else {
4996 			for ( var i = 0; i < RiText.instances.length; i++)
4997 				RiText.instances[i] && RiText.instances[i].draw();
4998 		}   
4999 	}
5000 	
5001 	/**
5002 	 * Sets/gets the default color
5003 	 * @returns {object} the current default color
5004 	 */
5005 	RiText.defaultColor = function(r, g, b, a) {
5006  
5007 		if (arguments.length) { 
5008 			RiText.defaults.color = parseColor.apply(this,arguments);
5009 		}
5010 		return RiText.defaults.color;
5011 	}
5012 	
5013 	// private statics ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5014 	
5015 	RiText._makeLines = function(txt, x, y, maxW, maxH, theFont) {
5016 
5017 		//log('_makeLines('+txt.length+','+x+','+y+','+maxW+','+maxH+','+theFont+')');
5018 
5019 		var currentH = 0, currentW = 0, newParagraph = false, forceBreak = false, strLines = [],
5020 			sb = RiText.defaults.indentFirstParagraph ? RiText.defaults.paragraphIndent : E,
5021 			g = RiText.renderer, fn = RiText._makeLines;
5022 			
5023 		// remove line breaks & add spaces around html
5024 		txt = replaceAll(txt, "[\r\n]", SP);
5025 		txt = replaceAll(txt," ?(<[^>]+>) ?", " $1 "); 	
5026 
5027 		// split into reversed array of words
5028 		var tmp = txt.split(SP), words = [];
5029 		for ( var i = tmp.length - 1; i >= 0; i--)
5030 			words.push(tmp[i]);
5031 
5032 
5033 		// cached helpers //////////////////////////////////////////// 
5034 		
5035 		fn.checkLineHeight = fn.checkLineHeight || function(currentH, lineH, maxH) {
5036 			
5037 			return currentH + lineH <= maxH;
5038 		};
5039 		
5040 		fn.addLine = fn.addLine || function(arr, s) {
5041 			if (s && s.length) {
5042 				// strip trailing spaces (regex?)
5043 				while (s.length > 0 && endsWith(s, ' '))
5044 					s = s.substring(0, s.length - 1);
5045 				arr.push(s); 
5046 			}
5047 		};
5048 		
5049 		// the guts ////////////////////////////////////////////////
5050 			
5051 		var tmp = new RiText('_',0,0,theFont), textH = tmp.textHeight();
5052 		RiText.dispose(tmp); // grab the line height [?]
5053 		
5054 		while (words.length > 0) {
5055 
5056 			var next = words.pop();
5057 			
5058 			if (next.length == 0) continue;
5059 
5060 			if (startsWith(next, '<') && endsWith(next, ">")) {
5061 		 
5062 				if (next === RiText.NON_BREAKING_SPACE || next === "</sp>") {
5063 					
5064 					sb += SP;
5065 				}
5066 				else if (next === RiText.PARAGRAPH || next === "</p>") {
5067 					
5068 					if (sb.length > 0) { // case: paragraph break
5069 						
5070 						newParagraph = true;
5071 					}
5072 					else if (RiText.indentFirstParagraph) {
5073 					
5074 						sb += RiText.defaults.paragraphIndent;
5075 					}
5076 				}
5077 				else if (endsWith(next, RiText.LINE_BREAK) || next === "</br>") {
5078 					
5079 					forceBreak = true;
5080 				}
5081 				continue;
5082 			}
5083 
5084 			currentW = g._textWidth(theFont, sb + next);
5085 
5086 			// check line-length & add a word
5087 			if (!newParagraph && !forceBreak && currentW < maxW) {
5088 				
5089 				sb += next + " "; 
5090 			}
5091 			else // new paragraph or line-break
5092 			{
5093 				// check vertical space, add line & next word
5094 				if (fn.checkLineHeight(currentH, textH, maxH)) {
5095 					
5096 					fn.addLine(strLines, sb);
5097 					sb = E;
5098 
5099 					if (newParagraph) { // do indent
5100 
5101 						sb += RiText.defaults.paragraphIndent;
5102 						if (RiText.defaults.paragraphLeading > 0) {
5103 							sb += '|'; // filthy
5104 						}
5105 					}
5106 					newParagraph = false;
5107 					forceBreak = false;
5108 					sb += next + SP;
5109 
5110 					currentH += textH;
5111 				}
5112 				else {
5113 					
5114 					if (next != null) words.push(next);
5115 					break;
5116 				}
5117 			}
5118 		}
5119 
5120 		// check if leftover words can make a new line
5121 		if (fn.checkLineHeight(currentH, textH, maxH)) {
5122 			
5123 			fn.addLine(strLines, sb);
5124 			sb = E;
5125 		}
5126 		else {
5127 			var tmp = sb.split(SP);
5128 			for ( var i = tmp.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
5129 				words.push(tmp[i]);
5130 			}
5131 		}
5132 		
5133 		return strLines;
5134 	}
5135 	
5136 	RiText._createRiTexts = function(txt, x, y, w, h, fontObj, splitFun) {  
5137 
5138 		if (!txt || !txt.length) return EA;
5139 
5140 		fontObj = fontObj || RiText._getDefaultFont();
5141 
5142 		var rlines = RiText.createLines(txt, x, y, w, h, fontObj);
5143 		if (!rlines) return EA;
5144 
5145 		var result = [];
5146 		for (var i = 0; i < rlines.length; i++) {
5147 			
5148 			var rts = splitFun.call(rlines[i]);
5149 			for (var j = 0; j < rts.length; j++) {// add the words
5150 				
5151 				result.push(rts[j].font(fontObj)); 
5152 			}
5153 			
5154 			RiText.dispose(rlines[i]);
5155 		}
5156 
5157 		return result;
5158 	}
5159 	
5160 	RiText._createLinesByCharCountFromArray = function(txtArr, startX, startY, fontObj) {
5161 
5162 		if (!fontObj) err('no font in _createLinesByCharCountFromArray!');
5163 
5164 		//log('createLinesByCharCountFromArray('+txtArr.length+','+startX+','+startY+','+fontObj.size+','+fontObj.leading+')');
5165 
5166 		var rts = [], leading = fontObj.leading, yOff = startY + leading;
5167 		
5168 		for ( var i = 0; i < txtArr.length; i++) {
5169 			
5170 			rts.push(RiText(txtArr[i], startX, yOff, fontObj));
5171 		}
5172 		
5173 		return (rts && rts.length > 1)  ? RiText._handleLeading(fontObj, rts, yOff) : []; 
5174 	}
5175 	
5176 	// Returns the pixel x-offset for the word at 'wordIdx' 
5177 	RiText._wordOffsetFor = function(rt, words, wordIdx) { 
5178 
5179 		if (wordIdx < 0 || wordIdx >= words.length)
5180 			throw new Error("Bad wordIdx=" + wordIdx + " for " + words);
5181 		
5182 		rt.g._pushState();
5183 
5184 		var xPos = rt.x;
5185 
5186 		if (wordIdx > 0) {
5187 			
5188 			var pre = words.slice(0, wordIdx);
5189 			var preStr = '';
5190 			for ( var i = 0; i < pre.length; i++) {
5191 				preStr += pre[i] + ' ';
5192 			}
5193 
5194 			var tw = rt.g._textWidth(rt._font, preStr);
5195 
5196 			//log("x="+xPos+" pre='"+preStr+"' tw=" + tw); 
5197 
5198 			switch (rt._alignment) {
5199 				case RiTa.LEFT:
5200 					xPos = rt.x + tw;
5201 					break;
5202 				case RiTa.RIGHT:
5203 					xPos = rt.x - tw;
5204 					break;
5205 				case RiTa.CENTER:
5206 					console.warn("TODO: test center-align here");
5207 					xPos = rt.x; // ?
5208 					break;
5209 			}
5210 		}
5211 		rt.g._popState();
5212
