5213 		return xPos;
5214 	}
5215 	
5216 	RiText._handleLeading = function(fontObj, rts, startY) {
5217 
5218 		
5219 		if(!rts || !rts.length) return;
5220 
5221 		fontObj = fontObj || RiText._getDefaultFont();
5222 
5223 		//log('handleLeading: '+fontObj.leading);
5224 
5225 		var nextHeight = startY;
5226 		rts[0].font(fontObj);
5227 		for(var i = 0; i < rts.length; i++) {
5228 
5229 			//if(fontObj) rts[i].font(fontObj); // set the font
5230 			rts[i].y = nextHeight; // adjust y-pos
5231 			nextHeight += fontObj.leading;
5232 		}
5233 
5234 		return rts;
5235 	}
5236 	
5237 	RiText._disposeOne = function(toDelete) {
5238 		
5239 		removeFromArray(RiText.instances, toDelete);
5240 		
5241 		if (toDelete) {
5242 			delete(toDelete._rs);
5243 			delete(toDelete);
5244 		}
5245 
5246 	}  
5247 
5248 	RiText._disposeArray = function(toDelete) {
5249 		
5250 		for ( var i = 0; i < toDelete.length; i++) {
5251 			
5252 			RiText._disposeOne(toDelete[i]);
5253 		}
5254 	}
5255 	
5256 	// TODO: test this font default across all platforms and browsers
5257 	
5258 	RiText._getDefaultFont = function() {
5259 		
5260 		//log("RiText._getDefaultFont: "+RiText.defaults.fontFamily+","+RiText.defaults.font.size);
5261 		
5262 		RiText.defaults.font = RiText.defaults.font || 
5263 			RiText.renderer._createFont(RiText.defaults.fontFamily, 
5264 				RiText.defaults.fontSize, RiText.defaults.fontSize * RiText.defaults.leadingFactor);
5265 		
5266 		return RiText.defaults.font;
5267 	}
5268 	
5269 	RiText.foreach = function(fun) {
5270 	
5271 		var f = function(el,idx,arr){ fun(el,idx,arr); return 1; }; 
5272 		RiText.instances.every(f);
5273 	}
5274 	
5275 	// PUBLIC statics (TODO: clean up) ///////////////////////////////////////////
5276    
5277 	RiText.NON_BREAKING_SPACE = "<sp>";
5278 	RiText.LINE_BREAK = "<br>";
5279 	RiText.PARAGRAPH = "<p>";
5280 	
5281 	RiText.instances = [];
5282 	
5283 	/**
5284 	 * A set of static defaults to be shared by RiText objects
5285 	 * Can be modified directly or through API methods.
5286 	 * 
5287 	 * @example 
5288 	 *  RiText.defaultAlignment(RiTa.RIGHT);
5289 	 *  RiText.defaultFontSize(20);
5290 	 * 
5291 	 * @example 
5292 	 *  RiText.defaults.alignment = RiTa.RIGHT;
5293 	 *  RiText.defaults.fontSize = 20;
5294 
5295 	 * @property {object} defaults
5296 	 */
5297 	RiText.defaults = { 
5298 		
5299 		color : { r : 0, g : 0, b : 0, a : 255 }, 
5300 		alignment : RiTa.LEFT, motionType : RiTa.LINEAR, font: null,
5301 		rotateX:0, rotateY:0, rotateZ: 0, scaleX:1, scaleY:1, scaleZ:1,
5302 		paragraphLeading :  0, paragraphIndent: '    ', indentFirstParagraph: false,
5303 		fontFamily: 'Times New Roman', fontSize: 14, leadingFactor : 1.1,
5304 		boundingBoxStroke : null, boundingBoxFill: null, boundingBoxVisible : false
5305 	}
5306 
5307 	RiText.prototype = {
5308 
5309 		/**
5310 		 * @private
5311 		 * @param {S | N | O} text
5312 		 * @param x
5313 		 * @param y
5314 		 * @param font
5315 		 * @returns {RiText}
5316 		 */
5317 		init : function(text, x, y, font) { 
5318 			
5319 			if (!RiText.renderer) 
5320 				err("No graphics context, RiText unavailable");
5321 
5322 			if (arguments.length) {
5323 				
5324 				if (is(text, O) && typeof text.text == F)
5325 					text = text.text();
5326 				
5327 				else if (is(text,N))    
5328 					text = String.fromCharCode(text);
5329 			}
5330 			else {
5331 				
5332 				text = E;
5333 			}
5334 			
5335 			ok(text, S);
5336 			
5337 			this._color = { 
5338 				r : RiText.defaults.color.r, 
5339 				g : RiText.defaults.color.g, 
5340 				b : RiText.defaults.color.b, 
5341 				a : RiText.defaults.color.a 
5342 			};
5343 			
5344 			var bbs = RiText.defaults.boundingBoxStroke;
5345 			this._boundingBoxStroke = { 
5346 				r : (bbs && bbs.r) || this._color.r, 
5347 				g : (bbs && bbs.g) || this._color.g, 
5348 				b : (bbs && bbs.b) || this._color.b, 
5349 				a : (bbs && bbs.a) || this._color.a
5350 			};
5351 			
5352 			var bbf = RiText.defaults.boundingBoxFill;
5353 			this._boundingBoxFill = { 
5354 				r : (bbf && bbf.r) || this._color.r, 
5355 				g : (bbf && bbf.g) || this._color.g, 
5356 				b : (bbf && bbf.b) || this._color.b, 
5357 				a : (bbf && bbf.a) || 0
5358 			};
5359 	
5360 			this._boundingBoxVisible = RiText.defaults.boundingBoxVisible;
5361 			this._motionType = RiText.defaults.motionType;
5362 			this._alignment = RiText.defaults.alignment;
5363 	
5364 			this._rotateZ = RiText.defaults.rotateZ;
5365 			this._scaleX = RiText.defaults.scaleX;
5366 			this._scaleY = RiText.defaults.scaleY;
5367 			this._scaleZ = 1;
5368 	 
5369 			this._behaviors = [];
5370 			this.font(font);
5371 			this.text(text);
5372 			
5373 			this.g = RiText.renderer;
5374 
5375 			//log('RiText) '+this._rs._text +" / "+ this._font.name);
5376 
5377 			// center by default
5378 			this.x = arguments.length>1 ? x : this.g._width() / 2 - this.textWidth() / 2.0;
5379 			this.y = arguments.length>1 ? y : this.g._height() / 2 + this.textHeight() / 2.0;
5380 			this.z = 0;
5381 
5382 			RiText.instances.push(this);
5383 			
5384 			return this;
5385 		},
5386 		
5387 		/**
5388 		 * Returns the specified feature, computing it first if necessary. <p>
5389 		 * 
5390 		 * Default features include RiTa.STRESSES, RiTa.PHONEMES, and RiTa.SYLLABLES.
5391 		 * 
5392 		 * @example myRiText.get('phonemes') ||  myRiText.get(RiTa.PHONEMES);
5393 		 * 
5394 		 * @returns {string} the requested feature
5395 		 */
5396 		get : function(featureName) {
5397 			
5398 			return this._rs.get(featureName);
5399 		},
5400 		
5401 		/**
5402 		 * Returns the full feature set for this object
5403 		 * 
5404 		 * @see #get
5405 		 * @see #analyze
5406 		 * 
5407 		 * @returns {array} the features 
5408 		 */
5409 		features : function() {
5410 			
5411 		   return this._rs.features();
5412 		},
5413 		
5414 		/**
5415 		 * Draws the object to the screen
5416 		 * 
5417 		 * @returns {object} this RiText
5418 		 */
5419 		draw : function() {
5420 		  this._update()._render();   
5421 		  if (this.fadeToTextCopy)
5422 			  this.fadeToTextCopy.draw();
5423 		  return this;
5424 		},
5425 		
5426 		_update : function() {
5427 			
5428 			var time = Date.now();
5429 			this._updateBehaviors(time);
5430 			return this;
5431 		},
5432 		
5433 		_render : function() {
5434 			
5435 			var g = this.g;
5436 			
5437 			if (!g) err('no-renderer');
5438 			
5439 			g._pushState();
5440 			
5441 			if (this._rs && this._rs.length) {
5442 			
5443 				g._pushState();
5444 				
5445 				// order: scale, center-point-trans, rotate,-center-point-trans,translate?
5446 				
5447 				g._rotate(this._rotateZ);
5448 				g._translate(this.x, this.y);
5449 				g._scale(this._scaleX, this._scaleY, this._scaleZ); 
5450 			 
5451 				// Set color
5452 				g._fill(this._color.r, this._color.g, this._color.b, this._color.a);
5453 	  
5454 				// Set font params
5455 				g._textFont(this._font);
5456 				g._textAlign(this._alignment);
5457 		
5458 				// Draw text
5459 				g._text(this._rs._text, 0, 0);
5460 		
5461 				// And the bounding box
5462 				if (this._boundingBoxVisible) {
5463 					
5464 					g._fill(this._boundingBoxFill.r, this._boundingBoxFill.g, 
5465 						this._boundingBoxFill.b, this._boundingBoxFill.a);
5466 					
5467 					g._stroke(this._boundingBoxStroke.r, this._boundingBoxStroke.g, 
5468 							this._boundingBoxStroke.b, this._boundingBoxStroke.a);
5469 					
5470 					var bb = g._getBoundingBox(this);
5471 					
5472 					// shift bounds based on alignment
5473 					switch(this._alignment) {
5474 						
5475 						case RiTa.RIGHT:
5476 							g._translate(-bb.width,0);
5477 							break;
5478 						case RiTa.CENTER:
5479 							g._translate(-bb.width/2,0);
5480 							break;
5481 					}
5482 					g._rect(0, bb.y, bb.width, bb.height);
5483 				}
5484 				
5485 				g._popState();
5486 			}
5487 	
5488 			return this;
5489 		},
5490 		
5491 		///////////////////////////////// Text Behaviors ////////////////////////////////////
5492 	
5493 		/**
5494 		 * Sets/gets the animation <code>motionType</code> for this RiText
5495 		 * according to one of the following functions: <br>
5496 		 * <ul>
5497 		 * <li>RiText.LINEAR
5498 		 * <li>
5499 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN
5500 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_OUT
5501 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_OUT
5502 		 * <li>
5503 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_EXPO
5504 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_OUT_EXPO
5505 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_EXPO
5506 		 * <li>
5507 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_SINE
5508 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_OUT_SINE
5509 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_SINE
5510 		 * <li>
5511 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_CUBIC
5512 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_OUT_CUBIC
5513 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_CUBIC
5514 		 * <li>
5515 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_QUARTIC
5516 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_OUT_QUARTIC
5517 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_QUARTIC
5518 		 * <li>
5519 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_QUINTIC
5520 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_OUT_QUINTIC
5521 		 * <li>RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_QUINTIC
5522 		 * <li>
5523 		 * <li>RiText.BACK_IN
5524 		 * <li>RiText.BACK_OUT
5525 		 * <li>RiText.BACK_IN_OUT
5526 		 * <li>
5527 		 * <li>RiText.BOUNCE_IN
5528 		 * <li>RiText.BOUNCE_OUT
5529 		 * <li>RiText.BOUNCE_IN_OUT
5530 		 * <li>
5531 		 * <li>RiText.CIRCULAR_IN
5532 		 * <li>RiText.CIRCULAR_OUT
5533 		 * <li>RiText.CIRCULAR_IN_OUT
5534 		 * <li>
5535 		 * <li>RiText.ELASTIC_IN
5536 		 * <li>RiText.ELASTIC_OUT
5537 		 * <li>RiText.ELASTIC_IN_OUT                  
5538 		 * </ul>
5539 		 * 
5540 		 * @param {number} motionType
5541 		 * @returns {number} motionType
5542 		 */
5543 		motionType : function (motionType) {
5544 			if (arguments.length) {
5545 				this._motionType = motionType;
5546 				return this;
5547 			}
5548 			return this._motionType;
5549 		},
5550 		
5551 		/**
5552 		 * Fades in current text over <code>seconds</code> starting at
5553 		 * <code>startTime</code>. Interpolates from the current color {r,g,b,a}
5554 		 * to {r,g,b,255}.
5555 		 * 
5556 		 * @param {number} seconds start Time
5557 		 *          time in future to start
5558 		 * @param {number} delay seconds
5559 		 *          time for fade
5560 		 * @param {function} callback 
5561 		 * 
5562 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for this behavior
5563 		 */
5564 		fadeIn : function(seconds, delay, callback) {
5565 			
5566 			return this.colorTo([this._color.r, this._color.g, this._color.b, 255],
5567 				seconds, delay, null, 'fadeIn', false);
5568 		},
5569 	
5570 		/**
5571 		 * Fades out current text over <code>seconds</code> starting at
5572 		 * <code>startTime</code>. Interpolates from the current color {r,g,b,a} 
5573 		 * to {r,g,b,0}.
5574 		 *
5575 		 * @param {number} seconds
5576 		 *          time for fade
5577 		 * @param {number} delay 
5578 		 *          (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start 
5579 		 *          
5580 		 * @param {function} callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e)
5581 		 * 
5582 		 * @param {boolean} destroyOnComplete
5583 		 *          (optional, default=false), destroys the object when the behavior completes
5584 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for this behavior
5585 		 */
5586 		fadeOut : function(seconds, delay, callback, destroyOnComplete) {
5587 	
5588 			destroyOnComplete = destroyOnComplete || false;
5589 			return this.colorTo([this._color.r, this._color.g, this._color.b, 0], 
5590 				seconds, delay, null, 'fadeOut', destroyOnComplete);
5591 		},
5592 
5593 		
5594 		/**
5595 		 * Scales to 'theScale' over 'seconds' starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
5596 		 * 
5597 		 * @param {number} theScale delay 
5598 		 *          (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start       
5599 		 * @param {number} seconds
5600 		 *          time for fade
5601 		 * @param {number} delay seconds
5602 		 *          time for fade
5603 		 * @param {function} callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e)
5604 		 * 
5605 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for this behavior
5606 		 */
5607 		scaleTo : function(theScale, seconds, delay, callback) {
5608 
5609 			var rt = this;
5610 			delay = delay || 0;
5611 			seconds = seconds || 1.0;
5612 				
5613 			var id = setTimeout(function() {
5614 				
5615 				var tb = new TextBehavior(rt)
5616 					.to( { _scaleX: theScale, _scaleY: theScale }, seconds*1000)
5617 					.easing(rt._motionType)
5618 					.onUpdate( function () {
5619 						rt._scaleX = this._scaleX;
5620 						rt._scaleY = this._scaleY;
5621 					})
5622 					//.delay(delay*1000)
5623 					.onComplete( 
5624 						function () {
5625 						   RiTaEvent(rt, 'scaleToComplete')._fire(callback);                    
5626 					});
5627 			
5628 				tb.start();
5629 				
5630 			}, delay*1000);
5631 				
5632 			return id;
5633 		},
5634 		
5635 		/**
5636 		 * Rotates to 'radians' over 'seconds' starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
5637 		 * 
5638 		 * @param {number} angleInRadians
5639 		 * @param {number} delay 
5640 		 *          (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start       
5641 		 * @param {number} seconds
5642 		 *          time for fade  
5643 		 * @param {function} callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e)
5644 		 * 
5645 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for this behavior
5646 		 */
5647 		rotateTo : function(angleInRadians, seconds, delay, callback) {
5648 
5649 			var rt = this;
5650 			delay = delay || 0;
5651 			seconds = seconds || 1.0;
5652 				
5653 			var id = setTimeout(function() {
5654 				
5655 				var tb = new TextBehavior(rt)
5656 					.to( { _rotateZ: angleInRadians  }, seconds*1000)
5657 					.easing(rt._motionType)
5658 					.onUpdate( function () {
5659 						rt._rotateZ = this._rotateZ;
5660 					})
5661 					//.delay(delay*1000)
5662 					.onComplete( 
5663 						function () {
5664 						   RiTaEvent(rt, 'rotateToComplete')._fire(callback);                    
5665 					});
5666 			
5667 				tb.start();
5668 				
5669 			}, delay*1000);
5670 				
5671 			return id;
5672 		},
5673 		
5674 		/**
5675 		 * Fades out the current text and fades in the <code>newText</code> over
5676 		 * <code>seconds</code>
5677 		 * 
5678 		 * @param {string} newText
5679 		 *          to be faded in
5680 		 * 
5681 		 * @param {number} seconds
5682 		 *          time for fade
5683 		 * 
5684 		 * @param {number} endAlpha 
5685 		 *  (optional, default=255), the alpha to end on
5686 		 *  
5687 		 * @param {function} callback the callback to be invoked when the 
5688 		 * behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))
5689 		 * 
5690 		 * @returns {number} - the unique id for this behavior
5691 		 */
5692 		textTo: function(newText, seconds, endAlpha, callback) {
5693 			
5694 		  // grab the alphas if needed
5695 		  var c = this._color, startAlpha = 0, endAlpha = endAlpha || 255; // this._color.a
5696 		  
5697 		  if (this.fadeToTextCopy) 
5698 		  {
5699 			startAlpha = this.fadeToTextCopy.alpha();
5700 			RiText.dispose(this.fadeToTextCopy); // stop any currents
5701 
5702 		  	// WORKING HERE ON FADE BUG
5703 			//log('disposing fadeToTextCopy');
5704 		  }
5705 		
5706 		  // use the copy to fade out
5707 		  this.fadeToTextCopy = this.clone();
5708 
5709 		  //this.fadeToTextCopy.fadeOut(seconds, 0, true);
5710 		  this.fadeToTextCopy.colorTo(
5711 		  		[this._color.r, this._color.g, this._color.b, 0], 
5712 				seconds, 0, null, 'silent', true); // fade-out
5713 		  
5714 		  RiText.dispose(this.fadeToTextCopy.fadeToTextCopy); // no turtles
5715 		  
5716 		  // and use 'this' to fade in
5717 		  this.text(newText).alpha(startAlpha);
5718 		  
5719 		  return this.colorTo([c.r, c.g, c.b, endAlpha], seconds * .95, 0, null, 'textTo', false);
5720 		},
5721 
5722 
5723 		/**
5724 		 * Transitions to 'color' (rgba) over 'seconds' starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
5725 		 * 
5726 		 * @param {array} colors (length 1-4)  r,g,b,a (0-255)
5727 		 * @param {number} seconds delay 
5728 		 *          (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start 
5729 		 * @param {number} delay seconds
5730 		 *          time for fade
5731 		 * @param {function} callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed
5732 		 *   (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))
5733 
5734 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for this behavior
5735 		 */
5736 		colorTo : function(colors, seconds, delay, callback, _type, _destroyOnComplete) {             
5737 
5738 			// DH: omitting last 2 args from docs as they are private!
5739 
5740 			if (!is(colors,A))  err('arg#1 to colorTo() must be an array');
5741 			
5742 			//log(colors[0], g: colors[1], b: colors[2], a: colors[3], seconds);
5743 
5744 			delay = delay || 0;
5745 			seconds = seconds || 1.0;
5746 			colors = parseColor.apply(this, colors);
5747 			_type = _type || 'colorTo';            
5748 
5749 			var rt = this, id = setTimeout(function() {
5750 
5751 				new TextBehavior(rt, rt._color)
5752 					.to( { r: colors.r, g: colors.g, b: colors.b, a: colors.a }, seconds*1000)
5753 					.easing(rt._motionType)
5754 					.onUpdate( function () {
5755 					   rt._color.r = this.r;
5756 					   rt._color.g = this.g;
5757 					   rt._color.b = this.b;
5758 					   rt._color.a = this.a
5759 					})
5760 					//.delay(delay)
5761 					.onComplete( 
5762 						function () {
5763 							if (_type != 'silent')
5764 								RiTaEvent(rt, _type+'Complete')._fire(callback);    
5765 							if (_destroyOnComplete) RiText.dispose(rt);
5766 						})
5767 					.start();
5768 				
5769 			}, delay*1000);
5770 			
5771 			return id;
5772 		},
5773 	   
5774 		/**
5775 		 * Move to new x,y position over 'seconds'
5776 		 * <p>
5777 		 * Note: uses the current <code>motionType</code> for this object, starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
5778 		 * 
5779 		 * @param {number} newX
5780 		 * @param {number} newY
5781 		 * @param {number} seconds
5782 		 * @param {number} delay
5783 		 * @param {function} callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e)
5784 		 * 
5785 		 * @returns {number} the unique id for this behavior
5786 		 */
5787 		moveTo : function(newX,newY,seconds,delay,callback) {
5788 			
5789 			var rt = this;
5790 			
5791 			delay = delay || 0;
5792 			seconds = seconds || 1.0;
5793 			
5794 			var id = setTimeout(function() {
5795 				
5796 				new TextBehavior(rt)
5797 					.to( { x: newX, y: newY }, seconds*1000)
5798 					.easing(rt._motionType)
5799 					.onUpdate( function () {
5800 						rt.x = this.x ;
5801 						rt.y = this.y ;
5802 					})
5803 					.delay(delay).onComplete( 
5804 						function () {
5805 							RiTaEvent(rt, 'moveToCompleted')._fire(callback);                    
5806 						})
5807 					.start();
5808 				
5809 			}, delay*1000);
5810 			
5811 			return id;
5812 		},
5813 
5814 		analyze : function() {
5815 	
5816 			this._rs.analyze();
5817 			return this;
5818 		},
5819 		
5820 		/**
5821 		 * Set/gets the text for this RiText
5822 		 * 
5823 		 * @param {string} txt the new text (optional)
5824 		 * @returns {object | string} this RiText (for sets) or the current text (for gets) 
5825 		 */
5826 		text : function(txt) {
5827 			
5828 			if (arguments.length == 1) {
5829 				
5830 				var theType = Type.get(txt);
5831 				
5832 				if (theType == N) {
5833 					txt = String.fromCharCode(txt);
5834 				}
5835 				else if (theType == O && typeof txt.text == F) { 
5836 					txt = txt.text();
5837 				}
5838 				this._rs = (this._rs) ? this._rs.text(txt) : new RiString(txt);
5839 				
5840 				if (!this._rs) err("no rs!! "+txt); // TODO:remove
5841 	 
5842 				return this;
5843 			}
5844 			
5845 			return this._rs._text;
5846 		},
5847 		
5848 		/**
5849 		 * Searches for a match between a substring (or regular expression) and the contained
5850 		 * string, and returns the matches
5851 		 * 
5852 		 * @param {string | object} regex
5853 		 * @returns {array} strings matches or empty array if none are found
5854 		 */
5855 		match : function(regex) {
5856 			
5857 			return this._rs.match(regex);
5858 			
5859 		},
5860 		
5861 		 /**
5862 		 * Returns the character at the given 'index', or empty string if none is found
5863 		 * 
5864 		 * @param {number} index index of the character
5865 		 * @returns {string} the character
5866 		 */
5867 		charAt : function(index) {
5868 
5869 			return this._rs.charAt(index);
5870 			
5871 		},
5872 
5873 		
5874 		/**
5875 		 * Concatenates the text from another RiText at the end of this one
5876 		 * 
5877 		 * @returns {object} this RiText
5878 		 */
5879 		concat : function(riText) {
5880 
5881 			return this._rs._text.concat(riText.text());
5882 			
5883 		},
5884 		
5885 		 /**
5886 		 * Returns true if and only if this string contains the specified sequence of char values.
5887 		 * 
5888 		 * @param {string} text text to be checked
5889 		 * @returns {boolean}
5890 		 */
5891 		containsWord : function(text) {
5892 			
5893 			return this._rs.indexOf(text) > -1;
5894 			
5895 		},
5896 		
5897 		/**
5898 		 * Tests if this string ends with the specified suffix.
5899 		 * 
5900 		 * @param {string} substr string the suffix.
5901 		 * 
5902 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of
5903 		 *         the character sequence represented by this object; false otherwise.          * 
5904 		 */
5905 		endsWith : function(substr) {
5906 			
5907 			return endsWith(this._rs._text, substr);
5908 			
5909 		},
5910 		
5911 		/**
5912 		 * Compares this RiText to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the
5913 		 * argument is not null and is a RiText object that represents the same sequence of
5914 		 * characters as this object.
5915 		 * 
5916 		 * @param {object} RiText RiText object to compare this RiText against.
5917 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the RiText are equal; false otherwise.
5918 		 */
5919 		equals : function(RiText) {
5920 			
5921 			return RiText._rs._text === this._rs._text;
5922 			
5923 		},
5924 
5925 		/**
5926 		 * Compares this RiText to another RiText, ignoring case considerations.
5927 		 * 
5928 		 * @param {string | object} str String or RiText object to compare this RiText against
5929 		 * @returns {boolean} true if the argument is not null and the Strings are equal, ignoring
5930 		 *         case; false otherwise.
5931 		 */
5932 		equalsIgnoreCase : function(str) {
5933 			
5934 			if (typeof str === S) {
5935 				
5936 				return str.toLowerCase() === this._rs._text.toLowerCase();
5937 			} 
5938 			else {
5939 				
5940 				return str.text().toLowerCase() === this._rs._text.toLowerCase();
5941 			}
5942 			
5943 		},
5944 		
5945 		 /**
5946 		 * Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character.
5947 		 * 
5948 		 * @param {string} searchstring (Required) or character to search for
5949 		 * @param {number} start (Optional) The start position in the string to start the search. If omitted,
5950 		 *        the search starts from position 0
5951 		 * @returns {number} the first index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found
5952 		 */
5953 		indexOf : function(searchstring, start) {
5954 			
5955 			return this._rs._text.indexOf(searchstring, start);
5956 			
5957 		},
5958 		
5959 		/**
5960 		 * Inserts 'newWord' at 'wordIdx' and shifts each subsequent word accordingly.
5961 		 *
5962 		 * @returns {object} this RiText
5963 		 */
5964 		insertWordAt : function(newWord, wordIdx) {
5965 					
5966 			var words = this._rs.words();
5967 			if (newWord && newWord.length && wordIdx >= 0 && wordIdx < words.length) {
5968 			 
5969 				// filthy hack to preserve punctuation in 'newWord'
5970 				words.splice(wordIdx,0, DeLiM+newWord+DeLiM);
5971 				
5972 				
5973 				this._rs.text( RiTa.untokenize(words).replace(new RegExp(DeLiM,'g'),E) );
5974 			}
5975 
5976 			return this;
5977 			
5978 		},
5979 		
5980 		 /**
5981 		 * Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character.
5982 		 * 
5983 		 * @param {string} searchstring The string to search for
5984 		 * @param {number} start (Optional) The start position in the string to start the search. If omitted,
5985 		 *        the search starts from position 0
5986 		 *        
5987 		 * @returns {number} the last index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found
5988 		 */
5989 		lastIndexOf : function(searchstring, start) {
5990 			
5991 			return this._rs._text.lastIndexOf(searchstring, start);
5992 			
5993 		},
5994 		
5995 		/**
5996 		 * Returns the length of this string.
5997 		 * 
5998 		 * @returns {number} the length
5999 		 */
6000 		length : function() {
6001 			
6002 			return this._rs._text.length;
6003 			
6004 		},
6005 		
6006 	
6007 		 /**
6008 		 * Returns an array of part-of-speech tags, one per word, using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.posTag().
6009 		 *
6010 		 * @returns {array} strings of pos, one per word
6011 		 */
6012 		pos : function() {
6013 				   
6014 			var words = RiTa.tokenize((this._rs._text)); // was getPlaintext()
6015 			var tags = PosTagger.tag(words); 
6016   
6017 			for ( var i = 0, l = tags.length; i < l; i++) {
6018 				if (!strOk(tags[i])) 
6019 					err("RiText: can't parse pos for:" + words[i]);
6020 			}
6021 		
6022 			return tags;
6023 			
6024 		},
6025 
6026 		/**
6027 		 * Returns the part-of-speech tag for the word at 'index', using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.posTag().
6028 		 * 
6029 		 * @param {number} index the word index
6030 		 * @returns {string} the pos
6031 		 */
6032 		posAt : function(index) {
6033 			
6034 			var tags = this._rs.pos();
6035 
6036 			if (undef(tags) || tags.length == 0 || index < 0 || index >= tags.length)
6037 				return E;
6038 			
6039 			return tags[index];
6040 			
6041 		},
6042 
6043 		 /**
6044 		 * Inserts the character at the specified index
6045 		 * 
6046 		 * @param {number} ind the index
6047 		 * @param {string} theChar the character(s)
6048 		 * @returns {object} RiText
6049 		 */
6050 		insertChar : function(ind, theChar) { 
6051 			
6052 			this._rs.insertChar(ind, theChar);
6053 			return this;
6054 			
6055 		},
6056 		
6057 		/**
6058 		 * Removes the character at the specified index
6059 		 * 
6060 		 * @param {number} ind the index
6061 		 * @returns {object} RiText
6062 		 */
6063 		removeChar : function(ind) { 
6064 			
6065 			this._rs.removeChar(ind);
6066 			return this;
6067 			
6068 		},
6069 
6070 	  /**
6071 		 * Replaces the character at 'idx' with 'replaceWith'. If the specified 'idx' is less than
6072 		 * zero, or beyond the length of the current text, there will be no effect.
6073 		 * 
6074 		 * @param {number} idx the character index
6075 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
6076 		 * @returns {object} this RiText
6077 		 */
6078 		replaceChar : function(idx, replaceWith) {
6079 			
6080 			// if (idx < 0 || idx >= this._rs.length()) 
6081 				// return this;
6082 			//                 
6083 			// var s = this._rs.text();
6084 			// var beg = s.substring(0, idx);
6085 			// var end = s.substring(idx + 1);
6086 			// var s2 = null;
6087 			//             
6088 			// if (replaceWith)
6089 				// s2 = beg + replaceWith + end;
6090 			// else
6091 				// s2 = beg + end;
6092 			// 
6093 			// return this._rs.text(s2);
6094 			this._rs.replaceChar(idx, replaceWith);
6095 			return this;
6096 		},
6097 
6098 		/**
6099 		 * Replaces the first instance of 'regex' with 'replaceWith'
6100 		 * 
6101 		 * @param {string | regex} regex the pattern
6102 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
6103 		 * 
6104 		 * @returns this RiText
6105 		 */
6106 		replaceFirst : function(regex, replaceWith) {
6107 			
6108 			if (replaceWith) 
6109 				this._rs._text = this._rs._text.replace(regex,replaceWith);
6110 			return this;
6111 			
6112 		},
6113 		
6114 		/**
6115 		 * Replaces the last instance of 'regex' with 'replaceWith'
6116 		 * 
6117 		 * @param {string | regex} regex the pattern
6118 		 * @param {string} replaceWith the replacement
6119 		 * 
6120 		 * @returns this RiText
6121 		 */
6122 		replaceLast : function(regex, replaceWith) {
6123 		   
6124 			if (replaceWith) {
6125 
6126 				if (this._rs._text.lastIndexOf(regex) >= 0) { //TODO: this do not work for regex..
6127 					var ind = this._rs._text.lastIndexOf(regex);
6128 					var before = this._rs._text.substring(0, ind);
6129 					var after = this._rs._text.substring(ind + regex.length);
6130 
6131 					var finished = before + replaceWith + after;
6132 					this._rs._text = finished;
6133 
6134 					return this;
6135 				}
6136 			};
6137 
6138 
6139 		},
6140 		
6141 		
6142 		/**
6143 		 * Replaces each substring of this string that matches the given regular expression with the
6144 		 * given replacement.
6145 		 * 
6146 		 * @param {string | regex } pattern the pattern to be matched
6147 		 * @param {string} replacement the replacement sequence of char values
6148 		 * @returns {object} this RiText
6149 		 */
6150 		replaceAll : function(pattern, replacement) {
6151 			
6152 			if (pattern && (replacement || replacement==='')) {
6153 				this._rs._text = replaceAll(this._rs._text, pattern, replacement);
6154 			}
6155 			return this;
6156 			
6157 		},
6158 		
6159 		/**
6160 		 * Inserts 'newWord' at 'wordIdx' 
6161 		 * 
6162 		 * @param {number} wordIdx the index
6163 		 * @param {string} newWord the string to insert
6164 		 * 
6165 		 * @returns {object} this RiText
6166 		 */
6167 		insertWord : function(wordIdx, newWord) {
6168 			
6169 			// var words = this.words();
6170 			//         	  
6171 						// if (wordIdx >= 0 && wordIdx < words.length) { 
6172 			//                 
6173 							// var newWords = [];
6174 			//                 
6175 							// for (var i=0; i <= wordIdx; i++)  // OPT?
6176 							  // newWords.push(words[i]);
6177 			//                 
6178 							// newWords.push(newWord);
6179 			//                 
6180 							// for (var i=wordIdx+1; i < words.length; i++) 
6181 							  // newWords.push(words[i]);
6182 			//                   
6183 							// this._rs.text(RiTa.untokenize(words));
6184 						// }
6185 			//             
6186 						this._rs.insertWord(wordIdx, newWord);
6187 						return this;
6188 					},
6189 					
6190 					   
6191 					 /**
6192 					 * Replaces the word at 'wordIdx' with 'newWord'
6193 					 * 
6194 					 * @param {number} wordIdx the index
6195 					 * @param {string} newWord the replacement
6196 					 * 
6197 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6198 					 */
6199 					replaceWord : function(wordIdx, newWord) {
6200 						
6201 						// var words = this.words();
6202 						 
6203 						// if (wordIdx >= 0 && wordIdx < words.length) {
6204 							
6205 							// words[wordIdx] = newWord;
6206 							 
6207 							// this._rs.text(RiTa.untokenize(words));
6208 						// }
6209 						
6210 						this._rs.replaceWord(wordIdx, newWord);
6211 						
6212 						return this; // TODO: check that all RiText methods use the delegate 
6213 									//  (like above) for methods that exist in RiString
6214 					},
6215 					
6216 					/**
6217 					 * Removes the word at 'wordIdx'.
6218 					 * 
6219 					 * @param {number} wordIdx the index
6220 					 * 
6221 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6222 					 */
6223 					removeWord : function(wordIdx) {
6224 						
6225 						this._rs.removeWord(wordIdx,E);
6226 						return this;
6227 					},  
6228 					
6229 					 /**
6230 					 * Extracts a part of a string from this RiText
6231 					 * 
6232 					 * @param {number} begin (Required) The index where to begin the extraction. First character is at
6233 					 *        index 0
6234 					 * @param {number} end (Optional) Where to end the extraction. If omitted, slice() selects all
6235 					 *        characters from the begin position to the end of the string
6236 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6237 					 */
6238 					slice : function(begin, end) {
6239 						
6240 						var res = this._rs._text.slice(begin, end) || E;
6241 						return this._rs.text(res);
6242 						 
6243 					},
6244 					
6245 					/**
6246 					 * Split a RiText into an array of sub-RiText and return the new array.
6247 					 * 
6248 					 * If an empty string ("") is used as the separator, the string is split between each character.
6249 					 * 
6250 					 * @param {string} separator (Optional) Specifies the character to use for splitting the string. If
6251 					 *        omitted, the entire string will be returned. If an empty string ("") is used as the separator, 
6252 					 *        the string is split between each character.
6253 					 *        
6254 					 * @param {number} limit (Optional) An integer that specifies the number of splits
6255 					 * 
6256 					 * @returns {array} RiText
6257 					 */
6258 					split : function(separator, limit) {
6259 						
6260 						var parts = this._rs._text.split(separator, limit);
6261 						var rs = [];
6262 						for ( var i = 0; i < parts.length; i++) {
6263 							if (!undef(parts[i]))
6264 								rs.push(new RiText(parts[i]));
6265 						}
6266 						return rs;
6267 						
6268 					},
6269 					
6270 					 /**
6271 					 * Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.
6272 					 * 
6273 					 * @param {string} substr string the prefix
6274 					 * @returns {boolean} true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of
6275 					 *         the character sequence represented by this string; false otherwise. Note also
6276 					 *         that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this
6277 					 *         RiText object as determined by the equals() method.
6278 					 */
6279 					startsWith : function(substr) {
6280 						
6281 						return this._rs.indexOf(substr) == 0;
6282 						
6283 					},
6284 					
6285 					 /**
6286 					 * Extracts the characters from a string, between two specified indices, and sets the
6287 					 * current text to be that string. 
6288 					 * 
6289 					 * @param {number} from  The index where to start the extraction. First character is at
6290 					 *        index 0
6291 					 * @param {number} to (optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the
6292 					 *        rest of the string
6293 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6294 					 */
6295 					substring : function(from, to) {
6296 
6297 						return this._rs.text(this._rs._text.substring(from, to));
6298 						
6299 					},
6300 
6301 					
6302 					 /**
6303 					 * Extracts the characters from this objects contained string, beginning at 'start' and
6304 					 * continuing through the specified number of characters, and sets the current text to be
6305 					 * that string. (from Javascript String)
6306 					 * 
6307 					 * @param {number} start  The index where to start the extraction. First character is at
6308 					 *        index 0
6309 					 * @param {number} length (optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the
6310 					 *        rest of the string
6311 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6312 					 */
6313 					substr : function(start, length) {
6314 						
6315 						var res = this._rs._text.substr(start, length);
6316 						return this._rs.text(res);
6317 						
6318 					},
6319 					
6320 					/**
6321 					 * Converts this object to an array of RiText objects, one per character
6322 					 * 
6323 					 * @returns {array} RiTexts with each letter as its own RiText element
6324 					 */
6325 					toCharArray : function() {
6326 						var parts = this._rs._text.split(E);
6327 						var rs = [];
6328 						for ( var i = 0; i < parts.length; i++) {
6329 							if (!undef(parts[i]))
6330 								rs.push(parts[i]);
6331 						}
6332 						return rs;
6333 					},
6334 					
6335 					 /**
6336 					 * Converts all of the characters in this RiText to lower case
6337 					 * 
6338 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6339 					 */
6340 					toLowerCase : function() {
6341 						
6342 						return this._rs.text(this._rs._text.toLowerCase());
6343 						
6344 					 },
6345 					 
6346 					 /**
6347 					 * Converts all of the characters in this RiText to upper case
6348 					 * 
6349 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6350 					 */
6351 					toUpperCase : function() {
6352 						
6353 						return this._rs.text(this._rs._text.toUpperCase());
6354 						
6355 					},
6356 					
6357 					/**
6358 					 * Returns a copy of the string, with leading and trailing whitespace omitted.
6359 					 * 
6360 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6361 					 */
6362 					trim : function() {
6363 						
6364 						return this._rs.text(trim(this._rs._text));
6365 						
6366 					},
6367 					
6368 							/**
6369 					 * Returns the word at 'index', according to RiTa.tokenize()
6370 					 * 
6371 					 * @param {number} index the word index
6372 					 * @returns {string} the word
6373 					 */
6374 					wordAt : function(index) {
6375 						
6376 						var words = RiTa.tokenize((this._rs._text));
6377 						if (index < 0 || index >= words.length)
6378 							return E;
6379 						return words[index];
6380 						
6381 					},
6382 					
6383 					 /**
6384 					 * Returns the number of words in the object, according to RiTa.tokenize().
6385 					 * 
6386 					 * @returns {number} number of words
6387 					 */
6388 					wordCount : function() {
6389 						
6390 						if (!this._rs._text.length) return 0;
6391 						return this.words().length;
6392 						
6393 					},
6394 					
6395 					/**
6396 					 * Returns the array of words in the object, via a call to RiTa.tokenize().
6397 					 * 
6398 					 * @returns {array} strings, one per word
6399 					 */
6400 					words : function() { //TODO: change to words()
6401 						
6402 						return RiTa.tokenize(this._rs._text);
6403 						
6404 					},
6405 
6406 
6407 					/**
6408 					 * Returns the distance between the center points of this and another RiText
6409 					 * @returns {number} the distance
6410 					 */
6411 					distanceTo : function(riText)
6412 					{
6413 					  var p1 = this.center(), p2 = riText.center();
6414 					  return RiTa.distance( p1.x,  p1.y,  p2.x,  p2.y);
6415 					},
6416 				  
6417 					/**
6418 					 * Returns the center point of this RiText as derived from its bounding box
6419 					 * @returns {object} { x, y }
6420 					 */
6421 					center : function() {
6422 						
6423 						var bb = this.boundingBox();
6424 						return { x: bb.x+bb.width/2, y: bb.y - bb.height/2 };
6425 					},
6426 					
6427 					/**
6428 					 * Splits the object into an array of RiTexts, one per word
6429 					 * tokenized with the supplied regex.
6430 					 * 
6431 					 * @param {regex | string} to split
6432 					 * @returns {array} RiTexts
6433 					 */
6434 					splitWords : function(regex) {
6435 						
6436 						regex = regex || ' ';
6437 						
6438 						(typeof regex == S) && (regex = new RegExp(regex));  
6439 						
6440 						var l = [];
6441 						var txt = this._rs._text;
6442 						var words = txt.split(regex);
6443 				
6444 						for ( var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
6445 							if (words[i].length < 1) continue;
6446 							var tmp = this.clone();
6447 							tmp.text(words[i]);
6448 							var mx = RiText._wordOffsetFor(this, words, i);
6449 							tmp.position(mx, this.y);
6450 							l.push(tmp);
6451 						}
6452 				
6453 						return l;
6454 					},
6455 				
6456 					/**
6457 					 * Splits the object into an array of RiTexts, one per letter.
6458 					 * @returns {array} RiTexts
6459 					 */
6460 					splitLetters : function() {
6461 				
6462 						var l = [];
6463 						var chars = [];
6464 						var txt = this.text();
6465 						var len = txt.length;
6466 						for (var t = 0; t < len; t++) {
6467 							chars[t] = txt.charAt(t);
6468 						}
6469 				
6470 						for ( var i = 0; i < chars.length; i++) {
6471 							if (chars[i] == ' ') continue;
6472 							var tmp = this.clone();
6473 							tmp.text(chars[i]);
6474 							var mx = this.charOffset(i);
6475 							tmp.position(mx, this.y);
6476 				
6477 							l.push(tmp);
6478 						}
6479 				
6480 						return l;
6481 					},
6482 					
6483 					/**
6484 					 * Returns true if the bounding box for this RiText contains the point mx/my
6485 					 * 
6486 					 * @param {number} mx
6487 					 * @param {number} my
6488 					 * @returns {boolean}
6489 					 */
6490 					contains : function(mx, my) {
6491 									
6492 					   var bb = this.g._getBoundingBox(this);
6493 					   
6494 						//           // TODO: need to test this with point
6495 						//           if (!my && Type.get(mx.x) == 'Number' && Type.get(mx.y) == 'Number') {
6496 						//               mx = mx.x;
6497 						//               my = mx.y;
6498 						//           }
6499 						//           
6500 					   bb.x += this.x;
6501 					   bb.y += this.y;
6502 					   
6503 					   return (!(mx<bb.x || mx > bb.x+bb.width || my > bb.y || my < bb.y-bb.height));
6504 					},
6505 					
6506 					/**
6507 					 * Creates and returns a new (copy) of this RiText
6508 					 * @returns {object} RiText
6509 					 */
6510 					clone : function() {
6511 
6512 						var c = new RiText(this.text(), this.x, this.y, this._font);
6513 						c.color(this._color.r, this._color.g, this._color.b, this._color.a);
6514 
6515 						for (var prop in this) {
6516 							if (typeof this[prop] ==  F || typeof this[prop] ==  O) 
6517 								continue;
6518 							c[prop] = this[prop];
6519 						}
6520 
6521 						return c;
6522 					},
6523 					
6524 					/**
6525 					 * Set/gets the alignment for this RiText (RiTa.LEFT || RiTa.CENTER || RiTa.RIGHT)
6526 					 * 
6527 					 * @param {object} align (optional) the alignment 
6528 					 * @returns {object} this RiText (set) or the current font (get)
6529 					 */
6530 					align : function(align) {
6531 						if (arguments.length) {
6532 							this._alignment = align;
6533 							return this;
6534 						}
6535 						return this._alignment;
6536 					},
6537 
6538 					
6539 					/**
6540 					 * Set/gets the font for this RiText
6541 					 * 
6542 					 * @param {object} font (optional) containing the font data OR
6543 					 * @param {string} font containing the font name AND
6544 					 * @param {number} size (optional) containing the font size 
6545 					 * @returns {object} this RiText (set) or the current font (get)
6546 					 */
6547 					font : function(font, size) {
6548 						
6549 						var a = arguments;
6550 						
6551 						if (a.length == 1) {
6552 
6553 							this._font = font || RiText._getDefaultFont();
6554 							this._font.size = this._font.size || RiText.defaults.fontSize;
6555 							this._font.leading = this._font.leading || this._font.size * RiText.defaults.leadingFactor;
6556 							return this;
6557 						}
6558 						else if (a.length == 2) {
6559 							
6560 							return this.font( RiText.createFont(a[0], a[1]) );
6561 						}
6562 
6563 						return this._font;
6564 					},    
6565 					
6566 
6567 					/**
6568 					 * Set/gets the boundingbox visibility for this RiText
6569 					 * 
6570 					 * @param {boolean} trueOrFalse (optional) true or false 
6571 					 * @returns {object | boolean}this RiText (set) or the current boolean value (get)
6572 					 */
6573 					showBoundingBox : function(trueOrFalse) {
6574 					   if (arguments.length == 1) {
6575 						   this._boundingBoxVisible = trueOrFalse;
6576 						   return this;
6577 					   }
6578 					   return this._boundingBoxVisible;
6579 					},
6580 
6581 					/**
6582 					 * Set/gets the color for this RiText
6583 					 * 
6584 					 * @param {number | array} cr takes 1-4 number values for rgba, or an array of size 1-4
6585 					 * @param {number} cg
6586 					 * @param {number} cb
6587 					 * @param {number} ca
6588 					 * 
6589 					 * @returns {object} either this RiText (for sets) or the current color object (for gets)
6590 					 */
6591 					color : function(cr, cg, cb, ca) {
6592 						
6593 						if (arguments.length == 0) 
6594 							return this._color;
6595 						this._color = parseColor.apply(this, arguments);
6596 						return this;
6597 					},
6598 				
6599 					/**
6600 					 * Returns false if the alpha value of this object is <= 0, else true
6601 					 * @returns {boolean} 
6602 					 */
6603 					isVisible : function(b) { 
6604 						
6605 						if (arguments.length)
6606 							 err('visible() takes no arguments');
6607 						
6608 						return this._color.a > 0;
6609 					},
6610 					
6611 					/**
6612 					 * Set/gets the alpha (transparency) for this RiText
6613 					 *
6614 					 * @param {number} a (optional) input (0-255) 
6615 					 * @returns {object | number} either this RiText (for set) or the current alpha value (for get)
6616 					 */
6617 					alpha : function(a) {
6618 						if (arguments.length==1) {
6619 							this._color.a = a;
6620 							return this;
6621 						}
6622 						else return this._color.a;
6623 					},
6624 				
6625 					/**
6626 					 * Set/gets the position for this RiText
6627 					 * 
6628 					 * @param {number} x (optional) X coordinate
6629 					 * @param {number} y (optional) Y coordinate
6630 					 * 
6631 					 * @returns {object} either this RiText (for sets) or object {x, y} (for gets)
6632 					 */
6633 					position : function(x, y) {
6634 						
6635 						//TODO: add Z
6636 						 
6637 						if (!arguments.length) 
6638 							return { x: this.x, y: this.y };
6639 						this.x = x;
6640 						this.y = y;
6641 						return this;
6642 					},
6643 				 
6644 					/**
6645 					 * Sets/gets the 2d rotation for this RiText
6646 					 * 
6647 					 * @param {number} rotate degree to rotate
6648 					 * 
6649 					 * @returns {object} either this RiText (for sets) or the current degree of rotation (for gets)
6650 					 */
6651 					rotate : function(rotate) {
6652 						
6653 						//TODO: add X,Y ??
6654 					  if (!arguments.length) 
6655 						  return this._rotateZ
6656 					  this._rotateZ = rotate;
6657 					  return this;
6658 					},
6659 				
6660 					/**
6661 					 * Sets/gets the scale factor for this RiText (takes 0-2 arguments) 
6662 					 * 
6663 					 * @param {number} theScaleX the ScaleX ratio
6664 					 * @param {number} theScaleY (optional) the ScaleY ratio 
6665 					 * 
6666 					 @returns { object } either this RiText (for sets) or the current scales (for gets)
6667 					 */
6668 					scale : function(theScaleX, theScaleY) {
6669 						
6670 						if (!arguments.length) return { x:this._scaleX, y:this._scaleY }; //TODO: add Z
6671 							
6672 						if (arguments.length == 1) theScaleY = theScaleX;
6673 						
6674 						this._scaleX = theScaleX;
6675 						this._scaleY = theScaleY;
6676 						
6677 						return this;
6678 					},
6679 				
6680 					/**
6681 					 * Returns the pixel x-offset for the character at 'charIdx'
6682 					 * 
6683 					 * @param {number} charIdx
6684 					 * @returns {number} the pixel x-offset
6685 					 */
6686 					charOffset : function(charIdx) {
6687 				
6688 						var theX = this.x;
6689 				
6690 						if (charIdx > 0) {
6691 				
6692 							var txt = this.text();
6693 				
6694 							var len = txt.length;
6695 							if (charIdx > len) // -1?
6696 							charIdx = len;
6697 				
6698 							var sub = txt.substring(0, charIdx);
6699 							theX = this.x + this.g._textWidth(this._font, sub);
6700 						}
6701 
6702 						return theX;
6703 					},
6704 					
6705 					/**
6706 					 * Returns the pixel x-offset for the word at 'wordIdx'
6707 					 * @param {number} wordIdx
6708 					 * @returns {number} the pixel x-offset
6709 					 */
6710 					wordOffset : function(wordIdx) { 
6711 						
6712 						var words =  this.text().split(' ');
6713 						return RiText._wordOffsetFor(this, words, wordIdx);
6714 					},
6715 
6716 					/**
6717 					 * Returns the relative bounding box for the current text
6718 					 * @param {boolean} (optional, default=false) 
6719 					 * 	if true, bounding box is first transformed (rotate,translate,scale) 
6720 					 * @returns {object} x,y,width,height 
6721 					 */
6722 					boundingBox : function(transformed) {
6723 
6724 						var g = this.g;
6725 
6726 						g._pushState();
6727 
6728 						g._rotate(this._rotateZ);
6729 						g._translate(this.x, this.y);
6730 						g._scale(this._scaleX, this._scaleY, this._scaleZ); 
6731 				
6732 						// Set font params
6733 						g._textFont(this._font);
6734 						g._textAlign(this._alignment);
6735 		
6736 							var bb = this.g._getBoundingBox(this);
6737 							if (transformed) {
6738 								bb.x += this.x;
6739 								bb.y += this.y;
6740 								bb.width *= this._scaleX;
6741 								bb.height *= this._scaleY
6742 							}
6743 								
6744 						g._popState();
6745 
6746 						return bb;
6747 					},
6748 
6749 					/**
6750 					 * Returns the current width of the text (derived from the bounding box)
6751 					 * @returns {number} the width of the text
6752 					 */
6753 					//@param {boolean} (optional, default=false) if true, width is first scaled
6754 					textWidth : function() { 
6755 						
6756 						return this.g._textWidth(this._font,this._rs._text);
6757 					},
6758 					
6759 					/**
6760 					 * Returns the current height of the text (derived from the bounding box)
6761 					 * @returns {number} the current height of the text
6762 					 */
6763 					// * @param {boolean} (optional, default=false) if true, height is first scaled
6764 					textHeight : function() { 
6765 						
6766 						return this.g._textHeight(this);
6767 					},
6768 					
6769 					/**
6770 					 * Sets/gets the size of the current font. Note: this method only
6771 					 * effects only scaleX/Y, not the font's internal properties 
6772 					 * 
6773 					 * @param {number} sz (optional) font size 
6774 					 * 
6775 					 * @returns {object | number} either this RiText (for set) or the current font size (for get)
6776 					 */
6777 					fontSize : function(sz) {
6778 			 
6779 						// TODO: what to do if scaleX and scaleY are different?
6780 						
6781 						return (arguments.length) ? this.scale( sz / this._font.size) 
6782 							: (this._font.size * this._scaleX);
6783 					},
6784 					
6785 					/**
6786 					 * Returns the ascent of the current font 
6787 					 * @returns {number} the ascent of the current font
6788 					 */
6789 					textAscent : function() { 
6790 						
6791 						return this.g._textAscent(this);
6792 					},
6793 					
6794 					/**
6795 					 * Returns the descent of the current font 
6796 					 * @returns {number} the descent of the current font 
6797 					 */
6798 					textDescent : function() { 
6799 						
6800 						return this.g._textDescent(this);
6801 					},
6802 					 
6803 					/**
6804 					 * Adds a new text behavior to the object  
6805 					 * @returns {array} 
6806 					 */
6807 					_addBehavior: function ( behavior ) {
6808 
6809 						this._behaviors.push( behavior );
6810 
6811 					},
6812 					
6813 					/**
6814 					 * Returns the specified text behavior  
6815 					 * @param {number} the behavior id
6816 					 */
6817 					_getBehavior: function ( id ) {
6818 
6819 						for (var i = 0; i < this._behaviors.length; i++) {
6820 							if (this._behaviors[i].id == id)
6821 								return this._behaviors[i].id;
6822 						}
6823 						
6824 						return null;
6825 					},
6826 					
6827 					/**
6828 					 * Removes the specified text behavior for the object  
6829 					 * 
6830 					 * @param {number} the behavior id
6831 					 * @returns {object} this RiText
6832 					 */
6833 					stopBehavior: function ( id ) {
6834 
6835 						var behavior = this._getBehavior(id);
6836 						
6837 						if (behavior) {
6838 							var i = this._behaviors.indexOf(behavior);
6839 							if ( i !== -1 ) {
6840 				
6841 								this._behaviors.splice( i, 1 );
6842 				
6843 							}
6844 						}
6845 						return this;
6846 					},
6847 					
6848 					/**
6849 					 * Removes all text behaviors for the object  
6850 					 * 
6851 					 * @returns {object} this RiText 
6852 					 */
6853 					stopBehaviors: function () {
6854 
6855 						this._behaviors = [];
6856 						return this;
6857 					},
6858 					
6859 					/**
6860 					 * Updates existing text behaviors for the object 
6861 					 * @param {string} the behaviors
6862 					 */
6863 					_updateBehaviors: function (time) {
6864 
6865 						var i = 0;
6866 						var num = this._behaviors.length;
6867 						var time = time || Date.now();
6868 
6869 						while ( i < num ) {
6870 
6871 							if (this._behaviors[ i ].update(time) ) {
6872 								i++;
6873 
6874 							} else {
6875 
6876 								this._behaviors.splice(i, 1);
6877 								num --;
6878 
6879 							}
6880 						}
6881 					},
6882 					
6883 					/** @private */
6884 					toString : function() {
6885 						
6886 						var s =  (this._rs && this._rs._text) || 'undefined';
6887 						return '['+Math.round(this.x)+","+Math.round(this.y)+",'"+s+"']";
6888 					}
6889 
6890 					//        updateMousePosition : function(curElement, event) {
6891 					//            var offset = calculateOffset(window, event);
6892 					//            p.mouseX = event.pageX - offset.X;
6893 					//            p.mouseY = event.pageY - offset.Y
6894 					//        }
6895 				}
6896 				
6897 				/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6898 				// RiLetterToSound (adapted from FreeTTS text-to-speech)
6899 				/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6900 				
6901 				var LetterToSound = makeClass();
6902 				
6903 				/**
6904 				 * Entry in file represents the total number of states in the file. This
6905 				 * should be at the top of the file. The format should be "TOTAL n" where n is
6906 				 * an integer value.
6907 				 */
6908 				LetterToSound.TOTAL = "TOTAL";
6909 				
6910 				/**
6911 				 * Entry in file represents the beginning of a new letter index. This should
6912 				 * appear before the list of a new set of states for a particular letter. The
6913 				 * format should be "INDEX n c" where n is the index into the state machine
6914 				 * array and c is the character.
6915 				 */
6916 				LetterToSound.INDEX = "INDEX";
6917 				
6918 				/**
6919 				 * Entry in file represents a state. The format should be "STATE i c t f"
6920 				 * where 'i' represents an index to look at in the decision string, c is the
6921 				 * character that should match, t is the index of the state to go to if there
6922 				 * is a match, and f is the of the state to go to if there isn't a match.
6923 				 */
6924 				LetterToSound.STATE = "STATE";
6925 				
6926 				/**
6927 				 * Entry in file represents a final state. The format should be "PHONE p"
6928 				 * where p represents a phone string that comes from the phone table.
6929 				 */
6930 				LetterToSound.PHONE = "PHONE";
6931 				
6932 				/**
6933 				 * If true, the state string is tokenized when it is first read. The side
6934 				 * effects of this are quicker lookups, but more memory usage and a longer
6935 				 * startup time.
6936 				 */
6937 				LetterToSound.tokenizeOnLoad = true;
6938 				
6939 				/**
6940 				 * If true, the state string is tokenized the first time it is referenced. The
6941 				 * side effects of this are quicker lookups, but more memory usage.
6942 				 */
6943 				LetterToSound.tokenizeOnLookup = false;
6944 
6945 				/**
6946 				 * The 'window size' of the LTS rules.
6947 				 */
6948 				LetterToSound.WINDOW_SIZE = 4;
6949 
6950 				/** The list of phones that can be returned by the LTS rules.
6951 				LetterToSound.phonemeTable = null;  */
6952 				
6953 				LetterToSound.prototype = {
6954 					
6955 					/**
6956 					 * @private
6957 					 */
6958 					init : function() {
6959 						
6960 						/**
6961 						 * The indices of the starting points for letters in the state machine.
6962 						 */
6963 						this.letterIndex = {};
6964 						
6965 						/**
6966 						 * An array of characters to hold a string for checking against a rule. This
6967 						 * will be reused over and over again, so the goal was just to have a single
6968 						 * area instead of new'ing up a new one for every word. The name choice is to
6969 						 * match that in Flite's <code>cst_lts.c</code>.
6970 						 */
6971 					   this.fval_buff = [];
6972 				
6973 						/**
6974 						 * The LTS state machine. Entries can be String or State. An ArrayList could
6975 						 * be used here -- I chose not to because I thought it might be quicker to
6976 						 * avoid dealing with the dynamic resizing.
6977 						 */
6978 						this.stateMachine = null;
6979 				
6980 						/**
6981 						 * The number of states in the state machine.
6982 						 */
6983 						this.numStates = 0;
6984 						
6985 						// verify that the lts rules are included
6986 						if (!LetterToSound.RULES) LetterToSound.RULES = _RiTa_LTS;
6987 						
6988 						if (!LetterToSound.RULES.length) 
6989 							throw Error("No LTS-rules found!");
6990 						
6991 						// add the rules to the object (static?)
6992 						for ( var i = 0; i < LetterToSound.RULES.length; i++) {
6993 							
6994 							this.parseAndAdd(LetterToSound.RULES[i]);
6995 						}
6996 					},
6997 					
6998 					_createState : function(type, tokenizer) {
6999 					 
7000 						if (type === LetterToSound.STATE)
7001 						{
7002 						  var index = parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());
7003 						  var c = tokenizer.nextToken();
7004 						  var qtrue = parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());
7005 						  var qfalse = parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());
7006 						  
7007 						  return new DecisionState(index, c.charAt(0), qtrue, qfalse);
7008 						}
7009 						else if (type === LetterToSound.PHONE)
7010 						{
7011 						  return new FinalState(tokenizer.nextToken());
7012 						}
7013 						
7014 						throw Error("Unexpected type: "+type);
7015 					},
7016 					
7017 					/**
7018 					 * Creates a word from the given input line and add it to the state machine.
7019 					 * It expects the TOTAL line to come before any of the states.
7020 					 * 
7021 					 * @param line the line of text from the input file
7022 					 */
7023 					 parseAndAdd : function(line) {
7024 						 
7025 					  var tokenizer = new StringTokenizer(line, SP);
7026 					  var type = tokenizer.nextToken();
7027 
7028 					  if (type == LetterToSound.STATE || type == LetterToSound.PHONE)
7029 					  {
7030 						if (LetterToSound.tokenizeOnLoad)
7031 						{
7032 						  this.stateMachine[this.numStates] = this._createState(type, tokenizer);
7033 						} 
7034 						else
7035 						{
7036 						  this.stateMachine[this.numStates] = line;
7037 						}
7038 						this.numStates++;
7039 					  } 
7040 					  else if (type==LetterToSound.INDEX)
7041 					  {
7042 						var index = parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());
7043 						if (index != this.numStates)
7044 						{
7045 						  throw Error("Bad INDEX in file.");
7046 						} 
7047 						else
7048 						{
7049 						  var c = tokenizer.nextToken();
7050 						  this.letterIndex[c] = index;
7051 						  
7052 						}
7053 						//console.log(type+" : "+c+" : "+index + " "+this.letterIndex[c]);
7054 					  } 
7055 					  else if (type==LetterToSound.TOTAL)
7056 					  {
7057 						this.stateMachine = [];
7058 						this.stateMachineSize = parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());
7059 					  }
7060 					},
7061 					
7062 					/**
7063 					 * Calculates the phone list for a given word. If a phone list cannot be
7064 					 * determined, <code>[]</code> is returned. 
7065 					 * 
7066 					 * @param {string | array } input the word or words to find
7067 					 * 
7068 					 * @return {string} phones for word, separated by delim,
7069 					 *   or <code>empty string</code>
7070 					 */
7071 					getPhones : function(input, delim) {
7072 						
7073 						var ph, result = []; 
7074 						
7075 						delim = delim || '-';
7076 						
7077 						if (is(input, S)) {
7078 							
7079 							if (!input.length) return E; 
7080 							
7081 							input = RiTa.tokenize(input);
7082 						}
7083 			  
7084 						for (var i = 0; i < input.length; i++) {
7085 							
7086 							ph = this._computePhones(input[i]);
7087 							result[i] = ph ? ph.join(delim) : E;
7088 						}
7089 						
7090 						return result.join(delim);  
7091 					},
7092 
7093 					/**
7094 					 * Calculates the phone list for a given word. If a phone list cannot be
7095 					 * determined, <code>null</code> is returned. 
7096 					 * 
7097 					 * @param word the word or words to find
7098 					 * 
7099 					 * @return array of phones for word or <code>null</code>
7100 					 */
7101 					_computePhones : function(word) {
7102 						
7103 					  var dig, phoneList = [], full_buff, tmp, currentState, startIndex, stateIndex, c;
7104 					  
7105 					  if (!word || !word.length || RiTa.isPunctuation(word))
7106 						  return null;
7107 					  
7108 					  word = word.toLowerCase();
7109 					  
7110 					  if (isNum(word)) {
7111 						  
7112 						  word = (word.length>1) ? word.split(E) : [word];
7113 						  
7114 						  for (var i = 0; i < word.length; i++) {
7115 							  
7116 							  dig = parseInt(word[i]);
7117 							  if (dig < 0 || dig > 9)
7118 								  throw Error("Attempt to pass multi-digit number to LTS: '"+word+"'");
7119 							  
7120 							  phoneList.push(Phones.digits[dig]);
7121 						  }
7122 						  
7123 						  return phoneList;
7124 					  }
7125 				
7126 					  // Create "000#word#000"
7127 					  tmp = "000#"+word.trim()+"#000", full_buff = tmp.split("");
7128 					  
7129 					  // For each character in the word, create a WINDOW_SIZE
7130 					  // context on each size of the character, and then ask the
7131 					  // state machine what's next. Its magic
7132 					  for (var pos = 0; pos < word.length; pos++) {
7133 						  
7134 						for (var i = 0; i < LetterToSound.WINDOW_SIZE; i++) {
7135 							
7136 						  this.fval_buff[i] = full_buff[pos + i];
7137 						  this.fval_buff[i + LetterToSound.WINDOW_SIZE] = full_buff[i + pos + 1 + LetterToSound.WINDOW_SIZE];
7138 						}
7139 						
7140 						c = word.charAt(pos);
7141 						startIndex = this.letterIndex[c];
7142 						
7143 						// must check for null here, not 0
7144 						if (startIndex==null) throw Error("No LTS index for character: '"+
7145 							c + "', isDigit=" + isNum(c) + ", isPunct=" + RiTa.isPunctuation(c));
7146 
7147 						stateIndex = parseInt(startIndex);
7148 						
7149 						currentState = this.getState(stateIndex);
7150 						
7151 						while (! (currentState instanceof FinalState) ) {
7152 							
7153 						  stateIndex = currentState.getNextState(this.fval_buff);
7154 						  currentState = this.getState(stateIndex);
7155 						}
7156 						
7157 						currentState.append(phoneList);
7158 					  }
7159 					  
7160 					  return phoneList;
7161 					},
7162 					
7163 					getState : function(i) {
7164 
7165 						if (is(i,N)) {
7166 							
7167 							var state = null;
7168 							
7169 							// WORKING HERE: this check should fail :: see java
7170 							if (is(this.stateMachine[i],S)) {
7171 								
7172 							  state = this.getState(this.stateMachine[i]);
7173 							  if (LetterToSound.tokenizeOnLookup)
7174 								  this.stateMachine[i] = state;
7175 							} 
7176 							else
7177 							  state = this.stateMachine[i];
7178 					 
7179 							return state;
7180 						}
7181 						else {
7182 							
7183 							var tokenizer = new StringTokenizer(i, " ");
7184 							return this.getState(tokenizer.nextToken(), tokenizer);
7185 						}
7186 					}   
7187 				}
7188 				
7189 				/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7190 				// DecisionState
7191 				/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7192 				
7193 				var DecisionState = makeClass();
7194 				
7195 				DecisionState.TYPE = 1;
7196 				
7197 				DecisionState.prototype = {
7198 				
7199 					/**
7200 					 * Class constructor.
7201 					 * 
7202 					 * @param index
7203 					 *          the index into a string for comparison to c
7204 					 * @param c
7205 					 *          the character to match in a string at index
7206 					 * @param qtrue
7207 					 *          the state to go to in the state machine on a match
7208 					 * @param qfalse
7209 					 *          the state to go to in the state machine on no match
7210 					 */
7211 					//    char c, var index, var qtrue, var qfalse;
7212 					init : function(index, c, qtrue, qfalse) {
7213 						
7214 						this.c = c;
7215 						this.index = index;
7216 						this.qtrue = qtrue;
7217 						this.qfalse = qfalse;
7218 					},
7219 					
7220 					type : function() {
7221 						
7222 						return "DecisionState";
7223 					},
7224 				
7225 					/**
7226 					 * Gets the next state to go to based upon the given character sequence.
7227 					 * 
7228 					 * @param chars the characters for comparison
7229 					 * 
7230 					 * @returns an index into the state machine.
7231 					 */
7232 					//public var getNextState(char[] chars)
7233 					getNextState : function(chars) {
7234 						
7235 					  return (chars[this.index] == this.c) ? this.qtrue : this.qfalse;
7236 					},
7237 				
7238 					/**
7239 					 * Outputs this <code>State</code> as though it came from the text input
7240 					 * file. 
7241 					 */
7242 					toString : function() {
7243 					  return this.STATE + " " + this.index + " " + this.c + " " + this.qtrue + " " + this.qfalse;
7244 					}, 
7245 				
7246 					/**
7247 					 * Writes this <code>State</code> to the given output stream.
7248 					 * 
7249 					 * @param dos
7250 					 *          the data output stream
7251 					 * 
7252 					 * @throws IOException
7253 					 *           if an error occurs
7254 				
7255 					writeBinary : function(dos)
7256 					{
7257 				//      dos.writeInt(TYPE);
7258 				//      dos.writeInt(index);
7259 				//      dos.writeChar(c);
7260 				//      dos.writeInt(qtrue);
7261 				//      dos.writeInt(qfalse);
7262 					}     */
7263 				
7264 					/**
7265 					 * Loads a <code>DecisionState</code> object from the given input stream.
7266 					 * 
7267 					 * @param dis
7268 					 *          the data input stream
7269 					 * @return a newly constructed decision state
7270 					 * 
7271 					 * @throws IOException
7272 					 *           if an error occurs
7273 					 
7274 					public static State loadBinary(DataInputStream dis) throws IOException
7275 					{
7276 					  var index = dis.readInt();
7277 					  char c = dis.readChar();
7278 					  var qtrue = dis.readInt();
7279 					  var qfalse = dis.readInt();
7280 					  return new DecisionState(index, c, qtrue, qfalse);
7281 					}*/
7282 				
7283 					/**
7284 					 * Compares this state to another state for debugging purposes.
7285 					 * 
7286 					 * @param other
7287 					 *          the other state to compare against
7288 					 * 
7289 					 * @return true if the states are equivalent
7290 					 */
7291 					compare : function(other) {
7292 						
7293 					  if (other instanceof DecisionState)
7294 					  {
7295 						var otherState = other;
7296 						return index == otherState.index && c == otherState.c
7297 							&& qtrue == otherState.qtrue && qfalse == otherState.qfalse;
7298 					  }
7299 					  return false;
7300 					}
7301 					
7302 				}// end DecisionState
7303 				
7304 				// ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7305 				// FinalState
7306 				// ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7307 				
7308 				var FinalState = makeClass();
7309 				
7310 				FinalState.TYPE = 2;
7311 				
7312 				FinalState.prototype = {
7313 					
7314 					/**
7315 					 * Class constructor. The string "epsilon" is used to indicate an empty list.
7316 					 * @param {} phones the phones for this state
7317 					 */
7318 					init : function(phones) {
7319 						
7320 						this.phoneList = [];
7321 						
7322 						if (phones===("epsilon"))
7323 						{
7324 							this.phoneList = null;
7325 						} 
7326 						else if (is(phones,A)) {
7327 							
7328 							this.phoneList = phones;
7329 						}
7330 						else
7331 						{
7332 						  var i = phones.indexOf('-');
7333 						  if (i != -1)
7334 						  {
7335 							  this.phoneList[0] = phones.substring(0, i); 
7336 							  this.phoneList[1] = phones.substring(i + 1);
7337 						  } 
7338 						  else
7339 						  {
7340 							  this.phoneList[0] = phones;
7341 						  }
7342 						}
7343 					},
7344 					
7345 					type : function() {
7346 						
7347 						return "FinalState";
7348 					},
7349 				
7350 					/**
7351 					 * Appends the phone list for this state to the given <code>ArrayList</code>.
7352 					 * @param {array} array the array to append to
7353 					 */
7354 					append : function(array) {
7355 						
7356 						if (!this.phoneList) return;
7357 				
7358 						for (var i = 0; i < this.phoneList.length; i++)
7359 							array.push(this.phoneList[i]);
7360 					},
7361 				
7362 					/**
7363 					 * Outputs this <code>State</code> as though it came from the text input
7364 					 * file. The string "epsilon" is used to indicate an empty list.
7365 					 * 
7366 					 * @return a <code>String</code> describing this <code>State</code>
7367 					 */
7368 					toString : function() {
7369 						
7370 					  if (!this.phoneList)
7371 					  {
7372 						return LetterToSound.PHONE + " epsilon";
7373 					  } 
7374 					  else if (this.phoneList.length == 1)
7375 					  {
7376 						return LetterToSound.PHONE + " " + this.phoneList[0];
7377 					  } 
7378 					  else
7379 					  {
7380 						return LetterToSound.PHONE + " " + this.phoneList[0] + "-" + this.phoneList[1];
7381 					  }
7382 					},
7383 				
7384 					/**
7385 					 * Compares this state to another state for debugging purposes.
7386 					 * 
7387 					 * @param other
7388 					 *          the other state to compare against
7389 					 * 
7390 					 * @return <code>true</code> if the states are equivalent
7391 					 */
7392 					compare : function(other)
7393 					{
7394 					  if (other instanceof FinalState)
7395 					  {
7396 						var otherState = other;
7397 						if (!phoneList)
7398 						{
7399 						  return (otherState.phoneList == null);
7400 						} 
7401 						else
7402 						{
7403 						  for (var i = 0; i < phoneList.length; i++)
7404 						  {
7405 							if (!phoneList[i].equals(otherState.phoneList[i]))
7406 							{
7407 							  return false;
7408 							}
7409 						  }
7410 						  return true;
7411 						}
7412 					  }
7413 					  return false;
7414 					}
7415 				}
7416 				
7417 				/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7418 				//StringTokenizer
7419 				/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7420 				
7421 				var StringTokenizer = makeClass();  
7422 				
7423 				StringTokenizer.prototype = {
7424 				
7425 					init : function(str, delim) {
7426 						
7427 						this.idx = 0;
7428 						this.text = str;
7429 						this.delim = delim || " ";
7430 						this.tokens = str.split(delim);
7431 					},
7432 					
7433 					nextToken : function() {
7434 						
7435 						return (this.idx < this.tokens.length) ? this.tokens[this.idx++] : null;
7436 					}
7437 				}
7438 				
7439 				////////////////////////// PRIVATE CLASSES ///////////////////////////////
7440 
7441 				
7442 				// ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7443 				// RiText_Canvas 2D-Renderer
7444 				// ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7445 				
7446 				/**
7447 				 * @name RiText_Canvas
7448 				 * @class
7449 				 * @private
7450 				 */
7451 				var RiText_Canvas = makeClass();
7452 				
7453 				RiText_Canvas.prototype = {
7454 
7455 					init : function(ctx) {
7456 						this.ctx = ctx;
7457 					},
7458 					
7459 					_getGraphics : function() {
7460 						return this.ctx;
7461 					},
7462 					
7463 					_pushState : function() {
7464 						this.ctx.save();
7465 						return this;
7466 					},
7467 					
7468 					_popState : function() {
7469 						this.ctx.restore();
7470 						return this;
7471 					},
7472 					
7473 					_background : function(r,g,b,a) {
7474 						this._fill(r,g,b,a);
7475 						this.ctx.fillRect(0,0,this.ctx.canvas.width,this.ctx.canvas.height);
7476 					},
7477 
7478 					_scale : function(sx, sy) {
7479 						this.ctx.scale(sx, sy, 1);
7480 					},
7481 					
7482 					_translate : function(tx, ty) {
7483 						this.ctx.translate(tx, ty, 0);
7484 					},
7485 					
7486 					_rotate : function(zRot) {
7487 						this.ctx.rotate(0,0,zRot);
7488 					},
7489 					
7490 					_line : function(x1,y1,x2,y2,lw) {
7491 						
7492 				  
7493 						lw = lw || 1; // canvas hack for crisp lines
7494 						x1 = Math.round(x1), x2 = Math.round(x2);
7495 						y1 = Math.round(y1), y2 = Math.round(y2);
7496 						
7497 						//log('line: ('+(x1)+","+(y1)+","+(x2)+","+(y2)+")");
7498 						
7499 						this.ctx.save();
7500 						
7501 						if (x1 === x2) {
7502 							if (y1 > y2) {
7503 								var swap = y1;
7504 								y1 = y2;
7505 								y2 = swap;
7506 							}
7507 							y2++;
7508 							if (lw % 2 === 1)
7509 								this.ctx.translate(0.5, 0);
7510 						} 
7511 						else if (y1 === y2) {
7512 							if (x1 > x2) {
7513 								var swap = x1;
7514 								x1 = x2;
7515 								x2 = swap;
7516 							}
7517 							x2++;
7518 							if (lw % 2 === 1) 
7519 								this.ctx.translate(0, 0.5);
7520 						}
7521 						
7522 						
7523 						this.ctx.beginPath();
7524 						this.ctx.moveTo(x1 || 0, y1 || 0);
7525 						this.ctx.lineTo(x2 || 0, y2 || 0);
7526 						this.ctx.lineWidth = lw;
7527 						this.ctx.stroke();
7528 						
7529 						this.ctx.restore();
7530 					},
7531 					
7532 					_rect : function(x,y,w,h) {
7533 			  
7534 						this._line(x,y,x+w,y);
7535 						this._line(x,y+h,x+w,y+h);
7536 						this._line(x,y,x,y+h);
7537 						this._line(x+w,y,x+w,y+h)
7538 
7539 						// TODO: add test with filled bounding boxes and check
7540 						this.ctx.fillRect(x+1,y+1,w-1,h-1); // [hack] 
7541 					},
7542 					
7543 					_size : function(w, h, renderer) {
7544 						
7545 						
7546 						this.ctx.canvas.width = w;
7547 						this.ctx.canvas.height = h;
7548 						if (renderer) console.warn("Renderer arg ignored");
7549 					},
7550 					
7551 					_createFont : function(fontName, fontSize, leading) {
7552 						
7553 						var font = {
7554 							name:       fontName, 
7555 							size:       fontSize || RiText.defaults.font.size, 
7556 							leading:    leading || (fontSize * RiText.defaults.leadingFactor) 
7557 						};
7558 						return font;
7559 					},
7560 					
7561 					_width : function() {
7562 						
7563 						return this.ctx.canvas.width || 200;
7564 					},
7565 					
7566 					_height : function() {
7567 						
7568 						return this.ctx.canvas.height || 200;
7569 					},
7570 					
7571 					_fill : function(r,g,b,a) {
7572 						
7573 						this.ctx.fillStyle="rgba("+Math.round(r)+","+Math.round(g)+","+Math.round(b)+","+(a/255)+")";
7574 					},
7575 					
7576 					_stroke : function(r,g,b,a) {
7577 						
7578 						this.ctx.strokeStyle = is(r,S) ? r : "rgba("+Math.round(r)
7579 							+","+Math.round(g)+","+Math.round(b)+","+(a/255)+")";
7580 					},
7581 					
7582 					_textAlign : function(align) {
7583 						
7584 						switch (align) {
7585 							case RiTa.LEFT:
7586 								this.ctx.textAlign = 'left';
7587 								break;
7588 							case RiTa.CENTER:
7589 								this.ctx.textAlign = 'center';
7590 								break;
7591 							case RiTa.RIGHT:
7592 								this.ctx.textAlign = 'right';
7593 								break;
7594 						}
7595 					},
7596 					
7597 					_type : function() { return "Canvas"; },
7598 					
7599 					// only applies the font to the context!
7600 					_textFont : function(fontObj) {
7601 						if (!is(fontObj,O))
7602 							err("_textFont expects object, but got: "+fontObj);
7603 						this.ctx.font = "normal "+fontObj.size+"px "+fontObj.name;
7604 					},
7605 					
7606 					_textAscent : function(rt) {
7607 						return this._getMetrics(rt).ascent;
7608 					},
7609 					
7610 					_textDescent : function(rt) {
7611 						return this._getMetrics(rt).descent;
7612 
7613 					},
7614 
7615 					// should operate on the RiText itself (take rt as arg?)
7616 					_text : function(str, x, y) {
7617 						//log("text: "+str+","+x+","+y+","+this.ctx.textAlign);
7618 						this.ctx.baseline = 'alphabetic';
7619 						this.ctx.fillText(str, x, y);
7620 						//this.ctx.strokeText(str, x, y);
7621 					},
7622 
7623 					_textWidth : function(fontObj, str) {
7624 						this.ctx.save();
7625 						this._textFont(fontObj);
7626 						var tw = this.ctx.measureText(str).width;
7627 						this.ctx.restore();
7628 						return tw;
7629 					},
7630 
7631 					_textHeight : function(rt) {
7632 						return this._getBoundingBox(rt).height;
7633 					},
7634 					
7635 					//  hack to deal with lack of metrics in the canvas
7636 					_getBoundingBox : function(rt) {
7637 
7638 						this.ctx.save();
7639 						this._textFont(rt._font);
7640 						var w = this.ctx.measureText(rt.text()).width;
7641 						// this must be cached...
7642 						var metrics = this._getMetrics(rt);
7643 						//log('[CTX] ascent='+metrics.ascent+' descent='+metrics.descent+" h="+(metrics.ascent+metrics.descent));
7644 						this.ctx.restore();
7645 						return { x: 0, y: -metrics.ascent-1, width: w, height: metrics.ascent+metrics.descent+1 };
7646 					},
7647 
7648 					_getOffset : function(elem) { // private, not in API 
7649 						var box = elem.getBoundingClientRect();
7650 						return { top: box.top, left: box.left };
7651 					},
7652 					
7653 					_getDivChild : function(html) { // private, not in API 
7654 						
7655 						var frag = document.createDocumentFragment(); 
7656 						var div = document.createElement("div");
7657 						frag.appendChild( div );
7658 						div.innerHTML = html;
7659 						div.parentNode.removeChild( div );            
7660 						return div.firstChild; 
7661 					},
7662 					
7663 					_getMetrics : function(rt) {  // hack for font metrics in the canvas
7664 						
7665 						// TODO: if (rt._metrics) return rt._metrics; // check cache
7666 
7667 						var st = '<span style="font-size: '+rt._font.size+'; font-family: '+rt._font.name+'">'+rt.text()+'</span>';
7668 						var dt = '<div style="display: inline-block; width: 1px; height: 0px; vertical-align: bottom; "></div>';
7669 						var text = this._getDivChild(st);
7670 						var block = this._getDivChild(dt);
7671 
7672 						// make the 'div' fragment   ====================
7673 						var fragment = document.createDocumentFragment(); 
7674 						var div = document.createElement("div");
7675 						fragment.appendChild( div );
7676 						
7677 						// append 'text' and 'block' to the div
7678 						div.appendChild(text); 
7679 						div.appendChild(block);
7680 			  
7681 						// insert the fake 'div' in the body
7682 						document.body.appendChild(div);
7683 
7684 						try {
7685 							var result = {};
7686 
7687 							block.style.verticalAlign = 'baseline';
7688 							result.ascent = this._getOffset(block).top - this._getOffset(text).top + 1;
7689 							
7690 							block.style.verticalAlign = 'bottom';
7691 							var height = this._getOffset(block).top - this._getOffset(text).top;
7692 
7693 							result.descent = (height - result.ascent);
7694 							result.ascent -=  result.descent;
7695 
7696 						} 
7697 						finally {
7698 							document.body.removeChild(div);
7699 						}
7700 
7701 						// TODO: rt._metrics = results; // add to cache
7702
