7703 						return result;
7704 					},
7705 
7706 					/** @private */
7707 					toString : function() {
7708 						
7709 						return "RiText_"+this._type;
7710 					}
7711 					
7712 				}        
7713 				
7714 				// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7715 				// Timer
7716 				// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7717 				
7718 				var timers = new Object(); // static
7719 
7720 				/**
7721 				 * @name Timer - modified from Resig's JQuery-Timer
7722 				 * @class
7723 				 * @private
7724 				 */
7725 				var Timer = function(func, time, autostart) {
7726 						
7727 					this.set = function(func, time, autostart) {
7728 						
7729 						this.init = true;
7730 						if (typeof func == 'function') this.action = func;
7731 						if (!isNaN(time)) this.intervalTime = time;
7732 						if (autostart && !this.isActive) {
7733 							this.isActive = true;
7734 							this.setTimer();
7735 						}
7736 						return this;
7737 					};
7738 					
7739 					this.once = function(time) {
7740 						
7741 						var timer = this;
7742 						if (isNaN(time)) time = 0;
7743 						window.setTimeout(function() {timer.action();}, time);
7744 						return this;
7745 					};
7746 					
7747 					this.play = function(reset) {
7748 						
7749 						if (!this.isActive) {
7750 							if (reset) this.setTimer();
7751 							else this.setTimer(this.remaining);
7752 							this.isActive = true;
7753 						}
7754 						return this;
7755 					};
7756 					
7757 					this.pause = function() {
7758 						
7759 						if (this.isActive) {
7760 							this.isActive = false;
7761 							this.remaining -= new Date() - this.last;
7762 							this.clearTimer();
7763 						}
7764 						return this;
7765 					};
7766 					
7767 					this.stop = function() {
7768 						
7769 						this.isActive = false;
7770 						this.remaining = this.intervalTime;
7771 						this.clearTimer();
7772 						return this;
7773 					};
7774 					
7775 					this.toggle = function(reset) {
7776 						
7777 						if (this.isActive) this.pause();
7778 						else if (reset) this.play(true);
7779 						else this.play();
7780 						return this;
7781 					};
7782 					
7783 					this.reset = function() {
7784 						
7785 						this.isActive = false;
7786 						this.play(true);
7787 						return this;
7788 					};
7789 					
7790 					this.id = function() {
7791 						return this.timeoutObject;
7792 					};
7793 						
7794 					this.clearTimer = function() { // private
7795 						window.clearTimeout(this.timeoutObject);
7796 					};
7797 					
7798 					this.setTimer = function(time) {
7799 						
7800 						var timer = this;
7801 						if (typeof this.action != 'function') return;
7802 						if (isNaN(time)) time = this.intervalTime;
7803 						this.remaining = time;
7804 						this.last = new Date();
7805 						this.clearTimer();
7806 						this.timeoutObject = window.setTimeout
7807 							(function() { timer.go(); }, time);
7808 					};
7809 					
7810 					this.go = function() {
7811 						if (this.isActive) {
7812 							this.action();
7813 							this.setTimer();
7814 						}
7815 					};
7816 					
7817 					if (this.init) {
7818 						return new Timer(func, time, autostart);
7819 					} else {
7820 						this.set(func, time, autostart);
7821 						return this;
7822 					}
7823 				};
7824 					
7825 				// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7826 				// TextNode
7827 				// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7828 				
7829 				/**
7830 				 * @name TextNode
7831 				 * @class
7832 				 * @private
7833 				 */
7834 				var TextNode = makeClass();
7835 				
7836 				//TextNode.ignoreCase = true;
7837 				
7838 				TextNode.prototype = {
7839 
7840 					init : function(parent, token) {
7841 						
7842 						this.count = 0;
7843 						this.children = {};
7844 						this.parent = parent;
7845 						this.token = token;
7846 					},
7847 					
7848 					selectChild : function(regex, probabalisticSelect) {
7849 						
7850 						var ps = probabalisticSelect || true;
7851 						return this.children ? this._select(this.childNodes(regex), ps) : null;
7852 					},
7853 					
7854 					_select : function (arr, probabalisticSelect) {
7855 						
7856 						if (!arr) throw TypeError("bad arg to '_select()'");
7857 						
7858 						probabalisticSelect = probabalisticSelect || false;
7859 						
7860 						return (probabalisticSelect ? this._probabalisticSelect(arr) 
7861 							: arr[Math.floor((Math.random()*arr.length))]);    
7862 					},
7863 					
7864 					_probabalisticSelect : function(arr)  {    
7865 						
7866 						if (!arr) throw TypeError("bad arg to '_probabalisticSelect()'");
7867 						
7868 						//L("RiTa.probabalisticSelect("+c+", size="+c.size()+")");
7869 						if (!arr.length) return null;
7870 						if (arr.length == 1) return arr[0];
7871 
7872 						// select from multiple options based on frequency
7873 						var pTotal = 0, selector = Math.random();
7874 						for ( var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
7875 							
7876 							pTotal += arr[i].probability();
7877 							if (selector < pTotal)
7878 								return arr[i];
7879 						}
7880 						err("Invalid State in RiTa.probabalisticSelect()");   
7881 					},
7882 
7883 					addChild : function(newToken, initialCount) {
7884 
7885 					  initialCount = initialCount || 1;
7886 
7887 					  var key = this._key(newToken), node = this.children[key];
7888 
7889 					  //  add first instance of this token 
7890 					  if (!node) {
7891 						node = new TextNode(this, newToken);
7892 						node.count = initialCount;
7893 						this.children[key] = node;   
7894 					  }
7895 					  else {         
7896 						node.count++;
7897 					  }
7898 					  
7899 					  return node;
7900 					},
7901 					
7902 					asTree : function(sort) {
7903 						
7904 					  var s = this.token+" ";
7905 					  if (!this.isRoot()) 
7906 						s+= "("+this.count+")->"; 
7907 					  s += "{";
7908 					  if (!this.isLeaf())
7909 						return this.childrenToString(this, s, 1, sort);
7910 					  return s + "}";
7911 					},
7912 					
7913 					isRoot : function() {
7914 						
7915 						return undef(this.parent);
7916 					},
7917 					
7918 					isLeaf : function() {
7919 						
7920 						return this.childCount() == 0;
7921 					},
7922 					
7923 					probability : function() {
7924 						
7925 						//log('probability: '+ this.count+'/'+this.siblingCount());
7926 						return this.count/this.siblingCount();
7927 					},
7928 					
7929 
7930 					childNodes : function(regex) {
7931 						
7932 						if (!this.children) return EA;
7933 						
7934 						regex = is(regex,S) ? new RegExp(regex) : regex;
7935 						
7936 						var res = [];
7937 						for (var k in this.children)  {
7938 							var node = this.children[k];
7939 							if (!regex || (node && node.token && node.token.search(regex)>-1)) {
7940 								res.push(node);
7941 							}
7942 						}
7943 						
7944 						return res;
7945 					},        
7946 					
7947 					/**
7948 					 * Returns the number of siblings for this node (Note: is case-sensitive)
7949 					 */
7950 					siblingCount : function() {
7951 						
7952 					  if (this.isRoot()) err("Illegal siblingCount on ROOT!");
7953 					  
7954 					  if (!this.parent) err("Null parent for: "+this.token);
7955 					  
7956 					  return this.parent.childCount();
7957 					},
7958 					
7959 					/**
7960 					 * Returns the number of unique children (Note: is case-sensitive)
7961 					 */
7962 					uniqueCount : function() {
7963 					
7964 						var sum = 0;
7965 						for (var k in this.children) sum++;
7966 						return sum;
7967 					},
7968 					
7969 					 /**
7970 					 * Returns the number of children for this node (Note: is case-sensitive)
7971 					 */
7972 					childCount : function() {
7973 						
7974 						//return this.childNodes().length;
7975 						
7976 						if (!this.children) return 0;
7977 						
7978 						var sum = 0;
7979 						for (var k in this.children) {
7980 							if (k && this.children[k])
7981 								sum += this.children[k].count;
7982 						}
7983 						
7984 						return sum;
7985 					},        
7986 					
7987 					
7988 					/*
7989 					 * takes node or string, returns node
7990 					 */
7991 					lookup : function(obj) {   
7992 						
7993 					  if (!obj) return null;
7994 					  
7995 					  obj = (typeof obj != S && obj.token) ? obj.token : obj;
7996 					  
7997 					  //log(this.token+".lookup("+this._key(obj)+")");
7998 					  
7999 					  return obj ? this.children[this._key(obj)] : null; 
8000 					},
8001 					
8002 				
8003 					_key : function(str) {
8004 
8005 						return str;//(str && TextNode.ignoreCase) ? str.toLowerCase() : str;
8006 					},
8007 
8008 					childrenToString : function(textNode, str, depth, sort)  {
8009 
8010 					  var mn = textNode, l = [], node = null, indent = "\n";
8011 					  
8012 					  sort = sort || false;
8013 					  
8014 					  for (var k in textNode.children) {
8015 						  l.push(textNode.children[k]);
8016 					  }
8017 					  
8018 					  if (!l.length) return str;
8019 					  
8020 					  if (sort) l.sort();
8021 								
8022 					  for (var j = 0; j < depth; j++) 
8023 						indent += "  ";
8024 					  
8025 					  for (var i = 0; i < l.length; i++) {
8026 						  
8027 						node = l[i];
8028 						
8029 						if (!node) break;
8030 						
8031 						var tok = node.token;      
8032 						if (tok) {         
8033 						  (tok == "\n") && (tok = "\\n");
8034 						  (tok == "\r") && (tok = "\\r");
8035 						  (tok == "\t") && (tok = "\\t");
8036 						  (tok == "\r\n") && (tok = "\\r\\n");
8037 						}
8038 						
8039 						str += indent +"'"+tok+"'";
8040 						
8041 						if (!node.count) 
8042 						  err("ILLEGAL FREQ: "+node.count+" -> "+mn.token+","+node.token);
8043 						
8044 						if (!node.isRoot())
8045 						  str += " ["+node.count + ",p=" +//formatter.format
8046 							(node.probability().toFixed(3)) + "]->{"; 
8047 						
8048 						if (node.children)
8049 						  str = this.childrenToString(node, str, depth+1, sort);  
8050 						else 
8051 							str += "}";
8052 					  }
8053 					  
8054 					  indent = "\n";
8055 					  for (var j = 0; j < depth-1; j++) 
8056 						indent += "  ";
8057 					  
8058 					  return str + indent + "}";
8059 					},
8060 					
8061 					toString : function() {
8062 						return '[ '+this.token+" ("+this.count+'/'+this.probability().toFixed(3)+'%)]';
8063 					} 
8064 				}
8065 
8066 				// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8067 				// Conjugator
8068 				// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8069 				
8070 
8071 				/**
8072 				 * @name Conjugator
8073 				 * @class
8074 				 * @private
8075 				 */
8076 				var Conjugator = makeClass();
8077 				
8078 				Conjugator.prototype = {
8079 
8080 					init : function() {
8081 						
8082 						// TODO: get rid of these and make static method ?
8083 						
8084 						this.perfect = this.progressive = this.passive = this.interrogative = false;
8085 						this.tense = RiTa.PRESENT_TENSE;
8086 						this.person = RiTa.FIRST_PERSON;
8087 						this.number = RiTa.SINGULAR;
8088 						this.form = RiTa.NORMAL;
8089 						this.head = "";
8090 
8091 					},
8092 
8093 					// Conjugates the verb based on the current state of the conjugator.
8094 					// !@# Removed (did not translate) incomplete/non-working java
8095 					// implementation of modals handling.
8096 					// !@# TODO: add handling of past tense modals.
8097 					conjugate : function(verb, args) {
8098 
8099 						var s = E, actualModal = null, conjs = [], frontVG = verb, verbForm;
8100 						
8101 						if (!verb || !verb.length) return E;
8102 						
8103 						if (!args) return verb;
8104 
8105 						// ------------------ handle arguments ------------------
8106 						
8107 						args.number && (this.number = args.number);
8108 						args.person && (this.person = args.person);
8109 						args.tense && (this.tense = args.tense);
8110 						args.form && (this.form = args.form);
8111 						args.passive && (this.passive = args.passive);
8112 						args.progressive && (this.progressive = args.progressive);
8113 						args.interrogative && (this.interrogative = args.interrogative);
8114 						args.perfect && (this.perfect = args.perfect);
8115 						
8116 						// ----------------------- start ---------------------------
8117 						if (this.form == RiTa.INFINITIVE) {
8118 							actualModal = "to";
8119 						}
8120 
8121 						if (this.tense == RiTa.FUTURE_TENSE) {
8122 							actualModal = "will";
8123 						}
8124 
8125 						if (this.passive) {
8126 							conjs.push(this.getPastParticiple(frontVG));
8127 							frontVG = "be"; 
8128 						}
8129 
8130 						if (this.progressive) {
8131 							conjs.push(this.getPresentParticiple(frontVG));
8132 							frontVG = "be"; 
8133 						}
8134 
8135 						if (this.perfect) {
8136 							conjs.push(this.getPastParticiple(frontVG));
8137 							frontVG = "have";
8138 						}
8139 
8140 						if (actualModal) {
8141 							// log("push: "+frontVG);
8142 							conjs.push(frontVG);
8143 							frontVG = null;
8144 						}
8145 
8146 						// Now inflect frontVG (if it exists) and push it on restVG
8147 						if (frontVG) {
8148 
8149 							if (this.form === RiTa.GERUND) { // gerund - use ING form
8150 								
8151 								var pp = this.getPresentParticiple(frontVG);
8152 
8153 								// !@# not yet implemented! ??? WHAT?
8154 								conjs.push(pp);
8155 								
8156 							}
8157 							else if (this.interrogative && !(verb == "be") && conjs.length < 1) {
8158 
8159 								conjs.push(frontVG);
8160 								
8161 							}
8162 							else {
8163 
8164 								verbForm = this.getVerbForm(frontVG, this.tense, this.person, this.number);
8165 								conjs.push(verbForm);
8166 							}
8167 						}
8168 
8169 						// add modal, and we're done
8170 						actualModal && conjs.push(actualModal);
8171 
8172 						var s = E;
8173 						for ( var i = 0; i < conjs.length; i++) {
8174 							
8175 							s = conjs[i] + " " + s;
8176 						}
8177 
8178 						// !@# test this
8179 						endsWith(s, "peted") && err("Unexpected output: " + this.toString());
8180 
8181 						return trim(s);
8182 					},
8183 
8184 					checkRules : function(ruleSet, verb) {
8185 
8186 						var res, name = ruleSet.name, rules = ruleSet.rules, defRule = ruleSet.defaultRule || null;
8187 
8188 						//TODO: remove comments            
8189 			//log(ruleSet.name+' -> '+ruleSet.doubling);
8190 			
8191 			if (!rules) err("no rule: "+ruleSet.name+' of '+verb);
8192 			
8193 			if (inArray(MODALS, verb)) return verb;
8194 
8195 			for ( var i = 0; i < rules.length; i++) {
8196 
8197 				//log("checkRules2("+name+").fire("+i+")="+rules[i].regex);
8198 				if (rules[i].applies(verb)) {
8199 
8200 					var got = rules[i].fire(verb);
8201 
8202 				//log("HIT("+name+").fire("+i+")="+rules[i].regex+"_returns: "+got);
8203 					return got;
8204 				}
8205 			}
8206 			//log("NO HIT!");
8207 
8208 			if (ruleSet.doubling && inArray(VERB_CONS_DOUBLING, verb)) {
8209 
8210 			//log("doDoubling!");
8211 				verb = this.doubleFinalConsonant(verb);
8212 			}
8213 
8214 			res = defRule.fire(verb);
8215 
8216 			//log("checkRules("+name+").returns: "+res);
8217 			
8218 			return res;
8219 		},
8220 
8221 		doubleFinalConsonant : function(word) {
8222 			var letter = word.charAt(word.length - 1);
8223 			return word + letter;
8224 		},
8225 
8226 		getPast : function(verb, pers, numb) {
8227 
8228 			if (verb.toLowerCase() == "be") {
8229 
8230 				switch (numb) {
8231 
8232 				case RiTa.SINGULAR:
8233 
8234 					switch (pers) {
8235 
8236 					case RiTa.FIRST_PERSON:
8237 						break;
8238 
8239 					case RiTa.THIRD_PERSON:
8240 						return "was";
8241 
8242 					case RiTa.SECOND_PERSON:
8243 						return "were";
8244 
8245 					}
8246 					break;
8247 
8248 				case RiTa.PLURAL:
8249 
8250 					return "were";
8251 				}
8252 			}
8253 
8254 			var got = this.checkRules(PAST_TENSE_RULESET, verb);
8255 
8256 			//log("getPast(" + verb + ").returns: " + got);
8257 
8258 			return got;
8259 		},
8260 
8261 		getPresent : function(verb, person, number) {
8262 
8263 			person = person || this.person;
8264 			number = number || this.number;
8265 
8266 			if ((person == RiTa.THIRD_PERSON) && (number == RiTa.SINGULAR)) {
8267 
8268 				return this.checkRules(PRESENT_TENSE_RULESET, verb);
8269 			} 
8270 			else if (verb == "be") {
8271 
8272 				if (number == RiTa.SINGULAR) {
8273 
8274 					switch (person) {
8275 
8276 					case RiTa.FIRST_PERSON:
8277 						return "am";
8278 
8279 					case RiTa.SECOND_PERSON:
8280 						return "are";
8281 
8282 					case RiTa.THIRD_PERSON:
8283 						return "is";
8284 
8285 						// default: ???
8286 					}
8287 
8288 				} else {
8289 					return "are";
8290 				}
8291 			}
8292 			return verb;
8293 		},
8294 
8295 		getPresentParticiple : function(verb) {
8296 			
8297 			return strOk(verb) ? this.checkRules(PRESENT_PARTICIPLE_RULESET, verb) : E;
8298 		},
8299 
8300 		getPastParticiple : function(verb) {
8301 			
8302 			var res = strOk(verb) ? this.checkRules(PAST_PARTICIPLE_RULESET, verb) : E;
8303 	//            log("getPastParticiple("+verb+") -> "+res);
8304 			return res;
8305 		},
8306 
8307 		getVerbForm : function(verb, tense, person, number) {
8308 
8309 			switch (tense) {
8310 
8311 			case RiTa.PRESENT_TENSE:
8312 				return this.getPresent(verb, person, number);
8313 
8314 			case RiTa.PAST_TENSE:
8315 				return this.getPast(verb, person, number);
8316 
8317 			default:
8318 				return verb;
8319 			}
8320 		},
8321 
8322 		// Returns a String representing the current person from one of
8323 		// (first, second, third)
8324 		getPerson : function() {
8325 			return CONJUGATION_NAMES[this.person];
8326 		},
8327 
8328 		// Returns a String representing the current number from one of
8329 		// (singular, plural)
8330 		getNumber : function() {
8331 			return CONJUGATION_NAMES[this.number];
8332 		},
8333 
8334 		// Returns a String representing the current tense from one of
8335 		// (past, present, future)
8336 		getTense : function() {
8337 			return CONJUGATION_NAMES[this.tense];
8338 		},
8339 
8340 		// Returns the current verb
8341 		getVerb : function() {
8342 			return this.head;
8343 		},
8344 
8345 		// Returns whether the conjugation will use passive tense
8346 		isPassive : function() {
8347 			return this.passive;
8348 		},
8349 		// Returns whether the conjugation will use perfect tense
8350 		isPerfect : function() {
8351 			return this.perfect;
8352 		},
8353 		// Returns whether the conjugation will use progressive tense
8354 		isProgressive : function() {
8355 			return this.progressive;
8356 		},
8357 
8358 		// Sets the person for the conjugation, from one of the
8359 		// constants: [RiTa.FIRST_PERSON, RiTa.SECOND_PERSON, RiTa.THIRD_PERSON]
8360 		setPerson : function(personConstant) {
8361 			this.person = personConstant;
8362 		},
8363 
8364 		// Sets the number for the conjugation, from one of the
8365 		// constants: [RiTa.SINGULAR, RiTa.PLURAL]
8366 		setNumber : function(numberConstant) {
8367 			this.number = numberConstant;
8368 		},
8369 
8370 		// Sets the tense for the conjugation, from one of the
8371 		// constants: [RiTa.PAST_TENSE, RiTa.PRESENT_TENSE, RiTa.FUTURE_TENSE]
8372 		setTense : function(tenseConstant) {
8373 			this.tense = tenseConstant;
8374 		},
8375 
8376 		// Sets the verb to be conjugated
8377 		setVerb : function(verb) {
8378 			var v = this.head = verb.toLowerCase();
8379 			if (v === "am" || v === "are" || v === "is" || v === "was" || v === "were") {
8380 				this.head = "be";
8381 			}
8382 		},
8383 
8384 		// Sets whether the conjugation should use passive tense
8385 		setPassive : function(bool) {
8386 			this.passive = bool;
8387 		},
8388 
8389 		// Sets whether the conjugation should use perfect tense
8390 		setPerfect : function(bool) {
8391 			this.perfect = bool;
8392 		},
8393 
8394 		// Sets whether the conjugation should use progressive tense
8395 		setProgressive : function(bool) {
8396 			this.progressive = bool;
8397 		},
8398 
8399 		// A human-readable representation of state for logging
8400 		toString : function() {
8401 			return "  ---------------------\n" + "  Passive = " + this.isPassive() + "\n"
8402 					+ "  Perfect = " + this.isPerfect() + "\n" + "  Progressive = "
8403 					+ this.isProgressive() + "\n" + "  ---------------------\n" + "  Number = "
8404 					+ this.getNumber() + "\n" + "  Person = " + this.getPerson() + "\n"
8405 					+ "  Tense = " + this.getTense() + "\n" + "  ---------------------\n";
8406 		},
8407 
8408 		// Returns all possible conjugations of the specified verb
8409 		// (contains duplicates) (TODO: remove? not sure about this one)
8410 		conjugateAll : function(verb) {
8411 
8412 			var results = [], i, j, k, l, m, n;
8413 
8414 			this.setVerb(verb);
8415 
8416 			for (i = 0; i < TENSES.length; i++) {
8417 				this.setTense(TENSES[i]);
8418 				for (j = 0; j < NUMBERS.length; j++) {
8419 					this.setNumber(NUMBERS[j]);
8420 					for (k = 0; k < PERSONS.length; k++) {
8421 						this.setPerson(PERSONS[k]);
8422 						for (l = 0; l < 2; l++) {
8423 							this.setPassive(l == 0 ? true : false);
8424 							for (m = 0; m < 2; m++) {
8425 								this.setProgressive(m == 0 ? true : false);
8426 								for (n = 0; n < 2; n++) {
8427 									this.setPerfect(n == 0 ? true : false);
8428 									results.push(this.conjugate(verb));
8429 								}
8430 							}
8431 						}
8432 					}
8433 				}
8434 			}
8435 			// log("all="+results.length);
8436 			return results;
8437 		}
8438 	}
8439 
8440 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8441 	// PosTagger  (singleton)
8442 	// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8443 	var PosTagger = {
8444 
8445 		// Penn Pos types ------------------------------ (40+UKNOWN)
8446 
8447 		UNKNOWN : [ '???', 'UNKNOWN' ],
8448 		N : [ 'N', 'NOUN_KEY' ],
8449 		V : [ 'V', 'VERB_KEY' ],
8450 		R : [ 'R', 'ADVERB_KEY' ],
8451 		A : [ 'A', 'ADJECTIVE_KEY' ],
8452 		CC : [ 'CC', 'Coordinating conjunction' ],
8453 		CD : [ 'CD', 'Cardinal number' ],
8454 		DT : [ 'DT', 'Determiner' ],
8455 		EX : [ 'EX', 'Existential there' ],
8456 		FW : [ 'FW', 'Foreign word' ],
8457 		IN : [ 'IN', 'Preposition or subordinating conjunction' ],
8458 		JJ : [ 'JJ', 'Adjective' ],
8459 		JJR : [ 'JJR', 'Adjective, comparative' ],
8460 		JJS : [ 'JJS', 'Adjective, superlative' ],
8461 		LS : [ 'LS', 'List item marker' ],
8462 		MD : [ 'MD', 'Modal' ],
8463 		NN : [ 'NN', 'Noun, singular or mass' ],
8464 		NNS : [ 'NNS', 'Noun, plural' ],
8465 		NNP : [ 'NNP', 'Proper noun, singular' ],
8466 		NNPS : [ 'NNPS', 'Proper noun, plural' ],
8467 		PDT : [ 'PDT', 'Predeterminer' ],
8468 		POS : [ 'POS', 'Possessive ending' ],
8469 		PRP : [ 'PRP', 'Personal pronoun' ],
8470 		PRP$ : [ 'PRP$', 'Possessive pronoun (prolog version PRP-S)' ],
8471 		RB : [ 'RB', 'Adverb' ],
8472 		RBR : [ 'RBR', 'Adverb, comparative' ],
8473 		RBS : [ 'RBS', 'Adverb, superlative' ],
8474 		RP : [ 'RP', 'Particle' ],
8475 		SYM : [ 'SYM', 'Symbol' ],
8476 		TO : [ 'TO', 'to' ],
8477 		UH : [ 'UH', 'Interjection' ],
8478 		VB : [ 'VB', 'Verb, base form' ],
8479 		VBD : [ 'VBD', 'Verb, past tense' ],
8480 		VBG : [ 'VBG', 'Verb, gerund or present participle' ],
8481 		VBN : [ 'VBN', 'Verb, past participle' ],
8482 		VBP : [ 'VBP', 'Verb, non-3rd person singular present' ],
8483 		VBZ : [ 'VBZ', 'Verb, 3rd person singular present' ],
8484 		WDT : [ 'WDT', 'Wh-determiner' ],
8485 		WP : [ 'WP', 'Wh-pronoun' ],
8486 		WP$ : [ 'WP$', 'Possessive wh-pronoun (prolog version WP-S)' ],
8487 		WRB : [ 'WRB', 'Wh-adverb' ],
8488 
8489 		TAGS : [ 'CC', 'CD', 'DT', 'EX', 'FW', 'IN', 'JJ', 
8490 				'JJR', 'JJS', 'LS', 'MD', 'NN', 'NNS', 'NNP', 
8491 				'NNPS', 'PDT', 'POS', 'PRP', 'PRP$', 'RB', 
8492 				'RBR', 'RBS', 'RP', 'SYM', 'TO', 
8493 				 'UH', 'VB', 'VBD', 'VBG', 'VBN', 'VBP', 'VBZ', 'WDT', 
8494 				 'WP', 'WP$', 'WRB', 'UNKNOWN' ],
8495 
8496 		NOUNS : [ 'NN', 'NNS', 'NNP', 'NNPS' ],
8497 		VERBS : [ 'VB', 'VBD', 'VBG', 'VBN', 'VBP', 'VBZ' ],
8498 		ADJ : [ 'JJ', 'JJR', 'JJS' ],
8499 		ADV : [ 'RB', 'RBR', 'RBS', 'RP' ],
8500 
8501    
8502 		isVerb : function(tag) {
8503 			
8504 			return inArray(this.VERBS, tag.toUpperCase());
8505 		},
8506 
8507 		isNoun : function(tag) {
8508 			
8509 			return inArray(this.NOUNS, tag.toUpperCase());
8510 		},
8511 
8512 		isAdverb : function(tag) {
8513 log('tag='+tag+' count='+this.TAGS.length);
8514 			return inArray(this.ADV, tag.toUpperCase());
8515 		},
8516 
8517 		isAdj : function(tag) {
8518 			return inArray(this.ADJ, tag.toUpperCase());
8519 		},
8520 
8521 		isTag : function(tag) {
8522 			return inArray(this.TAGS, tag);
8523 		},
8524 
8525 		hasTag : function(choices, tag) {
8526 			ok(choices,A);
8527 			var choiceStr = choices.join();
8528 			return (choiceStr.indexOf(tag) > -1);
8529 		},
8530 		
8531 		/**
8532 		 * Returns an array of parts-of-speech from the Penn tagset, 
8533 		 * each corresponding to one word of input
8534 		 */
8535 		tag : function(words) {
8536 			
8537 			var result = [], lex = RiLexicon._getInstance(); 
8538 			var choices2d = [];
8539 			
8540 			words = is(words,A) ?  words : [ words ];
8541 			
8542 			for (var i = 0, l = words.length; i < l; i++) {
8543 	 
8544 				if (!strOk(words[i])) {
8545 					choices2d[i] = [];
8546 					continue;
8547 				}
8548 				
8549 				var data = lex._getPosArr(words[i]);
8550 
8551 				if (undef(data) || data.length == 0) {
8552 					
8553 					if (words[i].length == 1) {
8554 						
8555 						result.push(isNum(words[i].charAt(0)) ? "cd" : words[i]);
8556 					} 
8557 					else {
8558 						
8559 						result.push("nn");
8560 					}
8561 					choices2d[i] = [];  // TODO: OK?
8562 				} 
8563 				else {
8564 					result.push(data[0]);
8565 					choices2d[i] = data;
8566 				}
8567 			}
8568 
8569 					// Adjust pos according to transformation rules
8570 			return this._applyContext(words, result, choices2d);	
8571 		},
8572 
8573 		
8574 		// Applies a customized subset of the Brill transformations
8575 		_applyContext : function(words, result, choices) {
8576 			
8577 			//log("_applyContext("+words+","+result+","+choices+")");
8578 
8579 			// Shortcuts for brevity/readability
8580 			var sW = startsWith, eW = endsWith, PRINT_CUSTOM_TAGS = (0 && !RiTa.SILENT);
8581 
8582 			// Apply transformations
8583 			for (var i = 0, l = words.length; i < l; i++) {
8584 
8585 				var firstLetter = words[i].charAt(0);
8586 
8587 				// transform 1: DT, {VBD | VBP | VB} --> DT, NN
8588 				if (i > 0 && (result[i - 1] == "dt")) {
8589 					if (sW(result[i], "vb")) {
8590 						if (PRINT_CUSTOM_TAGS) {
8591 							log("PosTagger: changing verb to noun: " + words[i]);
8592 						}
8593 						result[i] = "nn";
8594 					}
8595 
8596 					// transform 1: DT, {RB | RBR | RBS} --> DT, {JJ |
8597 					// JJR | JJS}
8598 					else if (sW(result[i], "rb")) {
8599 						if (PRINT_CUSTOM_TAGS) 
8600 							log("PosTagger: custom tagged '"+words[i]+"', "+ result[i]);
8601 						result[i] = (result[i].length > 2) ? "jj" + result[i].charAt(2) : "jj";
8602 						if (PRINT_CUSTOM_TAGS) {
8603 							log(" -> " + result[i]);
8604 						}
8605 					}
8606 				}
8607 
8608 				// transform 2: convert a noun to a number (cd) if it is
8609 				// all digits and/or a decimal "."
8610 				if (sW(result[i], "n") && choices[i] == null) {
8611 					if (isNum(words[i])) {
8612 						result[i] = "cd";
8613 					} // mods: dch (add choice check above) <---- ? >
8614 				}
8615 
8616 				// transform 3: convert a noun to a past participle if
8617 				// words[i] ends with "ed"
8618 				if (sW(result[i], "n") && eW(words[i], "ed")) {
8619 					result[i] = "vbn";
8620 				}
8621 
8622 				// transform 4: convert any type to adverb if it ends in
8623 				// "ly";
8624 				if (eW(words[i], "ly")) {
8625 					result[i] = "rb";
8626 				}
8627 
8628 				// transform 5: convert a common noun (NN or NNS) to a
8629 				// adjective if it ends with "al"
8630 				if (sW(result[i], "nn") && eW(words[i], "al")) {
8631 					result[i] = "jj";
8632 				}
8633 
8634 				// transform 6: convert a noun to a verb if the
8635 				// preceeding word is "would"
8636 				if (i > 0 && sW(result[i], "nn") && equalsIgnoreCase(words[i - 1], "would")) {
8637 					result[i] = "vb";
8638 				}
8639 
8640 				// transform 7: if a word has been categorized as a
8641 				// common noun and it ends
8642 				// with "s", then set its type to plural common noun
8643 				// (NNS)
8644 				if ((result[i] == "nn") && eW(words[i], "s")) {
8645 					result[i] = "nns";
8646 				}
8647 
8648 				// transform 8: convert a common noun to a present
8649 				// participle verb (i.e., a gerund)
8650 				if (sW(result[i], "nn") && eW(words[i], "ing")) {
8651 					// fix here -- add check on choices for any verb: eg
8652 					// 'morning'
8653 					if (this.hasTag(choices[i], "vb")) {
8654 						result[i] = "vbg";
8655 					} else if (PRINT_CUSTOM_TAGS) {
8656 						log("[RiTa] PosTagger tagged '" + words[i] + "' as " + result[i]);
8657 					}
8658 				}
8659 
8660 				// transform 9(dch): convert common nouns to proper
8661 				// nouns when they start w' a capital and are not a
8662 				// sentence start
8663 				if (i > 0 && sW(result[i], "nn") && words[i].length > 1
8664 						&& (firstLetter == firstLetter.toUpperCase())) {
8665 					result[i] = eW(result[i], "s") ? "nnps" : "nnp";
8666 				}
8667 
8668 				// transform 10(dch): convert plural nouns (which are
8669 				// also 3sg-verbs) to 3sg-verbs when followed by adverb
8670 				// (jumps, dances)
8671 				if (i < result.length - 1 && result[i] == "nns" && sW(result[i + 1], "rb")
8672 						&& this.hasTag(choices[i], "vbz")) {
8673 					result[i] = "vbz";
8674 				}
8675 			}
8676 		 
8677 			return result;
8678 		}
8679 
8680 	}// end PosTagger
8681 
8682 	/**
8683 	 * @name Stemmer
8684 	 * @class
8685 	 * @private
8686 	 */
8687 	var Stemmer = {};
8688 	
8689 	// Stemming demo/comparison - http://text-processing.com/demo/stem/
8690 	
8691 	/**  
8692 	 *  Porter stemmer in Javascript: from https://github.com/kristopolous/Porter-Stemmer
8693 	 *  Ported from Porter, 1980, An algorithm for suffix stripping, Program, Vol. 14,
8694 	 *  no. 3, pp 130-137, see also http:www.tartarus.org/~martin/PorterStemmer
8695 	 */
8696 	Stemmer.stem_Porter = (function() {
8697 		
8698 		var step2list = {
8699 				"ational" : "ate",
8700 				"tional" : "tion",
8701 				"enci" : "ence",
8702 				"anci" : "ance",
8703 				"izer" : "ize",
8704 				"bli" : "ble",
8705 				"alli" : "al",
8706 				"entli" : "ent",
8707 				"eli" : "e",
8708 				"ousli" : "ous",
8709 				"ization" : "ize",
8710 				"ation" : "ate",
8711 				"ator" : "ate",
8712 				"alism" : "al",
8713 				"iveness" : "ive",
8714 				"fulness" : "ful",
8715 				"ousness" : "ous",
8716 				"aliti" : "al",
8717 				"iviti" : "ive",
8718 				"biliti" : "ble",
8719 				"logi" : "log"
8720 			},
8721 	
8722 			step3list = {
8723 				"icate" : "ic",
8724 				"ative" : "",
8725 				"alize" : "al",
8726 				"iciti" : "ic",
8727 				"ical" : "ic",
8728 				"ful" : "",
8729 				"ness" : ""
8730 			},
8731 	
8732 			c = "[^aeiou]",          // consonant
8733 			v = "[aeiouy]",          // vowel
8734 			C = c + "[^aeiouy]*",    // consonant sequence
8735 			V = v + "[aeiou]*",      // vowel sequence
8736 	
8737 			mgr0 = "^(" + C + ")?" + V + C,               // [C]VC... is m>0
8738 			meq1 = "^(" + C + ")?" + V + C + "(" + V + ")?$",  // [C]VC[V] is m=1
8739 			mgr1 = "^(" + C + ")?" + V + C + V + C,       // [C]VCVC... is m>1
8740 			s_v = "^(" + C + ")?" + v;                   // vowel in stem
8741 	
8742 		return function (w) {
8743 			var     stem,
8744 				suffix,
8745 				firstch,
8746 				re,
8747 				re2,
8748 				re3,
8749 				re4,
8750 				origword = w;
8751 	
8752 			if (w.length < 3) { return w; }
8753 	
8754 			firstch = w.substr(0,1);
8755 			if (firstch == "y") {
8756 				w = firstch.toUpperCase() + w.substr(1);
8757 			}
8758 	
8759 			// Step 1a
8760 			re = /^(.+?)(ss|i)es$/;
8761 			re2 = /^(.+?)([^s])s$/;
8762 	
8763 			if (re.test(w)) { w = w.replace(re,"$1$2"); }
8764 			else if (re2.test(w)) { w = w.replace(re2,"$1$2"); }
8765 	
8766 			// Step 1b
8767 			re = /^(.+?)eed$/;
8768 			re2 = /^(.+?)(ed|ing)$/;
8769 			if (re.test(w)) {
8770 				var fp = re.exec(w);
8771 				re = new RegExp(mgr0);
8772 				if (re.test(fp[1])) {
8773 					re = /.$/;
8774 					w = w.replace(re,"");
8775 				}
8776 			} else if (re2.test(w)) {
8777 				var fp = re2.exec(w);
8778 				stem = fp[1];
8779 				re2 = new RegExp(s_v);
8780 				if (re2.test(stem)) {
8781 					w = stem;
8782 					re2 = /(at|bl|iz)$/;
8783 					re3 = new RegExp("([^aeiouylsz])\\1$");
8784 					re4 = new RegExp("^" + C + v + "[^aeiouwxy]$");
8785 					if (re2.test(w)) { w = w + "e"; }
8786 					else if (re3.test(w)) { re = /.$/; w = w.replace(re,""); }
8787 					else if (re4.test(w)) { w = w + "e"; }
8788 				}
8789 			}
8790 	
8791 			// Step 1c
8792 			re = /^(.+?)y$/;
8793 			if (re.test(w)) {
8794 				var fp = re.exec(w);
8795 				stem = fp[1];
8796 				re = new RegExp(s_v);
8797 				if (re.test(stem)) { w = stem + "i"; }
8798 			}
8799 	
8800 			// Step 2
8801 			re = /^(.+?)(ational|tional|enci|anci|izer|bli|alli|entli|eli|ousli|ization|ation|ator|alism|iveness|fulness|ousness|aliti|iviti|biliti|logi)$/;
8802 			if (re.test(w)) {
8803 				var fp = re.exec(w);
8804 				stem = fp[1];
8805 				suffix = fp[2];
8806 				re = new RegExp(mgr0);
8807 				if (re.test(stem)) {
8808 					w = stem + step2list[suffix];
8809 				}
8810 			}
8811 	
8812 			// Step 3
8813 			re = /^(.+?)(icate|ative|alize|iciti|ical|ful|ness)$/;
8814 			if (re.test(w)) {
8815 				var fp = re.exec(w);
8816 				stem = fp[1];
8817 				suffix = fp[2];
8818 				re = new RegExp(mgr0);
8819 				if (re.test(stem)) {
8820 					w = stem + step3list[suffix];
8821 				}
8822 			}
8823 	
8824 			// Step 4
8825 			re = /^(.+?)(al|ance|ence|er|ic|able|ible|ant|ement|ment|ent|ou|ism|ate|iti|ous|ive|ize)$/;
8826 			re2 = /^(.+?)(s|t)(ion)$/;
8827 			if (re.test(w)) {
8828 				var fp = re.exec(w);
8829 				stem = fp[1];
8830 				re = new RegExp(mgr1);
8831 				if (re.test(stem)) {
8832 					w = stem;
8833 				}
8834 			} else if (re2.test(w)) {
8835 				var fp = re2.exec(w);
8836 				stem = fp[1] + fp[2];
8837 				re2 = new RegExp(mgr1);
8838 				if (re2.test(stem)) {
8839 					w = stem;
8840 				}
8841 			}
8842 	
8843 			// Step 5
8844 			re = /^(.+?)e$/;
8845 			if (re.test(w)) {
8846 				var fp = re.exec(w);
8847 				stem = fp[1];
8848 				re = new RegExp(mgr1);
8849 				re2 = new RegExp(meq1);
8850 				re3 = new RegExp("^" + C + v + "[^aeiouwxy]$");
8851 				if (re.test(stem) || (re2.test(stem) && !(re3.test(stem)))) {
8852 					w = stem;
8853 				}
8854 			}
8855 	
8856 			re = /ll$/;
8857 			re2 = new RegExp(mgr1);
8858 			if (re.test(w) && re2.test(w)) {
8859 				re = /.$/;
8860 				w = w.replace(re,"");
8861 			}
8862 	
8863 			// and turn initial Y back to y
8864 	
8865 			if (firstch == "y") {
8866 				w = firstch.toLowerCase() + w.substr(1);
8867 			}
8868 	
8869 			return w;
8870 		}
8871 	})();
8872 
8873 	Stemmer.stem_Lancaster = (function() {
8874 		
8875 		function accept(token) {
8876 			
8877 			return (token.match(/^[aeiou]/)) ?
8878 				(token.length > 1) : (token.length > 2 && token.match(/[aeiouy]/));
8879 		}
8880 		
8881 		// take a token, look up the applicable rule and do the stem
8882 		function applyRules(token, intact) {
8883 
8884 			var section = token.substr(-1), rules = ruleTable[section], input = token;
8885 	
8886 			if (rules) {
8887 				
8888 				for (var i = 0; i < rules.length; i++) {
8889 					
8890 				 // only apply intact rules to intact tokens
8891 					if ((intact || !rules[i].intact) && token.substr(0 - rules[i].pattern.length) == rules[i].pattern) {
8892 						
8893 						// hack off only as much as the rule indicates
8894 						var result = token.substr(0, token.length - rules[i].size);
8895 	
8896 						// if the rules wants us to apply an appendage do so
8897 						if (rules[i].appendage) {
8898 							result += rules[i].appendage;
8899 						}
8900 	
8901 						if (accept(result)) {
8902 							
8903 							token = result;
8904 	
8905 							// see what the rules wants to do next
8906 							if (rules[i].continuation) {
8907 								
8908 								// this rule thinks there still might be stem left. keep at it.
8909 								// since we've applied a change we'll pass false in for intact
8910 								return applyRules(result, false);
8911 								
8912 							} else {
8913 								
8914 								// the rule thinks we're done stemming. drop out.
8915 								return result;
8916 							}
8917 						}
8918 					}
8919 				}
8920 			}
8921 			// else // warn('No stemming rules (LancasterImpl) found for: '+input);
8922 	
8923 			return token;
8924 		}
8925 	
8926 		var ruleTable = { // indexed by last character of word
8927 			
8928 			"a": [
8929 				{
8930 					"continuation": false, 
8931 					"intact": true, 
8932 					"pattern": "ia", 
8933 					"size": "2"
8934 				}, 
8935 				{
8936 					"continuation": false, 
8937 					"intact": true, 
8938 					"pattern": "a", 
8939 					"size": "1"
8940 				}
8941 			], 
8942 			"b": [

8945 					"intact": false, 
8946 					"pattern": "bb",

8948 				}

9387 				}
9388 			],

9394 					"pattern": "ies",

9396 				},

9408 				},

9411 					"intact": false, 
9412 					"pattern": "ness", 
9413 					"size": "4"
9414 				}, 
9415 				{
9416 					"continuation": false, 
9417 					"intact": false, 
9418 					"pattern": "ss", 
9419 					"size": "0"
9420 				}, 
9421 				{
9422 					"continuation": true, 
9423 					"intact": false, 
9424 					"pattern": "ous", 
9425 					"size": "3"
9426 				}, 
9427 				{
9428 					"continuation": false, 
9429 					"intact": true, 
9430 					"pattern": "us", 
9431 					"size": "2"
9432 				}, 
9433 				{
9434 					"continuation": true, 
9435 					"intact": true, 
9436 					"pattern": "s", 
9437 					"size": "1"
9438 				}, 
9439 				{
9440 					"continuation": false, 
9441 					"intact": false, 
9442 					"pattern": "s", 
9443 					"size": "0"
9444 				}
9445 			], 
9446 			"t": [
9447 				{
9448 					"appendage": "y", 
9449 					"continuation": false, 
9450 					"intact": false, 
9451 					"pattern": "plicat", 
9452 					"size": "4"
9453 				}, 
9454 				{
9455 					"continuation": true, 
9456 					"intact": false, 
9457 					"pattern": "at", 
9458 					"size": "2"
9459 				}, 
9460 				{
9461 					"continuation": true, 
9462 					"intact": false, 
9463 					"pattern": "ment", 
9464 					"size": "4"
9465 				}, 
9466 				{
9467 					"continuation": true, 
9468 					"intact": false, 
9469 					"pattern": "ent", 
9470 					"size": "3"
9471 				}, 
9472 				{
9473 					"continuation": true, 
9474 					"intact": false, 
9475 					"pattern": "ant", 
9476 					"size": "3"
9477 				}, 
9478 				{
9479 					"appendage": "b", 
9480 					"continuation": false, 
9481 					"intact": false, 
9482 					"pattern": "ript", 
9483 					"size": "2"
9484 				}, 
9485 				{
9486 					"appendage": "b", 
9487 					"continuation": false, 
9488 					"intact": false, 
9489 					"pattern": "orpt", 
9490 					"size": "2"
9491 				},

9494 					"intact": false,

9496 					"size": "1"
9497 				},

9499 					"continuation": false, 
9500 					"intact": false,

9503 				},

9616 				{
9617 					"continuation": false,

9620 					"size": "1"
9621 				}, 
9622 				{
9623 					"continuation": true, 
9624 					"intact": false, 
9625 					"pattern": "ity", 
9626 					"size": "3"
9627 				}, 
9628 				{
9629 					"continuation": true, 
9630 					"intact": false, 
9631 					"pattern": "ety", 
9632 					"size": "3"
9633 				}, 
9634 				{
9635 					"continuation": false, 
9636 					"intact": false, 
9637 					"pattern": "lty", 
9638 					"size": "2"
9639 				}, 
9640 				{
9641 					"continuation": false, 
9642 					"intact": false, 
9643 					"pattern": "istry", 
9644 					"size": "5"
9645 				}, 
9646 				{
9647 					"continuation": true, 
9648 					"intact": false, 
9649 					"pattern": "ary", 
9650 					"size": "3"
9651 				}, 
9652 				{
9653 					"continuation": true, 
9654 					"intact": false, 
9655 					"pattern": "ory", 
9656 					"size": "3"
9657 				}, 
9658 				{
9659 					"continuation": false, 
9660 					"intact": false, 
9661 					"pattern": "ify", 
9662 					"size": "3"
9663 				}, 
9664 				{
9665 					"appendage": "t", 
9666 					"continuation": true, 
9667 					"intact": false, 
9668 					"pattern": "ncy", 
9669 					"size": "2"
9670 				}, 
9671 				{
9672 					"continuation": true, 
9673 					"intact": false, 
9674 					"pattern": "acy", 
9675 					"size": "3"
9676 				}
9677 			], 
9678 			"z": [
9679 				{
9680 					"continuation": true, 
9681 					"intact": false, 
9682 					"pattern": "iz", 
9683 					"size": "2"
9684 				}, 
9685 				{
9686 					"appendage": "s", 
9687 					"continuation": false, 
9688 					"intact": false, 
9689 					"pattern": "yz", 
9690 					"size": "1"
9691 				}
9692 			]
9693 		};
9694 		
9695 		return function(token) {
9696 			
9697 			return applyRules(token.toLowerCase(), true);
9698 		}
9699 		
9700 	})();
9701 	
9702 	// TODO: remove these 
9703 	
9704 	Array.prototype._arrayContains = function (searchElement ) {
9705 		return Array.prototype.indexOf(searchElement) > -1;
9706 	} 
9707 	String.prototype._endsWith = function(suffix) {
9708 		return this.indexOf(suffix, this.length - suffix.length) !== -1;
9709 	};
9710 
9711 	/*
9712 	 * From the PlingStemmer stemmer implementation included in the Java Tools package (see http://mpii.de/yago-naga/javatools).
9713 	 */
9714 	Stemmer.stem_Pling = (function() {
9715 		
9716 		/** Words that are both singular and plural */
9717 		var categorySP = ["acoustics", "aestetics", "aquatics", "basics", "ceramics", "classics", "cosmetics", "dermatoglyphics", "dialectics", "deer", "dynamics", "esthetics", "ethics", "harmonics", "heroics", "isometrics", "mechanics", "metrics", "statistics", "optic", "people", "physics", "polemics", "propaedeutics", "pyrotechnics", "quadratics", "quarters", "statistics", "tactics", "tropics"];
9718 	
9719 		/** Words that end in "-se" in their plural forms (like "nurse" etc.) */
9720 		var categorySE_SES = ["nurses", "cruises"];
9721 	
9722 		/** Words that do not have a distinct plural form (like "atlas" etc.) */
9723 		var category00 = ["alias", "asbestos", "atlas", "barracks", "bathos", "bias", "breeches", "britches", "canvas", "chaos", "clippers", "contretemps", "corps", "cosmos", "crossroads", "diabetes", "ethos", "gallows", "gas", "graffiti", "headquarters", "herpes", "high-jinks", "innings", "jackanapes", "lens", "means", "measles", "mews", "mumps", "news", "pathos", "pincers", "pliers", "proceedings", "rabies", "rhinoceros", "sassafras", "scissors", "series", "shears", "species", "tuna"];
9724 	
9725 		/** Words that change from "-um" to "-a" (like "curriculum" etc.), listed in their plural forms */
9726 		var categoryUM_A = ["addenda", "agenda", "aquaria", "bacteria", "candelabra", "compendia", "consortia", "crania", "curricula", "data", "desiderata", "dicta", "emporia", "enconia", "errata", "extrema", "gymnasia", "honoraria", "interregna", "lustra", "maxima", "media", "memoranda", "millenia", "minima", "momenta", "optima", "ova", "phyla", "quanta", "rostra", "spectra", "specula", "stadia", "strata", "symposia", "trapezia", "ultimata", "vacua", "vela"];
9727 	
9728 		/** Words that change from "-on" to "-a" (like "phenomenon" etc.), listed in their plural forms */
9729 		var categoryON_A = ["aphelia", "asyndeta", "automata", "criteria", "hyperbata", "noumena", "organa", "perihelia", "phenomena", "prolegomena"];
9730 	
9731 		/** Words that change from "-o" to "-i" (like "libretto" etc.), listed in their plural forms */
9732 		var categoryO_I = ["alti", "bassi", "canti", "contralti", "crescendi", "libretti", "soli", "soprani", "tempi", "virtuosi"];
9733 	
9734 		/**  Words that change from "-us" to "-i" (like "fungus" etc.), listed in their plural forms		 */
9735 		var categoryUS_I = ["alumni", "bacilli", "cacti", "foci", "fungi", "genii", "hippopotami", "incubi", "nimbi", "nuclei", "nucleoli", "octopi", "radii", "stimuli", "styli", "succubi", "syllabi", "termini", "tori", "umbilici", "uteri"];
9736 	
9737 		/** Words that change from "-ix" to "-ices" (like "appendix" etc.), listed in their plural forms */
9738 		var categoryIX_ICES = ["appendices", "cervices"];
9739 	
9740 		/** Words that change from "-is" to "-es" (like "axis" etc.), listed in their plural forms, plus everybody ending in theses */
9741 		var categoryIS_ES = ["analyses", "axes", "bases", "crises", "diagnoses", "ellipses", "emphases", "neuroses", "oases", "paralyses", "synopses"];
9742 	
9743 		/** Words that change from "-oe" to "-oes" (like "toe" etc.), listed in their plural forms*/
9744 		var categoryOE_OES = ["aloes", "backhoes", "beroes", "canoes", "chigoes", "cohoes", "does", "felloes", "floes", "foes", "gumshoes", "hammertoes", "hoes", "hoopoes", "horseshoes", "leucothoes", "mahoes", "mistletoes", "oboes", "overshoes", "pahoehoes", "pekoes", "roes", "shoes", "sloes", "snowshoes", "throes", "tic-tac-toes", "tick-tack-toes", "ticktacktoes", "tiptoes", "tit-tat-toes", "toes", "toetoes", "tuckahoes", "woes"];
9745 	
9746 		/** Words that change from "-ex" to "-ices" (like "index" etc.), listed in their plural forms*/
9747 		var categoryEX_ICES = ["apices", "codices", "cortices", "indices", "latices", "murices", "pontifices", "silices", "simplices", "vertices", "vortices"];
9748 	
9749 		/** Words that change from "-u" to "-us" (like "emu" etc.), listed in their plural forms*/
9750 		var categoryU_US = ["apercus", "barbus", "cornus", "ecrus", "emus", "fondus", "gnus", "iglus", "mus", "nandus", "napus", "poilus", "quipus", "snafus", "tabus", "tamandus", "tatus", "timucus", "tiramisus", "tofus", "tutus"];
9751 	
9752 		/** Words that change from "-sse" to "-sses" (like "finesse" etc.), listed in their plural forms,plus those ending in mousse*/
9753 		var categorySSE_SSES = ["bouillabaisses", "coulisses", "crevasses", "crosses", "cuisses", "demitasses", "ecrevisses", "fesses", "finesses", "fosses", "impasses", "lacrosses", "largesses", "masses", "noblesses", "palliasses", "pelisses", "politesses", "posses", "tasses", "wrasses"];
9754 	
9755 		/** Words that change from "-che" to "-ches" (like "brioche" etc.), listed in their plural forms*/
9756 		var categoryCHE_CHES = ["adrenarches", "attaches", "avalanches", "barouches", "brioches", "caches", "caleches", "caroches", "cartouches", "cliches", "cloches", "creches", "demarches", "douches", "gouaches", "guilloches", "headaches", "heartaches", "huaraches", "menarches", "microfiches", "moustaches", "mustaches", "niches", "panaches", "panoches", "pastiches", "penuches", "pinches", "postiches", "psyches", "quiches", "schottisches", "seiches", "soutaches", "synecdoches", "thelarches", "troches"];
9757 	
9758 		/** Words that end with "-ics" and do not exist as nouns without the 's' (like "aerobics" etc.)*/
9759 		var categoryICS = ["aerobatics", "aerobics", "aerodynamics", "aeromechanics", "aeronautics", "alphanumerics", "animatronics", "apologetics", "architectonics", "astrodynamics", "astronautics", "astrophysics", "athletics", "atmospherics", "autogenics", "avionics", "ballistics", "bibliotics", "bioethics", "biometrics", "bionics", "bionomics", "biophysics", "biosystematics", "cacogenics", "calisthenics", "callisthenics", "catoptrics", "civics", "cladistics", "cryogenics", "cryonics", "cryptanalytics", "cybernetics", "cytoarchitectonics", "cytogenetics", "diagnostics", "dietetics", "dramatics", "dysgenics", "econometrics", "economics", "electromagnetics", "electronics", "electrostatics", "endodontics", "enterics", "ergonomics", "eugenics", "eurhythmics", "eurythmics", "exodontics", "fibreoptics", "futuristics", "genetics", "genomics", "geographics", "geophysics", "geopolitics", "geriatrics", "glyptics", "graphics", "gymnastics", "hermeneutics", "histrionics", "homiletics", "hydraulics", "hydrodynamics", "hydrokinetics", "hydroponics", "hydrostatics", "hygienics", "informatics", "kinematics", "kinesthetics", "kinetics", "lexicostatistics", "linguistics", "lithoglyptics", "liturgics", "logistics", "macrobiotics", "macroeconomics", "magnetics", "magnetohydrodynamics", "mathematics", "metamathematics", "metaphysics", "microeconomics", "microelectronics", "mnemonics", "morphophonemics", "neuroethics", "neurolinguistics", "nucleonics", "numismatics", "obstetrics", "onomastics", "orthodontics", "orthopaedics", "orthopedics", "orthoptics", "paediatrics", "patristics", "patristics", "pedagogics", "pediatrics", "periodontics", "pharmaceutics", "pharmacogenetics", "pharmacokinetics", "phonemics", "phonetics", "phonics", "photomechanics", "physiatrics", "pneumatics", "poetics", "politics", "pragmatics", "prosthetics", "prosthodontics", "proteomics", "proxemics", "psycholinguistics", "psychometrics", "psychonomics", "psychophysics", "psychotherapeutics", "robotics", "semantics", "semiotics", "semitropics", "sociolinguistics", "stemmatics", "strategics", "subtropics", "systematics", "tectonics", "telerobotics", "therapeutics", "thermionics", "thermodynamics", "thermostatics"];
9760 	
9761 		/** Words that change from "-ie" to "-ies" (like "auntie" etc.), listed in their plural forms*/
9762 		var categoryIE_IES = ["aeries", "anomies", "aunties", "baddies", "beanies", "birdies", "boccies", "bogies", "bolshies", "bombies", "bonhomies", "bonxies", "booboisies", "boogies", "boogie-woogies", "bookies", "booties", "bosies", "bourgeoisies", "brasseries", "brassies", "brownies", "budgies", "byrnies", "caddies", "calories", "camaraderies", "capercaillies", "capercailzies", "cassies", "catties", "causeries", "charcuteries", "chinoiseries", "collies", "commies", "cookies", "coolies", "coonties", "cooties", "corries", "coteries", "cowpies", "cowries", "cozies", "crappies", "crossties", "curies", "dachsies", "darkies", "dassies", "dearies", "dickies", "dies", "dixies", "doggies", "dogies", "dominies", "dovekies", "eyries", "faeries", "falsies", "floozies", "folies", "foodies", "freebies", "gaucheries", "gendarmeries", "genies", "ghillies", "gillies", "goalies", "goonies", "grannies", "grotesqueries", "groupies", "hankies", "hippies", "hoagies", "honkies", "hymies", "indies", "junkies", "kelpies", "kilocalories", "knobkerries", "koppies", "kylies", "laddies", "lassies", "lies", "lingeries", "magpies", "magpies", "marqueteries", "mashies", "mealies", "meanies", "menageries", "millicuries", "mollies", "facts1", "moxies", "neckties", "newbies", "nighties", "nookies", "oldies", "organdies", "panties", "parqueteries", "passementeries", "patisseries", "pies", "pinkies", "pixies", "porkpies", "potpies", "prairies", "preemies", "premies", "punkies", "pyxies", "quickies", "ramies", "reveries", "rookies", "rotisseries", "scrapies", "sharpies", "smoothies", "softies", "stoolies", "stymies", "swaggies", "sweeties", "talkies", "techies", "ties", "tooshies", "toughies", "townies", "veggies", "walkie-talkies", "wedgies", "weenies", "weirdies", "yardies", "yuppies", "zombies"];
9763 	
9764 		/** Maps irregular Germanic English plural nouns to their singular form */
9765 		var categoryIRR = ["beefs", "beef", "beeves", "beef", "brethren", "brother", "busses", "bus", "cattle", "cattlebeast", "children", "child", "corpora", "corpus", "ephemerides", "ephemeris", "firemen", "fireman", "genera", "genus", "genies", "genie", "genii", "genie", "kine", "cow", "lice", "louse", "men", "man", "mice", "mouse", "mongooses", "mongoose", "monies", "money", "mythoi", "mythos", "octopodes", "octopus", "octopuses", "octopus", "oxen", "ox", "people", "person", "soliloquies", "soliloquy", "throes", "throes", "trilbys", "trilby", "women", "woman"];
9766 	
9767 		/** Tells whether a noun is plural. */
9768 		function isPlural(s) {
9769 			return (!s === stem(s));
9770 		}
9771 	
9772 		/** Tells whether a word form is singular. Note that a word can be both plural and singular */
9773 		function isSingular(s) {
9774 			return (categorySP._arrayContains(s.toLowerCase()) || !isPlural(s));
9775 		}
9776 	
9777 		/**
9778 		 * Tells whether a word form is the singular form of one word and at
9779 		 * the same time the plural form of another.
9780 		 */
9781 		function isSingularAndPlural(s) {
9782 			return (categorySP._arrayContains(s.toLowerCase()));
9783 		}
9784 	
9785 		/** Cuts a suffix from a string (that is the number of chars given by the suffix) */
9786 		function cut(s, suffix) {
9787 			return (s.substring(0, s.length - suffix.length));
9788 		}
9789 	
9790 		/** Returns true if a word is probably not Latin */
9791 		function noLatin(s) {
9792 			return (s.indexOf('h') > 0 || s.indexOf('j') > 0 || s.indexOf('k') > 0 || s.indexOf('w') > 0 || s.indexOf('y') > 0 || s.indexOf('z') > 0 || s.indexOf("ou") > 0 || s.indexOf("sh") > 0 || s.indexOf("ch") > 0 || s._endsWith("aus"));
9793 		}
9794 	
9795 		/** Returns true if a word is probably Greek */
9796 		function greek(s) {
9797 			return (s.indexOf("ph") > 0 || s.indexOf('y') > 0 && s._endsWith("nges"));
9798 		}
9799 	
9800 		/** Stems an english noun */
9801 		function stem(s) {
9802 			
9803 			//log("PlingStem("+s+")");
9804 			
9805 			if (!strOk(s)) return E;
9806 	
9807 			// Handle irregular ones
9808 			var irreg = categoryIRR[s];
9809 			
9810 			if (irreg) return (irreg);
9811 	
9812 			// -on to -a
9813 			if (categoryON_A._arrayContains(s))
9814 				return (cut(s, "a") + "on");
9815 	
9816 			// -um to -a
9817 			if (categoryUM_A._arrayContains(s))
9818 				return (cut(s, "a") + "um");
9819 	
9820 			// -x to -ices
9821 			if (categoryIX_ICES._arrayContains(s))
9822 				return (cut(s, "ices") + "ix");
9823 	
9824 			// -o to -i
9825 			if (categoryO_I._arrayContains(s))
9826 				return (cut(s, "i") + "o");
9827 	
9828 			// -se to ses
9829 			if (categorySE_SES._arrayContains(s))
9830 				return (cut(s, "s"));
9831 	
9832 			// -is to -es
9833 			if (categoryIS_ES._arrayContains(s) || s._endsWith("theses"))
9834 				return (cut(s, "es") + "is");
9835 	
9836 			// -us to -i
9837 			if (categoryUS_I._arrayContains(s))
9838 				return (cut(s, "i") + "us");
9839 			//Wrong plural
9840 			if (s._endsWith("uses") && (categoryUS_I._arrayContains(cut(s, "uses") + "i") || s === ("genuses") || s === ("corpuses")))
9841 				return (cut(s, "es"));
9842 	
9843 			// -ex to -ices
9844 			if (categoryEX_ICES._arrayContains(s))
9845 				return (cut(s, "ices") + "ex");
9846 	
9847 			// Words that do not inflect in the plural
9848 			if (s._endsWith("ois") || s._endsWith("itis") || category00._arrayContains(s) || categoryICS._arrayContains(s))
9849 				return (s);
9850 	
9851 			// -en to -ina
9852 			// No other common words end in -ina
9853 			if (s._endsWith("ina"))
9854 				return (cut(s, "en"));
9855 	
9856 			// -a to -ae
9857 			// No other common words end in -ae
9858 			if (s._endsWith("ae"))
9859 				return (cut(s, "e"));
9860 	
9861 			// -a to -ata
9862 			// No other common words end in -ata
9863 			if (s._endsWith("ata"))
9864 				return (cut(s, "ta"));
9865 	
9866 			// trix to -trices
9867 			// No common word ends with -trice(s)
9868 			if (s._endsWith("trices"))
9869 				return (cut(s, "trices") + "trix");
9870 	
9871 			// -us to -us
9872 			//No other common word ends in -us, except for false plurals of French words
9873 			//Catch words that are not latin or known to end in -u
9874 			if (s._endsWith("us") && !s._endsWith("eaus") && !s._endsWith("ieus") && !noLatin(s) && !categoryU_US._arrayContains(s))
9875 				return (s);
9876 	
9877 			// -tooth to -teeth
9878 			// -goose to -geese
9879 			// -foot to -feet
9880 			// -zoon to -zoa
9881 			//No other common words end with the indicated suffixes
9882 			if (s._endsWith("teeth"))
9883 				return (cut(s, "teeth") + "tooth");
9884 			if (s._endsWith("geese"))
9885 				return (cut(s, "geese") + "goose");
9886 			if (s._endsWith("feet"))
9887 				return (cut(s, "feet") + "foot");
9888 			if (s._endsWith("zoa"))
9889 				return (cut(s, "zoa") + "zoon");
9890 	
9891 			// -eau to -eaux
9892 			//No other common words end in eaux
9893 			if (s._endsWith("eaux"))
9894 				return (cut(s, "x"));
9895 	
9896 			// -ieu to -ieux
9897 			//No other common words end in ieux
9898 			if (s._endsWith("ieux"))
9899 				return (cut(s, "x"));
9900 	
9901 			// -nx to -nges
9902 			// Pay attention not to kill words ending in -nge with plural -nges
9903 			// Take only Greek words (works fine, only a handfull of exceptions)
9904 			if (s._endsWith("nges") && greek(s))
9905 				return (cut(s, "nges") + "nx");
9906 	
9907 			// -[sc]h to -[sc]hes
9908 			//No other common word ends with "shes", "ches" or "she(s)"
9909 			//Quite a lot end with "che(s)", filter them out
9910 			if (s._endsWith("shes") || s._endsWith("ches") && !categoryCHE_CHES._arrayContains(s))
9911 				return (cut(s, "es"));
9912 	
9913 			// -ss to -sses
9914 			// No other common singular word ends with "sses"
9915 			// Filter out those ending in "sse(s)"
9916 			if (s._endsWith("sses") && !categorySSE_SSES._arrayContains(s) && !s._endsWith("mousses"))
9917 				return (cut(s, "es"));
9918 	
9919 			// -x to -xes
9920 			// No other common word ends with "xe(s)" except for "axe"
9921 			if (s._endsWith("xes") && !s === ("axes"))
9922 				return (cut(s, "es"));
9923 	
9924 			// -[nlw]ife to -[nlw]ives
9925 			//No other common word ends with "[nlw]ive(s)" except for olive
9926 			if (s._endsWith("nives") || s._endsWith("lives") && !s._endsWith("olives") || s._endsWith("wives"))
9927 				return (cut(s, "ves") + "fe");
9928 	
9929 			// -[aeo]lf to -ves  exceptions: valve, solve
9930 			// -[^d]eaf to -ves  exceptions: heave, weave
9931 			// -arf to -ves      no exception
9932 			if (s._endsWith("alves") && !s._endsWith("valves") || s._endsWith("olves") && !s._endsWith("solves") || s._endsWith("eaves") && !s._endsWith("heaves") && !s._endsWith("weaves") || s._endsWith("arves"))
9933 				return (cut(s, "ves") + "f");
9934 	
9935 			// -y to -ies
9936 			// -ies is very uncommon as a singular suffix
9937 			// but -ie is quite common, filter them out
9938 			if (s._endsWith("ies") && !categoryIE_IES._arrayContains(s))
9939 				return (cut(s, "ies") + "y");
9940 	
9941 			// -o to -oes
9942 			// Some words end with -oe, so don't kill the "e"
9943 			if (s._endsWith("oes") && !categoryOE_OES._arrayContains(s))
9944 				return (cut(s, "es"));
9945 	
9946 			// -s to -ses
9947 			// -z to -zes
9948 			// no words end with "-ses" or "-zes" in singular
9949 			if (s._endsWith("ses") || s._endsWith("zes"))
9950 				return (cut(s, "es"));
9951 	
9952 			// - to -s
9953 			if (s._endsWith("s") && !s._endsWith("ss") && !s._endsWith("is"))
9954 				return (cut(s, "s"));
9955 	
9956 			return (s);
9957 		}
9958 	
9959 		return function(token) {
9960 	
9961 			return stem(token.toLowerCase());
9962 		}
9963 		
9964 	})();
9965 
9966 
9967 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
9968 	//////// MinEditDist (singleton)
9969 	////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
9970 
9971 	/**
9972 	 * Minimum-Edit-Distance (or Levenshtein distance) is a measure of the similarity 
9973 	 * between two strings, the source string and the target string (t). The distance 
9974 	 * is the number of deletions, insertions, or substitutions required to transform 
9975 	 * the source into the target / avg_string_length<p> 
9976 	 * 
9977 	 * Adapted from Michael Gilleland's algorithm
9978 	 * 
9979 	 * @name MinEditDist
9980 	 * @class
9981 	 * @private
9982 	 */
9983 	var MinEditDist = {
9984 
9985 		_min3 : function(a,b,c) { 
9986 
9987 			var min = a;
9988 			if (b < min) min = b;
9989 			if (c < min) min = c;
9990 			return min;
9991 		},
9992 
9993 		/**
9994 		 * Computes min-edit-distance between 2 string arrays
9995 		 * where each array element either matches or does not
9996 		 */
9997 		_computeRawArray : function(srcArr, trgArr) { // TODO: make private to class
9998 
9999 			//log((srcArr)+" "+(trgArr));
10000 			
10001 			var matrix = []; // matrix
10002 			var sI; // ith element of s
10003 			var tJ; // jth element of t
10004 			var cost; // cost
10005 
10006 			// Step 1 ----------------------------------------------
10007 
10008 			if (srcArr.length == 0) return trgArr.length;
10009 
10010 			if (trgArr.length == 0) return srcArr.length;
10011 
10012 			//matrix = new var[srcArr.length + 1][trgArr.length + 1];
10013 
10014 			// Step 2 ----------------------------------------------
10015 
10016 			for (var i = 0; i <= srcArr.length; i++) {
10017 				matrix[i] = [];
10018 				matrix[i][0] = i;
10019 			}
10020 
10021 			for (var j = 0; j <= trgArr.length; j++)    
10022 				matrix[0][j] = j;
10023 
10024 			// Step 3 ----------------------------------------------
10025 
10026 			//String[] srcArr = RiFreeTTSEngine.cleanPhonemes(srcArr);    
10027 			for (var i = 1; i <= srcArr.length; i++)
10028 			{
10029 				sI = srcArr[i - 1];
10030 
10031 				// Step 4 --------------------------------------------
10032 
10033 				for (var j = 1; j <= trgArr.length; j++)
10034 				{
10035 					tJ = trgArr[j - 1];
10036 
10037 					// Step 5 ------------------------------------------
10038 
10039 					cost = (sI === tJ) ? 0 : 1;
10040 
10041 					// Step 6 ------------------------------------------
10042 					matrix[i][j] = this._min3 (matrix[i - 1][j] + 1, 
10043 						matrix[i][j - 1] + 1, 
10044 						matrix[i - 1][j - 1] + cost);
10045 				}
10046 			}
10047 
10048 			// Step 7 ----------------------------------------------
10049 
10050 			return matrix[srcArr.length][trgArr.length];
10051 		},
10052 
10053 		
10054 		/**
10055 		 * Compute min-edit-distance between 2 strings
10056 		 * @see MinEditDist#computeAdjusted(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
10057 		 */ 
10058 		computeRaw : function(source, target) { 
10059 
10060 			var st = Type.get(source), tt = Type.get(source);
10061 			
10062 			if (st!=tt) err('Unexpected args: '+source+"/"+target);
10063 
10064 			if (tt===A) return this._computeRawArray(source, target);
10065 			
10066 			if (!source.length && !target.length) return 0;
10067 
10068 			var matrix = []; // matrix
10069 			var sI; // ith character of s
10070 			var tJ; // jth character of t
10071 			var cost; // cost
10072 
10073 			// Step 1 ----------------------------------------------
10074 			var sourceLength = source.length;
10075 			var targetLength = target.length;
10076 
10077 			if (sourceLength == 0) return targetLength;
10078 
10079 			if (targetLength == 0) return sourceLength;
10080 
10081 			//matrix = new int[sourceLength + 1][targetLength + 1];
10082 
10083 			// Step 2 ----------------------------------------------
10084 
10085 			for (var i = 0; i <= sourceLength; i++) {
10086 				matrix[i] = [];
10087 				matrix[i][0] = i;
10088 			}
10089 
10090 			for (var j = 0; j <= targetLength; j++)   
10091 				matrix[0][j] = j;
10092 
10093 			// Step 3 ----------------------------------------------
10094 
10095 			for (var i = 1; i <= sourceLength; i++)
10096 			{
10097 
10098 				sI = source.charAt(i - 1);
10099 
10100 				// Step 4 --------------------------------------------
10101 
10102 				for (var j = 1; j <= targetLength; j++)
10103 				{
10104 					tJ = target.charAt(j - 1);
10105 
10106 					// Step 5 ------------------------------------------
10107 
10108 					cost = (sI == tJ) ? 0 : 1;
10109 
10110 					// Step 6 ------------------------------------------
10111 					matrix[i][j] = this._min3(matrix[i - 1][j] + 1, 
10112 						matrix[i][j - 1] + 1, 
10113 						matrix[i - 1][j - 1] + cost);
10114 				}
10115 			}
10116 
10117 			// Step 7 ----------------------------------------------
10118 
10119 			return matrix[sourceLength][targetLength];
10120 			
10121 		},
10122 
10123 		/**
10124 		 * Compute min-edit-distance between 2 strings (or 2 arrays of strings) 
10125 		 * divided by their average length.
10126 		 */ 
10127 		computeAdjusted : function(source, target) {
10128 
10129 			var st = Type.get(source), tt = Type.get(source);
10130 			if (st===tt) {
10131 
10132 				if (tt===S) {
10133 					if (!source.length && !target.length) return 0;
10134 					//log(this.computeRaw(source, target)+'/'+(source.length + target.length));
10135 					return this.computeRaw(source, target) / (source.length + target.length);
10136 				}
10137 				else if (tt===A) {
10138 					if (!source.length && !target.length) return 0;
10139 					//log(_computeRawArray(source, target)+'/'+(source.length + target.length));
10140 					return this._computeRawArray(source, target) / (source.length + target.length);
10141 				}
10142 			}
10143 			err('Unexpected args: '+source+"/"+target);
10144 			
10145 		}
10146 		
10147 	}
10148 
10149 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10150 	//////// RE 
10151 	////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10152 
10153 	/**
10154 	* @name RE (RegEx)
10155 	* @class
10156 	* @private
10157 	*/
10158 	var RE = makeClass();
10159 
10160 	RE.prototype = {
10161 		
10162 		init : function(regex, offset, suffix) {
10163 			
10164 			this.regex = new RegExp(regex);
10165 			this.offset = offset;
10166 			this.suffix = suffix;
10167 		},
10168 		
10169 		applies : function(word) {
10170 
10171 			return this.regex.test(trim(word));
10172 		},
10173 		
10174 		fire : function(word) {
10175 
10176 			return this.truncate(trim(word)) + this.suffix;
10177 		},
10178 		
10179 		analyze : function(word) {
10180 			
10181 			return ((this.suffix != "") && endsWith(word, this.suffix)) ? true : false;
10182 		},
10183 		
10184 		truncate : function(word) {
10185 
10186 			return (this.offset == 0) ? word : word.substr(0, word.length - this.offset);
10187 		}
10188 	}
10189 	
10190 	
10191 	
10192 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
10193 	// adapted from: https://github.com/sole/tween.js
10194 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////    
10195 	
10196 	/**
10197 	 * @private
10198 	 */
10199 	var TextBehavior = function (rt, object) {
10200 	
10201 		var _parent = rt;
10202 		var _object = object || _parent;
10203 		var _valuesStart = {};
10204 		var _valuesEnd = {};
10205 		var _duration = 1000;
10206 		var _delayTime = 0;
10207 		var _startTime = null;
10208 		var _easingFunction = Easing.Linear.None;
10209 		var _interpolationFunction = Interpolation.Linear;
10210 		var _chainedTween = null;
10211 		var _onUpdateCallback = null;
10212 		var _onCompleteCallback = null;
10213 	
10214 		this.to = function ( properties, duration ) {
10215 	
10216 			if ( duration !== null ) {
10217 	
10218 				_duration = duration;
10219 			}
10220 	
10221 			_valuesEnd = properties;
10222 			
10223 			return this;
10224 		}
10225 	
10226 		this.start = function ( time ) {
10227 	
10228 			if (_parent) 
10229 				_parent._addBehavior( this );
10230 			else
10231 				err('Unable to add tween');
10232 	
10233 			_startTime = time !== undefined ? time : Date.now();
10234 			_startTime += _delayTime;
10235 	
10236 			for ( var property in _valuesEnd ) {
10237 	
10238 				// This prevents the engine from interpolating null values
10239 				if ( _object[ property ] === null ) {
10240 					console.error('null value in interpolater for: '+property);
10241 					continue;
10242 	
10243 				}
10244 	
10245 				// check if an Array was provided as property value
10246 				if ( _valuesEnd[ property ] instanceof Array ) {
10247 	
10248 					if ( _valuesEnd[ property ].length === 0 ) {
10249 	
10250 						continue;
10251 					}
10252 	
10253 					// create a local copy of the Array with the start value at the front
10254 					_valuesEnd[ property ] = [ _object[ property ] ].concat( _valuesEnd[ property ] );
10255 				}
10256 	
10257 				_valuesStart[ property ] = _object[ property ];
10258 			}
10259 	
10260 			return this;
10261 	
10262 		}
10263 	
10264 		this.stop = function () {
10265 	
10266 			if (_parent) _parent.stopBehavior( this );
10267 			return this;
10268 	
10269 		}
10270 	
10271 		this.delay = function ( amount ) {
10272 	
10273 			_delayTime = amount;
10274 			return this;
10275 	
10276 		}
10277 	
10278 		this.easing = function ( easing ) {
10279 	
10280 			_easingFunction = easing;
10281 			return this;
10282 	
10283 		}
10284 	
10285 		this.interpolation = function ( interpolation ) {
10286 	
10287 			_interpolationFunction = interpolation;
10288 			return this;
10289 	
10290 		}
10291 	
10292 		this.chain = function ( chainedTween ) {
10293 	
10294 			_chainedTween = chainedTween;
10295 			return this;
10296 	
10297 		}
10298 	
10299 		this.onUpdate = function ( onUpdateCallback ) {
10300 	
10301 			_onUpdateCallback = onUpdateCallback;
10302 			return this;
10303 	
10304 		}
10305 	
10306 		this.onComplete = function ( onCompleteCallback ) {
10307 	
10308 			_onCompleteCallback = onCompleteCallback;
10309 			return this;
10310 	
10311 		}
10312 	
10313 		this.update = function ( time ) {
10314 	
10315 			if ( time < _startTime ) return true;
10316 	
10317 			var elapsed = ( time - _startTime ) / _duration;
10318 			elapsed = elapsed > 1 ? 1 : elapsed;
10319 	
10320 			var value = _easingFunction( elapsed );
10321 	
10322 			for ( var property in _valuesStart ) {
10323 	
10324 				var start = _valuesStart[ property ];
10325 				var end = _valuesEnd[ property ];
10326 	
10327 				if ( end instanceof Array ) {
10328 	
10329 					_object[ property ] = _interpolationFunction( end, value );
10330 	
10331 				} else {
10332 	
10333 					_object[ property ] = start + ( end - start ) * value;
10334 	
10335 				}
10336 			}
10337 	
10338 			if (_onUpdateCallback !== null ) {
10339 	
10340 				_onUpdateCallback.call( _object, value );
10341 			}
10342 	
10343 			if ( elapsed == 1 ) {
10344 	
10345 				if ( _onCompleteCallback !== null ) {
10346 	
10347 					_onCompleteCallback.call( _object );
10348 				}
10349 	
10350 				if ( _chainedTween !== null ) {
10351 	
10352 					_chainedTween.start();
10353 				}
10354 	
10355 				return false;
10356 	
10357 			}
10358 	
10359 			return true;
10360 		}
10361 	
10362 	}
10363 
10364 	/**
10365 	 * @name RiText_P5
10366 	 * @class
10367 	 * @private
10368 	 */
10369 	var RiText_P5 = makeClass();
10370 
10371 	RiText_P5.prototype = {
10372 
10373 		init : function(p) {
10374 			
10375 			this.p = p;
10376 		},
10377 		
10378 		_size : function() {
10379 			
10380 			return this.p.size.apply(this, arguments);
10381 		},
10382 		
10383 		_getGraphics : function() {
10384 			
10385 			return this.p;
10386 		},
10387 		
10388 		_pushState : function(str) {
10389 			
10390 			this.p.pushStyle();
10391 			this.p.pushMatrix();
10392 			return this;
10393 		},
10394 		
10395 		_popState : function() {
10396 			
10397 			this.p.popStyle();
10398 			this.p.popMatrix();
10399 			return this;
10400 		},
10401 
10402 		_textAlign : function(align) {
10403 			
10404 			this.p.textAlign.apply(this,arguments);
10405 			return this;
10406 		},
10407 		
10408 		_scale : function(sx, sy) {
10409 			
10410 			this.p.scale(sx, sy, 1);
10411 		},
10412 		
10413 		_translate : function(tx, ty) {
10414 			
10415 			this.p.translate(tx, ty, 0);
10416 		},
10417 		
10418 		_rotate : function(zRot) {
10419  
10420 			this.p.rotate(zRot);
10421 		},
10422 		
10423 		_text : function(str, x, y) {
10424 			
10425 			this.p.text.apply(this,arguments);
10426 		},
10427 		
10428 		_fill : function(r,g,b,a) {
10429 			
10430 			this.p.fill.apply(this,arguments);
10431 		},
10432 		
10433 		_stroke : function(r,g,b,a) {
10434 			
10435 			this.p.stroke.apply(this,arguments);
10436 		},
10437 		
10438 		_background : function(r,g,b,a) {
10439 			
10440 			this.p.background.apply(this,arguments);
10441 		},
10442 
10443 		// actual creation: only called from RiText.createDefaultFont();!
10444 		_createFont : function(fontName, fontSize, leading) { // ignores leading
10445 			
10446 			//console.log("[P5] Creating font: "+fontName+"-"+fontSize+"/"+leading);
10447 			var pfont = this.p.createFont(fontName, fontSize);                
10448 			
10449 			if (leading) pfont.leading = leading;
10450 
10451 			//console.log(pfont);
10452 			return pfont;
10453 		},
10454 
10455 		_rect : function(x,y,w,h) {
10456 			
10457 			this.p.rect.apply(this,arguments);
10458 		},
10459 		
10460 		_line : function(x1,y1,x2,y2,lw) {
10461 			
10462 			if (lw) p.strokeWeight(lw);
10463 			this.p.line.apply(this,arguments);
10464 		},
10465 		
10466 		_textFont : function(fontObj) {
10467 			
10468 			if (!is(fontObj,O)) 
10469 				err("_textFont takes object!");
10470 			this.p.textFont(fontObj, fontObj.size);
10471 		},
10472 		
10473 		_textWidth : function(fontObj, str) {
10474 			
10475 			this.p.pushStyle();
10476 			this.p.textFont(fontObj,fontObj.size); // was _textFont
10477 			var tw = this.p.textWidth(str);
10478 			this.p.popStyle();
10479 			return tw;
10480 		},
10481 		
10482 		_textHeight : function(rt) {
10483 			
10484 			return this._getBoundingBox(rt).height;
10485 		},
10486 		
10487 		_textAscent : function(rt) {
10488 			
10489 			this.p.pushStyle();
10490 			this.p.textFont(rt._font, rt._font.size);
10491 			var asc = this.p.textAscent();
10492 			this.p.popStyle();
10493 			return asc;
10494 		},
10495 		
10496 		_textDescent : function(rt) {
10497 			
10498 			this.p.pushStyle();
10499 			this.p.textFont(rt._font, rt._font.size);
10500 			var dsc = this.p.textDescent();
10501 			this.p.popStyle();
10502 			return dsc;
10503 		},
10504 
10505 		_width : function() {
10506 
10507 			return this.p.width;
10508 		},
10509 		
10510 		_height : function() {
10511 
10512 			return this.p.height;
10513 		},
10514 		
10515 		// TODO: what about scale?
10516 		_getBoundingBox : function(rt) {
10517 			
10518 			this.p.pushStyle();
10519 
10520 			var ascent  =   Math.round(this.p.textAscent()),
10521 				descent =   Math.round(this.p.textDescent()),
10522 				width   =   Math.round(this.p.textWidth(rt.text()));
10523 			
10524 			this.p.popStyle();
10525 			
10526 			return { x: 0, y: -ascent-1, width: width, height: (ascent+descent)+1 };
10527 		},
10528 		
10529 		_type : function() {
10530 			
10531 			return "Processing";
10532 		},
10533 		
10534 		toString : function() {
10535 			
10536 			return "RiText_"+this._type;
10537 		}
10538 	}
10539 	
10540 	////////////////////////////////// End Classes ///////////////////////////////////
10541 
10542 	// TODO: clean this mess up... wrap in Constants?
10543 	
10544 	var QUESTION_STARTS = ["Was", "What", "When", "Where", "How", "Which", "If", "Who", "Is", "Could", "Might", "Will", "Does", "Why", "Are" ];    
10545 	
10546 	var W_QUESTION_STARTS = ["Was", "What", "When", "Where", "How", "Which", "Why", "Who", "Will"];
10547

10549 	
10550 	var ONLY_PUNCT = /^[^0-9A-Za-z\s]*$/, RiTextCallbacksDisabled = false;
10551 	
10552 	var ALL_PUNCT = /^[-[\]{}()*+!?%&.,\\^$|#@<>|+=;:]+$/g, DeLiM = ':DeLiM:', EA = new Array();
10553

10555

10873 		PAST_TENSE_RULES = [
10874 							RE("^(reduce)$", 0, "d", 0),
