11295 	PAST_PARTICIPLE_RULESET = {
11296 		name : "PAST_PARTICIPLE",
11297 		defaultRule : RE(ANY_STEM, 0, "ed", 2),
11298 		rules : PAST_PARTICIPLE_RULES,
11299 		doubling : true
11300 	},
11301 
11302 	PRESENT_PARTICIPLE_RULESET = {
11303 		name : "ING_FORM",
11304 		defaultRule : RE(ANY_STEM, 0, "ing", 2),
11305 		rules : ING_FORM_RULES,
11306 		doubling : true
11307 	},
11308 
11309 	PAST_TENSE_RULESET = {
11310 		name : "PAST_TENSE",
11311 		defaultRule : RE(ANY_STEM, 0, "ed", 2),
11312 		rules : PAST_TENSE_RULES,
11313 		doubling : true
11314 	},
11315 
11316 	PRESENT_TENSE_RULESET = {
11317 		name : "PRESENT_TENSE",
11318 		defaultRule : RE(ANY_STEM, 0, "s", 2),
11319 		rules : PRESENT_TENSE_RULES,
11320 		doubling : false
11321 	};
11322 
11323 	//////// Utility functions ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11324 		
11325 	function isNum(n) {
11326 		
11327 	  return !isNaN(parseFloat(n)) && isFinite(n);
11328 	}
11329 	
11330 	function okeys(obj) {
11331 	
11332 		
11333 		var keys = [];  // replaces Object.keys();
11334 		for(var k in obj) keys.push(k);
11335 		return keys;
11336 	}
11337 
11338    
11339 	function dump(obj) {
11340 
11341 		var properties = "";
11342 		for ( var propertyName in obj) {
11343 
11344 			properties += propertyName + ": ";
11345 
11346 			// Check if its NOT a function
11347 			if (!(obj[propertyName] instanceof Function)) {
11348 				properties += obj.propertyName;
11349 			} else {
11350 				properties += "function()";
11351 			}
11352 			properties += ", ";
11353 		}
11354 		return properties;
11355 	}
11356 	
11357 	function asList(array) {
11358 		
11359 		var s="[";
11360 		for ( var i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
11361 			var el = array[i];
11362 			if (array[i] instanceof Array)
11363 				el = asList(array[i]);
11364 			s += el;
11365 			if (i < array.length-1) s += ", ";
11366 		}
11367 		return s+"]";
11368 	}
11369 
11370 	function undef(obj) {
11371 		
11372 		return (typeof obj === 'undefined' || obj === null);
11373 	}
11374 
11375 	function err(msg) {
11376 		
11377 		//console.log("err(msg) :: "+RiTa.SILENT);
11378 		(!RiTa.SILENT) && console && console.trace(this);
11379 		
11380 		throw Error("[RiTa] " + msg);
11381 	}
11382 	
11383 	function warn() {
11384 		
11385 		if (RiTa.SILENT || !console) return;
11386 		
11387 		for ( var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) 
11388 			console.warn(arguments[i]);
11389 	}
11390  
11391 	function log() {
11392 	
11393 		if (RiTa.SILENT || !console) return;        
11394 		
11395 		for ( var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) 
11396 			console.log(arguments[i]);
11397 	}
11398 
11399 	function strOk(str) {
11400 		
11401 		return (typeof str === S && str.length > 0);
11402 	}
11403 
11404 	function trim(str) {
11405 		
11406 		// faster version from: http://blog.stevenlevithan.com/archives/faster-trim-javascript
11407 		return str.replace(/^\s\s*/, '').replace(/\s\s*$/, ''); 
11408 		//return str.replace(/^\s*(\S*(?:\s+\S+)*)\s*$/, "$1");
11409 	}
11410 
11411 	function last(word) { // last char of string
11412 		
11413 		if (!word || !word.length) return E;
11414 		return word.charAt(word.length-1);
11415 	}
11416 
11417 	function extend(l1,l2) { // python extend
11418 		
11419 		for (var i = 0; i < l2.length; i++) {
11420 		 
11421 			l1.push(l2[i]);
11422 		}
11423 	}
11424 
11425 	function replaceAll(theText, replace, withThis) {
11426 		
11427 		return theText && is(replace, S) ?  
11428 			theText.replace(new RegExp(replace, 'g'), withThis) : theText;
11429 	}
11430 
11431 	function endsWith(str, ending) { 
11432 		
11433 		if (!is(str,S)) return false;
11434 		return str.slice(-ending.length) == ending;
11435 	}
11436 	
11437 	function startsWith(text, substr) {
11438 
11439 		if (!is(text,S)) return false;
11440 		return text.slice(0, substr.length) == substr;
11441 	}
11442 	
11443 	function equalsIgnoreCase(str1, str2) {
11444 		
11445 		return (is(str1,S) && is(str2,S)) ?
11446 			(str1.toLowerCase() === str2.toLowerCase()) : false;
11447 	}
11448 
11449 	function makeClass() { // By John Resig (MIT Licensed)
11450 
11451 		return function(args) {
11452 			
11453 			if (this instanceof arguments.callee) {
11454 
11455 				if (typeof this.init == "function") {
11456 					
11457 					this.init.apply(this, args && args.callee ? args : arguments);
11458 				}
11459 			} 
11460 			else {
11461 				return new arguments.callee(arguments);
11462 			}
11463 		};
11464 	}
11465 	
11466 	function parseColor() {
11467    
11468 		var a = arguments, len = a.length;
11469 		
11470 		var color = { r: 0, g: 0, b: 0, a: 255 };
11471 
11472 		if (!len) return color;
11473 
11474 		if (len == 1 && is(a[0],A)) {
11475 			return parseColor.apply(this, a[0]);
11476 		}
11477 	
11478 		if (len >= 3) {
11479 			color.r = a[0];
11480 			color.g = a[1];
11481 			color.b = a[2];
11482 		}
11483 		if (len == 4) {
11484 			color.a = a[3];
11485 		}
11486 		if (len <= 2) {
11487 			color.r = a[0];
11488 			color.g = a[0];
11489 			color.b = a[0];
11490 		}
11491 		if (len == 2) {
11492 			color.a = a[1];
11493 		}
11494 
11495 		return color;
11496 	}
11497 	
11498 	function addSpaces(str, num) {
11499 		
11500 		for ( var i = 0; i < num; i++)
11501 			str += " ";
11502 		return str;
11503 	}
11504 
11505 	// Arrays ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11506 	
11507 	function shuffle(oldArray) {
11508 		var newArray = oldArray.slice();
11509 		var len = newArray.length;
11510 		var i = len;
11511 		 while (i--) {
11512 			var p = parseInt(Math.random()*len);
11513 			var t = newArray[i];
11514 			newArray[i] = newArray[p];
11515 			newArray[p] = t;
11516 		}
11517 		return newArray; 
11518 	}
11519 	
11520 	// Array Remove - from John Resig (MIT Licensed)
11521 	function remove(array, from, to) {
11522 		
11523 	  // remove? only used once
11524 	  var rest = array.slice((to || from) + 1 || array.length);
11525 	  array.length = from < 0 ? array.length + from : from;
11526 	  return array.push.apply(array, rest);
11527 	}
11528  
11529 	function insert(array, item, idx) {
11530 		
11531 	  array.slice(idx,0,item);
11532 	  return array;
11533 	}
11534 	
11535 	function removeFromArray(items, element) {
11536 		
11537 		while (items.indexOf(element) !== -1) {
11538 			items.splice(items.indexOf(element), 1);
11539 		}
11540 	}
11541 	
11542 	function inArray(array, val) {
11543 		if (!array) return false;
11544 		return array.indexOf(val)>-1;
11545 	}
11546 
11547 	// ///////////////////////////// End Functions ////////////////////////////////////
11548 
11549 	var hasProcessing = (typeof Processing !== 'undefined');
11550 		//console.log('hasProcessing='+hasProcessing);
11551 	
11552 	if (hasProcessing) {
11553 
11554 		Processing.registerLibrary("RiTa", {
11555 			
11556 			//log("Processing.registerLibrary()");
11557 			p : null, 
11558 			
11559 			init : function(obj) {
11560 			  //log("Processing.registerLibrary.init: ");
11561 			},
11562 		
11563 			attach : function(p5) {
11564 				p = p5;
11565 				//log("Processing.registerLibrary.attach");
11566 				RiText.renderer = new RiText_P5(p5);
11567 			},
11568 			
11569 			detach : function(p5) {
11570 				//log("Processing.registerLibrary.detach");
11571 			}
11572 			
11573 			//exports : [] // export global function names?
11574 		})
11575 	}
11576 	else {
11577 		
11578 		if (typeof document !== 'undefined') {
11579 			var cnv = document.getElementsByTagName("canvas")[0];
11580 			try {
11581 				var context2d = cnv.getContext("2d");
11582 				RiText.renderer = new RiText_Canvas(context2d);
11583 			}
11584 			catch(e) {
11585 				//console.warn("[RiTa] No object w' name='canvas' in DOM, renderer will be unavailable");
11586 			}
11587 		}
11588 	}
11589 	
11590 	if (!RiTa.SILENT)
11591 		console && console.log("[INFO] RiTaJS.version ["+RiTa.VERSION+RiTa.PHASE+"]");
11592 	
11593 	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11594 	// Core RiTa objects (in global namespace)
11595 	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
11596 
11597 	RiTa._eval = eval;
11598 
11599 	if (window) { // for browser
11600 		
11601 		window['RiText'] = RiText;
11602 		window['RiString'] = RiString;
11603 		window['RiLexicon'] = RiLexicon;
11604 		window['RiGrammar'] = RiGrammar;
11605 		window['RiMarkov'] = RiMarkov;
11606 		window['RiTaEvent'] = RiTaEvent;
11607 		window['RiTa'] = RiTa;
11608 	}
11609 	
11610 	if (typeof module != 'undefined' && module.exports) { // for node
11611 		
11612 		//module.exports['RiText'] = RiText; // not in Node
11613 		module.exports['RiString'] = RiString;
11614 		module.exports['RiLexicon'] = RiLexicon;
11615 		module.exports['RiGrammar'] = RiGrammar;
11616 		module.exports['RiMarkov'] = RiMarkov;
11617 		module.exports['RiTaEvent'] = RiTaEvent;
11618 		module.exports['RiTa'] = RiTa;
11619 
11620 		module.vm = require("vm"); // TODO: reconsider, use deps?
11621 		module.vm && (RiTa._eval = module.vm.runInThisContext);
11622 	}
11623 	
11624 
11625 	RiTa.p5Compatible(hasProcessing); // TODO: whats the no-P5 default? false, for now
11626 
11627 })(typeof window !== 'undefined' ? window : null);
11628
